It was great to be back in New Jersey! There's too much at stake in this election to sit it out. Let's keep New Jersey moving forward by re-electing @PhilMurphyNJ and Democrats up and down the ballot. Make a plan to vote early—and get everyone you know to do the same.

Virginians delivered for me twice, and now I’m asking them to do it again by electing @TerryMcAuliffe as their next governor. Every bit of progress in Virginia is at stake in this election—and there's no time to waste. Make a plan to vote early at

Some of the most important changes often start in state legislatures. That's why I'm proud to support these candidates for the Virginia state legislature. I hope you'll join me and the @DLCC in giving them your vote.
Glad I had a chance to talk with our new champs! I really am proud of this team and their work this season.

At a time when voting rights are being rolled back, the Freedom to Vote Act would strengthen our democracy and give more Americans a voice. That’s why the Senate should do the right thing and protect what so many generations fought so hard to secure.
It was great speaking with the @MBK_Alliance Advisory Council, and hearing more about the work they’re doing to make a difference in the lives of boys and young men of color across the country.

General Colin Powell understood what was best in this country, and tried to bring his own life, career, and public statements in line with that ideal. Michelle and I will always look to him as an example of what America—and Americans—can and should be.
Congrats to our new WNBA champs, @ChicagoSky! I couldn’t be prouder of this team — they worked hard for this moment, and have made our city proud.

Today, we lost an icon with the passing of Timuel Black. Over his 102 years, Tim was many things: a veteran, historian, author, educator, civil rights leader, and humanitarian. Michelle and I send our thoughts to his family, and everyone who loved him.

I was deeply saddened to learn about the passing of General Ray Odierno after a battle with cancer. He devoted his life to serving this country, and for that I will always be grateful. Michelle and I send our thoughts to his wife Linda, and their children.

Congratulations to Maria Ressa and Dmitry Muratov. This award is a tribute to their extraordinary courage and the enduring value of fact-based journalism and freedom of expression, which is under threat in far too many places today.
And of course, I’m excited for my @WhiteSox to be back in the playoffs. It’s going to be hard to top a walk-off home run on the Field of Dreams, but if any team can do it, it’s this one. Go Sox!

It’s always good to be from Chicago, but this year is especially sweet. Congratulations to the @ChicagoSky for making it to the WNBA finals, and to the legend, @Candace_Parker, for making all of us proud. We’ll be rooting for you.

If we don’t stand up for democracy, we’ll see this type of gerrymandering happen in even more states. It’s why @DemRedistrict is fighting for #FairMaps. And it’s why the Senate must pass the Freedom to Vote Act to protect our communities from partisan gerrymandering.

And in Georgia, Republicans released a congressional map that decreases the voting power of communities of color – including African Americans in a historically Black district – and ignores how the state has changed.

In Texas, for example, Republicans recently passed a law making voting harder, especially for people of color. Now they’re advancing a new congressional map that’s tilted in their favor and doesn’t reflect the state’s growth.

Right now, state legislatures across the country are setting new boundaries for state legislative and congressional districts. And in many states, Republicans are drawing maps that allow them to hold onto power.

Our latest production from Higher Ground, Ada Twist, Scientist, is now on Netflix. Based on the book series, the show will continue the work we started at the White House Science Fair. We hope it inspires more young people to discover science and use their imagination to create.

Happy anniversary, Miche! Over the past 29 years, I've loved watching the world get to know you not just as a daughter of the South Side, but as a mother, lawyer, executive, author, First Lady, and my best friend. I can’t imagine life without you.
Happy 97th birthday, President Carter! Thank you for the extraordinary example of lifelong service that you've set for all of us.

Today, we officially broke ground on the Obama Presidential Center on the South Side of Chicago. Michelle and I can’t imagine a better investment in the city we love, and generations of young leaders who will help create change.
Michelle and I couldn't be more excited to officially break ground on the Obama Presidential Center on the South Side of Chicago. Tune in live:

Michelle and I had fun surprising some of the hardworking women from the Chicago Women of Trades. We’re grateful for the work they're doing — not only to build the Obama Presidential Center, but also to make it easier for more people to follow their example.
It was great meeting our newest class of @ObamaFoundation Scholars at @UChicago. Young leaders like them are the source of my hope, and I believe they will power a brighter future for all of us.

Chicago will always be an important place to @MichelleObama and me, which is why we're excited to celebrate the virtual groundbreaking for the Obama Presidential Center in Chicago next week. It’s been a long time coming, and we can't wait to see this project come to life.
If we want to give our children and grandchildren a brighter future, the wealthiest Americans and large corporations must pay their fair share in taxes.
The repeal of ‘Don’t Ask, Don’t Tell’ allowed these two Marines to be true to themselves while serving in our military. Listen to their story:

Ten years ago today, we repealed ‘Don’t Ask, Don’t Tell.’ Today our military is stronger and our country is safer because patriotic Americans no longer have to live a lie in order to defend the country they love.
Wishing my friend @JustinTrudeau the best in Canada’s upcoming election. Justin has been an effective leader and strong voice for democratic values, and I’m proud of the work we did together.

The Freedom to Vote Act just introduced in the Senate would strengthen our democracy by making it easier for people to vote and harder for politicians and special interests to drown out the voices of ordinary Americans. I support it, and every Senator should do the same.

Many of the refugees fleeing Afghanistan stood by America and risked everything for a chance at a better life. With the launch of   we can support our new Afghan neighbors and reaffirm our common humanity. I hope you'll join us.

Today we honor the nearly 3,000 men, women, and children who died on September 11, 2001, and the heroes who have always run towards danger to do what’s right. Let’s never forget that day, and let’s never take them for granted.

It was great speaking with @Surgeon_General Murthy and the COVID-19 Community Corps volunteers across the country who've been spending their time and energy encouraging their communities to get vaccinated. Their work is making a difference and will help us end this pandemic.

California! You’ve got a big choice to make by September 14, and everything is on the line. Your vote could be the difference between protecting our kids or putting them at risk; helping Californians recover or taking us backwards. Vote “no” on the Republican recall.

Great memories of an important day. 31 million people now have health insurance—and the peace of mind that comes with it—thanks to the Affordable Care Act. Now @POTUS is committed to making it even stronger through his Build Back Better plan.

The pandemic has devastated communities everywhere. But the young leaders in our newest class of @ObamaFoundation Scholars studying at @UChicago and @Columbia give me hope for a better future. Congratulations, Scholars!

Labor Day is about honoring folks like Maurice Harris—a devoted husband and father of five, who has spent his career working in the trades in Chicago. He'll soon help build our Obama Presidential Center. Here’s his incredible story:
This Labor Day, let’s honor all the working men and women who make this country what it is—and the American labor movement that has helped protect them, especially during this pandemic.
Michelle and I are thinking of everyone affected by Hurricane Ida, and we're grateful to the first responders doing heroic work. Here are some ways to support those in need:
May God bless the memory of those we lost, and protect those who remain in harm’s way.

Our hearts go out to the families who lost a loved one, and to everyone continuing the mission in Kabul. We’re also thinking of the families of the Afghans who died, many of whom stood by America and were willing to risk everything for a chance at a better life.

As president, nothing was more painful than grieving with the loved ones of Americans who gave their lives serving our country. As President Biden said, these service members are heroes who have been engaged in a dangerous, selfless mission to save the lives of others.

Like so many of you, Michelle and I were heartbroken to hear about the terrorist attack outside the Kabul airport that killed and wounded so many U.S. service members, as well as Afghan men, women, and children.

Yesterday, the House passed the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act that will help Americans everywhere make their voices heard. Now the Senate needs to follow the House’s lead. Call your Senators and ask them to do the right thing. Our democracy is on the line.

The Olympics may be over, but the @Paralympics are just getting started. Many of the athletes on @TeamUSA have traveled amazing journeys to reach the top of their sport, and I’ll be cheering them on. Hope you will, too.

Right now, thousands of people in Haiti are injured and even more are homeless after an earthquake hit the island on Saturday. If you’re looking for ways to make a difference, here are some organizations that are helping Haitians recover and rebuild.
Tomorrow is the last day to sign up for health insurance during this special enrollment period. Go to   and join more than two million Americans who have gotten covered over the last six months.

Congress needs to summon the same courage we saw a half century ago when the Voting Rights Act was passed and guarantee every American a voice and a vote.

The Voting Rights Act, signed into law 56 years ago today, was a monumental piece of legislation. But with the Supreme Court and state legislatures making it harder to cast a ballot, we can’t take voting rights for granted.

From the coal mines of Pennsylvania to the halls of Congress, Rich Trumka was a fierce advocate for working Americans. He loved this country, and he never missed an opportunity to remind us what we can be. Thinking of his family, friends, and federation on this difficult day.

One of the things I’ve always loved about basketball is the fact that it brings people together and empowers young people everywhere. I’m proud to join the team at @NBA_Africa and look forward to seeing the change we can create across the continent.
COVID-19 has gotten more contagious, so it’s more important than ever to get vaccinated. Vaccines are safe, and the best way to protect yourself and your loved ones. Go to   to find one near you.

Bob Moses was a hero of mine. His quiet confidence helped shape the civil rights movement, and he inspired generations of young people looking to make a difference. Michelle and I send our prayers to Janet and the rest of the Moses family.

I could not be prouder of the incredible athletes representing @TeamUSA at the Olympics. Their determination and hard work got them this far, and they’re ready to seize this moment. We'll be rooting for them all the way.

Since Bruce @springsteen and I first sat down to record our podcast Renegades: Born in the USA, folks have asked about the stories we told and the people and places that shaped us, and we’re excited for this new book to continue the conversation we started last summer.

Even when he was confined to the darkness of a jail cell, Madiba’s light shone brightly. Today, as we reflect on his legacy, I see Mandela’s spirit alive in our @ObamaFoundation leaders. I’m inspired by their service, and the work they’re doing to create the change we need now.

As Republican legislatures across the country deliberately try to make it harder to cast a ballot, we need to keep fighting to make sure every citizen has a voice and a vote. The future of our country is at stake.

John Lewis and C.T. Vivian loved this country so much that they risked their lives so that it might live up to its promise. They gave all of themselves to the cause of freedom and justice, and inspired generations to follow their example. Now it’s up to us to continue the work.

For more than nine years, DREAMers have watched courts and politicians debate whether they’ll be allowed to stay in the only country many of them have ever known. It’s long past time for Congress to act and give them the protection and certainty they deserve.

Starting today, working families are getting monthly payments of up to $300 per child thanks to @POTUS' American Rescue Plan. This is an historic step that will help families make ends meet and lift millions of children out of poverty.

With so many folks getting together with family and friends, there’s a lot to celebrate this summer. Here’s a playlist of songs I’ve been listening to lately—it's a mix of old and new, household names and emerging artists, and a whole lot in between.

While we were still in the White House, I began sharing my summer favorites—and now, it’s become a little tradition that I look forward to sharing with you all. So here's this year's offering. Hope you enjoy them as much as I did.
Three Guinness World Records and now the national spelling bee champ! Congrats, Zaila—your hard work is paying off. We’re all proud of you.

Michelle and I sat down with some terrific young people from @KidsPress to talk about We The People, our latest @Netflix series through Higher Ground. We're hoping these songs teach the next generation about how our government works and what it means to be an active citizen.

It's more urgent than ever for Congress to pass robust new voting rights legislation—now.

In the wake of the SCOTUS ruling further weakening the Voting Rights Act, take a look at how one Republican in Michigan was subjected to harsh attacks from within his own party for simply acknowledging the validity of the election results in his state.

Happy Fourth of July, and Happy Birthday, Malia! It’s been such a joy to watch you begin to make your own way in the world with poise, grace, and humor. I miss the days when you thought the fireworks were for you.

Libraries are citadels of knowledge and empathy—and they’ve played an extraordinarily important role in my life. I spoke with @SmithsonianSec Bunch about our shared love of books, A Promised Land, and the role storytelling plays in shaping our history.
Our progress on the journey to equality sometimes feels like two steps forward, one step back. But when marriage equality became the law of the land six years ago, justice arrived like a thunderbolt.
As a dad of two daughters, this movie really hit home for me. I'm glad to see it has resonated with so many people.

Congratulations to the @CripCampFilm team on their @PeabodyAwards! I could not be prouder of the disability rights activists who inspired this film, the directors who brought their story to life, and our team at Higher Ground for their hard work.

By telling her story, Natoma Canfield helped us pass the Affordable Care Act. She was an inspiration to me and so many others, which is why her letter still hangs in my office. Michelle and I send our condolences to Natoma’s family.

The Senate is preparing to take action on a bill that would strengthen our democracy, but Republican Senators are afraid to even debate it. This week, @EricHolder and I had a chance to talk with folks across the country about what’s at stake – and how we can make a difference.

I’m really proud of young men like James and Lazarus who, despite the obstacles they have faced, are raising their daughters with tremendous love and care. To all the dads out there—Happy Father’s Day.

Now that Juneteenth is a federal holiday, take a minute to learn about Opal Lee—the woman who did more than anyone to make it happen. Let’s follow her lead and try to leave our grandkids a better world than the one we came up in.

And because he extended the special enrollment period until August 15th, anyone who needs coverage can go to   and sign up.

Now we need to build on the Affordable Care Act and continue to strengthen and expand it. That’s what @POTUS Biden has done through the American Rescue Plan, giving more families the peace of mind they deserve.

The principle of universal coverage has been established, and 31 million people now have access to care through the law we passed—with millions more who can no longer be denied coverage or charged more because of a preexisting condition.
Today, the Supreme Court upheld the Affordable Care Act. Again. This ruling reaffirms what we have long known to be true: the Affordable Care Act is here to stay.

On the ninth anniversary of DACA, I’m thinking about all the brave DREAMers who have stepped forward to tell their stories. They have fueled a movement that is still working to guarantee the permanent protections they deserve. I will always be inspired by their fight.
Happy birthday, Sasha! You’ve grown so much, and it’s been a joy to watch you become the person we always hoped you’d be. Your mom and I can’t wait to see where life takes you next.

It's always great catching up with @POTUS, and I'm grateful for everything he and his administration have done to protect and expand the Affordable Care Act. Let's keep working until every American has access to quality, affordable health care.

On National Gun Violence Awareness Day, we #wearorange to honor those we’ve lost. As we begin to emerge from the pandemic, let’s not forget the other epidemic killing far too many Americans—and keep working to pass commonsense gun safety laws that will protect our communities.

Coaches like Ernest Radcliffe are changing lives every single day. They understand how sports can help us build relationships, communicate better, and learn how to get back up when life knocks us down. Thanks for letting me stop by practice, Coach!

Yesterday, I sat down with some of the Obama Presidential Center’s neighbors—local business owners who help hold the South Side of Chicago together. We talked about how the @ObamaFoundation can catalyze more inclusive economic development and their hopes for the future.

Michelle and I are excited to share our latest show from Higher Ground: We The People. Some of our favorite artists got together with amazing animators to remix civics—and the result is a lot better than what we had in school. Check it out on @Netflix this July 4.

It’s great to be back in my hometown and even better to spend some time with talented young people in Jackson Park. I’m proud of the Wolfpack for a terrific season, and for their leadership off the field as well. Thanks for letting me give a guest pep talk!

.@brhodes has been a close advisor and a good friend for more than a decade. His new book, After the Fall, is a personal, timely look at how America has shaped the world we live in—for better and worse—and the importance of continuing to lead by example. It's a great read!

On the 100th anniversary of the Tulsa Race Massacre, we remember all those who were killed and the survivors who bravely continue to share their stories so that we never forget this painful part of our history. Take a moment to learn about what happened:
This Memorial Day, let’s remember the men and women who sacrificed everything for the people they served with and the country they loved. We owe them all an enormous debt of gratitude.

At today’s @MBK_Alliance Leadership Forum, we’re talking about the amazing levels of activism we’ve seen since George Floyd was killed—and the need to reimagine policing and public safety. Join us live.

At a time when so much of the debate around vaccinations and other public health measures has been politicized, this article offers a useful reminder of the role of modern science in fundamentally transforming all of our lives.

When injustice runs deep, progress takes time. But if we can turn words into action and action into meaningful reform, we will, in the words of James Baldwin, “cease fleeing from reality and begin to change it.”

So much is at stake in Virginia, including the constitutional right to access abortion. As governor, @TerryMcAuliffe will fight to defend that right.

NYC is home to some of the largest pensions in the country. If other cities & states join,we’re talking major shifts for climate. And it’s not only pensions. Univ endowments can divest, too. Want to help? Ask your school or pension to divest from fossil fuels & into climate

That’s where workers come in to spark change. By demanding their retirements be divested of fossil fuels, workers and voters are precipitating large shifts of $ out of big oil, gas,etc. That amps up pressure & leaves companies like Exxon w/ fewer places to get fossil fuel money.

I sit on the Financial Services Cmte & often see how Wall St leverages risky &/or unpopular investments onto public pensions, taking bets and setting up workers to hold the bag. As fossil fuels sink in popularity, pension funds have been an important source for fossil fuel $.

Pension funds are massive pools of money that fund retirement for teachers, city workers, and other public employees. These funds invest throughout our economy, & the sheer size of pension plans in the US economy (~$5.5 trillion according to @PensionDialog) make them powerful.

Actually good, major climate news: today New York City is announcing its public pensions are fully divesting out of the fossil fuel industry and into renewables & climate - a massive shift of about $50 billion.   This move is led by NYC workers. Here’s why this is a big deal.⤵️

This issue is bigger than ideology. It is a moral imperative for humanity and our planet’s future to reduce and eventually eliminate emissions. There are many ways to do it, but we can’t afford to give up. Biden admin is already backing too many pipelines - we need clean energy.

The math we need to do is not just dollars and cents, but emissions reductions + projections. Any negotiations on climate need to ensure that we will come out climate positive. And that emissions math cannot be informed by fossil fuel lobbyists, who don’t even count methane.

We cannot advance legislation that makes the climate crisis worse. The Exxon-designed “bipartisan” infrastructure plan worsens emissions, but pairing it w/clean energy in Build Back Better neutralizes BIF’s harm and lets us tackle the climate crisis. We cannot afford to gut it.

This means there are likely a LOT more poor people in the US than we admit. Policymakers know this, so they try to compensate by drafting some federal policies at 150% of the fed poverty line, etc. But when the measure is SO nonsensical, even 150% of pov line has little basis

Additionally, changes to a topline number isn’t necessarily shorthand for a conservative or progressive policy either. Ex: There’s a world where a bigger number over longer time could be a conservative win, or a smaller number over shorter time could be a progressive win.Or not!

& I suspect it may also be why you see media reflexively centering coverage of these bills on a number instead of what’s actually in them. The thing is, 1 number doesn’t tell you anything. It doesn’t help you as a normal person understand at ALL how your life could improve.

How many people need to die, how many people need to get unnecessarily sicker, how many people will needlessly suffer before the Congress will summon the courage to finally take on the greed of the pharmaceutical industry?

Let me tell you what a dysfunctional health care system is all about. In our country today, nearly 1 out of every 4 Americans cannot afford the medications that their doctors prescribe. How insane is that?!
It is not the case anywhere else on the planet, but uniquely, here in America, the pharmaceutical industry can raise prices at any time they want, and to any price they want. UNACCEPTABLE!
Now is the time for Congress to finally have the courage to take on the pharmaceutical industry. They cannot continue to charge us the highest prices in the world for prescription drugs.

Why is it that the pharmaceutical industry is able to charge the American people the highest prices on the planet for prescription drugs? Because their greed goes unchallenged in Washington, D.C. I say we put an end to that. Join me tonight for a live address.

Raising the minimum wage. Paid leave. Equal pay. This is the progress made under the leadership of @PhilMurphyNJ, and this Thursday, we'll rally to get out the vote at Rutgers University. I hope you can join us.

Days of paid leave offered to new moms around the world:   : 182   : 152   : 126   : 119   : 112   : 112   : 112   : 98   : 98   : 91   : 90   : 84   : 0 It's time we end that international embarrassment and finally guarantee paid family and medical leave in this country.

You know, I don't recall seeing Big Pharma and their lobbyists on the ballot in 2020, yet in Washington today, they are calling the shots. That has got to end. The American people want us to lower prescription drug prices. I say we listen to the people and get it done.

Cost for one vial of Humalog insulin in 2009: $93 Cost for the same vial of insulin in 2021: $297 As long as the greed of the pharmaceutical industry continues to go unchecked, they can charge YOU, the American people, whatever price they want! Enough. Time to end their greed.

LIVE: We are working to pass the most consequential legislation for the working class in decades. Tune in NOW to find out how policies in the reconciliation bill will meet your needs and what we must do to get it done.

I find it absurd that while billionaires in this country have gotten 70% richer since the start of the pandemic, working families are living paycheck to paycheck, struggling to afford their prescriptions, struggling to afford childcare. We must invest in the working class.

What is the worst that would happen if we showed working people that their government can deliver for them, and not just those at the top? It would show working people that DEMOCRACY WORKS! A democracy which delivers for its people, the worst nightmare of the ruling class.

TONIGHT: Polls show a majority of the American people support the policies in our reconciliation bill, but too many don't know they're actually in the bill! Tonight, @AOC, @RevDrBarber, @MaryKayHenry, @VarshPrakash, and @alaw202 join me to discuss. I hope you'll join us.
The company should instead come to the table and negotiate a fair contract.

John Deere's profits have exploded by some 67%, but workers who spent years with the company are now being forced off their insurance. That is beyond outrageous. John Deere is a hugely profitable company, and workers must be allowed to keep their health care during the strike.

TOMORROW: The corporate media has done a pretty poor job covering the reconciliation legislation, which has left a lot of working people asking, 'What's in the damn bill?' Join me, @AOC, @RevDrBarber, @MaryKayHenry, @VarshPrakash, and @alaw202 tomorrow for a panel discussion.

The ruling class of this country is absolutely terrified that we just might show the working class what it looks like when the United States government delivers for someone who is not a billionaire or a corporation.

In Washington, Republicans don't think twice about huge tax cuts for billionaires. But when you start talking about doing anything at all to make life easier for working people? Forget it. Republicans love socialism for the rich, rugged individualism for the rest of us.
The richest country in the world can afford to invest in the needs of working people.

Am I worried about the wishes of the more than 600 billionaires in America today? No, not for a minute. I am worried about a working class who has been neglected by their government for decades, who is working longer hours for less pay. That's who I'm worried about.

It is the working class of America that makes this country move. Not Wall Street stockbrokers. Not real estate speculators. Not hedge fund managers. Not billionaires. Not CEOs taking exorbitant compensation packages while cutting the benefits of workers. Workers have the power.

In Congress, we have a very simple choice to make. Do we listen to 1,500 pharmaceutical industry lobbyists telling us to let them continue to rip off the American people, or do we listen to tens of millions of Americans who tell us we should lower drug prices in this country?
It is obscene that no member of the Sackler family, which profited for years from the sale of OxyContin and at the expense of the suffering of millions, has faced criminal charges for their actions.

NEWSFLASH: The overwhelming majority of the American people are with us. They want us to lower prescription drug costs. They want the wealthy to pay their fair share. We cannot let Big Pharma's lobbyists and the millions of dollars of dishonest ads from the ruling class stop us.

When poll after poll tells us that the American people overwhelmingly support our efforts to dramatically lower the cost of prescription drugs in this country, what should we do? Easy answer: we summon the courage in the Congress to stand up to Big Pharma and end their greed.

column1: Profits at John Deere have skyrocketed by some 61% in recent years, while its CEO's salary has exploded by 160% since the start of the pandemic. Please do not tell me they cannot afford to pay their workers fairly. I am proud to stand in solidarity with @UAW members on strike.

Kellogg's made record-breaking profits and pays its CEO $12 million in compensation, but they want to slash pay and benefits for the workers who make the products. Enough is enough. I stand in solidarity with @BCTGM workers on strike for a fair contract and reasonable hours.
Solidarity forever.

Working class people in America have waited for decades while their needs were neglected by their government. I will not ask working parents, the children, seniors, the sick, and the poor to continue to wait just to satisfy the wants of a handful of billionaires and corporations.

And one out of four Americans can't afford to fill the prescriptions their doctor has prescribed them. Let's tax Mr. Musk and Mr. Bezos so that they finally pay their fair share of taxes, and invest that money into the many, many long-neglected needs of working class Americans.

No, I do not think it's acceptable for a new mom in Detroit to be guaranteed ZERO days of paid leave to spend with her newborn, while just over the border in Canada, new moms are guaranteed 119 days. If Canada can guarantee paid leave to its people, why can't we?
.@IATSE members are the working class backbone of TV programs and films. The Alliance of Motion Picture and Television Producers should negotiate a fair contract with these workers.

column1: When you've got the support of the majority of the American people, the Democratic House and Senate caucus, and when you've got the support of the president — this is not some 50-50 deal. Two people cannot stand in the way of delivering for the working people of this country.

The pharmaceutical industry is spending millions and millions of dollars on misleading ads, swarming Capitol Hill with their lobbyists to convince lawmakers that it's a-okay for you to continue to pay the highest prices on earth for your prescriptions — NO MORE.

I get a little tired of Republicans telling me and telling you that we can't afford it" when we talk about investing in the needs of working class people. You ever hear those people say we "can't afford it" when it comes to giving a billionaire another tax break? OF COURSE NOT!"

We have the real possibility of creating unprecedented public policy which stands up for working families, the elderly, the children, the sick, and the poor — and defeats the greed of powerful special interests and the billionaire class — but only if we fight for it.

For a very long time, American exceptionalism has meant being the only major country not to guarantee a single day of paid family and medical leave. I believe it's time we change our national priorities and guarantee paid leave to our people.

The vast majority of the American people want us to: - substantially lower prescription drug costs - expand Medicare to cover dental, vision, and hearing - expand home health care - make child care affordable - lead the world in the fight against climate change Let's get it done.

There's a big disconnect between the corporate media and working people. Across America, people work 50-60 hours a week, can't afford child care, have no health care, and they turn on the TV and the media says 'everything is great!' because corporations are making record profits.

Look, the Republican Party has already been bought and paid for — they are not going to do anything to help working people. We know this. But I hope very much and I expect that the Democratic caucus will stand firm and will fight for the working class of this country.

Now is the time — FINALLY — for Congress to have the guts to stand up for the working families and finally have the courage to take on the big money interests and wealthy campaign contributors who have so much power over the economic and political life of our country.

Covid-19 has now killed more than 700,000 people in the United States – a shocking death toll. Please get vaccinated. It will save your life. Do it for your loved ones and your neighbors. We can beat this pandemic, but we can only do it together.

What if — and stick with me for a minute, because this is a pretty far out concept to some of my Republican colleagues in Washington — what if we built a government that delivered for working class people, and not just corporations and the billionaire class?

Republicans just L-O-V-E-D reconciliation when it was used to give some $2 trillion in tax breaks for billionaires — that was fine! But now that we want to use reconciliation to address the long-neglected needs of working people, SUDDENLY, the sky is falling! Give me a break.

Let me let you all in on a little secret. You ready? The federal government is capable of standing up to powerful special interests and fighting for the needs of working class people. The billionaire class does not want it to happen. TOO BAD. We're going to get it done.

Let me be as clear as I can be. The budget reconciliation bill is PAID FOR. How will that happen? We will finally end the days of tax loopholes and evasions by the billionaire class of this country. Yes, they will finally pay their fair share of taxes.

What 95% of the Democratic caucus wants and more importantly, what the American people want, is TWO pieces of legislation which yes, will not only rebuild our physical infrastructure, but will finally invest in the long-neglected needs of our country's working class. Let's do it.

Now is the time, finally, for Congress to stand up for working families and have the courage to take on the big money interests and wealthy campaign contributors who have so much power over the economic and political life of our country.

When the planet gets hotter, with unprecedented forest fires, drought, floods, extreme weather, and acidification of the oceans, when scientists tell us that we only have a few years to avoid irreparable harm to our planet, should we really continue to ignore this global crisis?
Should we continue to have 600,000 Americans remain homeless, or should we finally begin building the millions of units of low income and affordable housing that we need?
Should we, as an aging society, force older and disabled Americans into expensive nursing home care or should we expand home health care and allow them the opportunity to stay in their own homes?
Should we continue being the only major country on earth not to guarantee paid family and medical leave?

Should we continue a situation where many millions of seniors are unable to afford to go to a dentist to get treatment for their rotting teeth, or buy the hearing aids and eye glasses they need — or should we expand Medicare to cover those basic health care needs?
Should we continue allowing the pharmaceutical industry to charge us, by far, the highest prices in the world for prescription drugs?
Should we deny low and moderate income young people the opportunity to get the higher education and job skills they need by making community colleges tuition-free?

Should we continue to ignore the dysfunctionality of our child care system which forces millions of working families to spend 20-30% of their limited incomes on childcare and keeps over a million women out of the workforce?
Should we end the $300 direct payments to working class parents which have cut childhood poverty in our country by half?

For whatever reason, there are pundits out there who say we should compromise even more and cut back on addressing the long-neglected problems facing working families as well as climate change. REALLY? Please tell me where we should cut.

No infrastructure bill should pass without a $3.5 trillion reconciliation bill. That is the agreement that was made & that is the agreement that must be kept. Physical infrastructure is important, but the needs of working families & combatting climate change is more important.

Aging in America ought to mean aging with dignity. And right now, aging with dignity is very, very difficult for far too many of our elderly people. Let us realize the original goal and vision of Medicare and expand it to include dental, vision, and hearing care.

18 million people in this country have reported being unable to fill a prescription because they couldn't afford the cost. Please do not tell me we do not need to take on the greed of the pharmaceutical industry and dramatically lower the cost of prescription drugs.

The Chicago PD reported it as a raid but analysis showed all gunshots were directed at Fred Hampton's bed. Let us channel his revolutionary spirit as we continue the fight for racial justice and equality. #FredHampton
Then in 1969, the FBI got informant William O'Neal to infiltrate his chapter. O'Neal gave them Fred Hampton's exact location while he slept for a measly $300.

At 20, Fred Hampton wanted to uplift communities. Inspired by the community success of the Black Panthers in California, he started a chapter in his hometown of Chicago, organized a Rainbow Coalition to reduce violence, fed poor communities, & pushed Community Control Of Police.

Chairman Fred Hampton (August 30, 1948 - December 4, 1969) would have been 73 years old today. He was assassinated by the FBI and Chicago PD when he was only 21 years old.  #BlackLivesMatter #EndCapitalism #HappyBirthday

*And* in which disease eradication is already acknowledged to be impossible. The notion that we are going to vaxx all kids to kill covid, which is already endemic, is rather extraordinary.

This is also coming from someone who is quite pro-mass vaccination for MMR, DTap, etc. That's because those are CHILDHOOD diseases. It's not about achieving herd immunity for an entire population in which the risk is largely relegated to the elderly.

Again, this is coming from parents (me and my wife) who will get their children the flu vaccine. But flu is more dangerous to kids than covid, and flu vaccines have more data than covid vaccines. So this isn't about being anti-vaxx." It's about being pro-risk assessment."

The logic that we *must* vaxx kids so grandparents don't get sick also has no limiting principle. Kids are sick *all* the time. If you have immunocompromised grandparents, you're taking extra precautions anyway. If you choose to vaxx, your choice. But it must be a choice.
Furthermore, the notion that we should both mask and vaxx kids, as Rochelle Walensky is now suggesting, is fully insane. There is no limiting principle here.

The risk from serious covid problems for young children is very low. It might be right for your kids -- maybe with one dose, as @MartyMakary suggests -- but it might not. This is not clear-cut like being 75+. I greatly fear that the mandate push will extend to this age group.

column1: Last night, the Supreme Court officially overturned five decades of settled law and permitted Texas' unconstitutional abortion ban to stand.  Yes: They gutted Roe v. Wade without hearing arguments, in a one-paragraph, unsigned 5-4 opinion issued in the middle of the night.

Today I’d like to thank first responders everywhere. These men and women are the first to arrive and take action at the scene of a disaster – putting their lives on the line for the safety of others. I commend their bravery and willingness to serve. #NationalFirstRespondersDay

Afterschool programs keep kids safe, inspire them to learn and grow, and give parents peace of mind. Proud to see communities across Alabama celebrating these programs with @ALACNAlabama. #LightsOnAfterschool

Last week, Alabama received a total of $2.35 million in Distance, Learning & Telemedicine grants from @USDA. These investments will help increase access to quality healthcare and educational services. Great news for rural areas throughout the state.

The Biden administration’s misguided plan to let the IRS monitor law-abiding citizens’ private financial information is dangerous and invasive, and will have far-reaching, adverse consequences. This should concern all Americans who value their privacy.

I am honored to receive the Dredging Contractors of America’s distinguished Lifetime Achievement Award. Throughout my tenure in Congress, I have worked to improve maritime infrastructure and prioritize #dredging needs, creating the conditions for a more robust maritime industry.
A trailblazer on his own accord, General Powell served our nation with integrity, courage, and devotion. He will never be forgotten.

My thoughts and prayers are with the family and friends of Colin Powell, the four-star Army General and former Secretary of State, Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, and National Security Advisor. The entire nation mourns the loss of this statesman.

For over two centuries, America's Navy has worked diligently day in and day out to protect our nation's interests at home and at sea. I am proud to recognize their service, sacrifice, and unwavering commitment. Happy 246th birthday, @USNavy!

Happy #NationalFarmersDay to the hard-working men and women who devote their lives to feeding and fueling the world. Alabama's farmers are indispensable to our state's economy, and I am grateful for their dedication, grit, and resilient nature. Thank you, farmers!

Congratulations to @Austal_USA on the $145M @USNavy contract to build steel towing & salvage ships. This speaks volumes about Alabama’s premier workforce & dedication to improving our defense forces through innovative shipbuilding. Great news for Alabama!

We’ve been fortunate to benefit from Dr. Collins’ leadership, particularly during a time when smart, sensible public health policies are critical to our success. I thank Dr. Collins for his incredible influence and wisdom. He will certainly be missed.

Dr. Francis Collins is the most impactful and respected @NIHDirector our nation has ever seen. Having devoted nearly three decades to NIH, his investment in medical research and close partnership with research universities have resulted in a host of advanced medical capabilities.

Today I attended a ribbon cutting ceremony for @LockheedMartin’s new Hypersonic Missile Assembly Building located in Courtland, #Alabama. This world-class production facility will help advance our nation’s defense capabilities and further develop AL's national security footprint.

I joined @SenJohnThune & colleagues in opposing Biden’s proposal to require financial institutions to report confidential information to the IRS - compromising American taxpayers' privacy & unnecessarily burdening financial institutions across the nation.
Our CR, S.2789, keeps the government open, provides much needed disaster assistance to storm-ravaged areas of our country, and delivers the aid necessary to address the Afghanistan withdrawal crisis.

Just now, I spoke on the Senate floor to urge my Democratic colleagues to take up and pass a bipartisan CR package. @LeaderMcConnell & I introduced a clean CR that was negotiated on a bipartisan, bicameral basis and has support on both sides of the aisle.

Importantly, our bill includes funding for the Iron Dome, making good on our commitment to a historic & significant ally, and it removes Dems’ ill-conceived language on the debt limit. Members on both sides of the aisle can support this measure, & I urge them to do so with haste.

.@LeaderMcConnell and I have introduced a CR package that would extend government funding, provide much-needed disaster relief, and deliver targeted Afghan assistance – tackling our most urgent priorities.

Five Alabama schools have been awarded a @NatlBlueRibbon, @usedgov's highest honor – Brewton Elementary, Hall-Kent Elementary, MacMillan International Academy, Mt. Laurel Elementary, and Orange Beach Elementary. I applaud their commitment to excellence!
Local communities will be directly impacted by this airport grant funding, which will help improve the quality of life for residents, increase tourism, and drive development.

I am proud that the @USDOT is granting $4.3M in FAA funding to enhance the development of our airport infrastructure. These grants are important investments in the safety, efficiency, and expansion of large and small airports around our state. @FAANews

Two high school students will be chosen to represent #Alabama in this prestigious program. Each delegate will hear major policy addresses, participate in high-profile meetings, and receive a $10K scholarship for undergraduate studies. The deadline to apply is September 30, 2021.

The U.S. @SenateYouth Program plans to return to DC for their 60th Annual Washington Week in early March. This is an invaluable learning opportunity for young Alabamians to gain a greater understanding of their national government. Click here to apply:

ICYMI: Mountain Brook's very own, Jane Grey Battle, earned a spot on the 2021-22 USA Debate Team! The young competitor is the first Alabamian in history to qualify for the team. I’m confident that she will represent our state well as she competes internationally.
May we remember and honor the innocent lives taken, and may September 11th forever serve as a testament to the courage and resilience of the American people. #NeverForget

Their sacrifice is a reminder that our freedoms and liberties must not be taken for granted. Twenty years later, our nation is stronger and more grounded in the American values and principles under attack that dreadful day.

I remember the chaos that ensued that day in our nation’s Capitol, and the tragedy that engulfed the entire country as a result of the barbaric acts of terrorists. Thousands of heroes paid the ultimate price.
Today marks 20 years since our country fell under attack on September 11, 2001 — a day that changed the course of our nation’s history. #NeverForget

The Tennessee Valley Authority's #STEM Classroom Grant Program is back and accepting applications through October 18. This is an excellent opportunity for K-12 schools within the Tennessee Valley region. Visit the @TVAnews link below for further information and to apply.
Happy #LaborDay, a day in which we celebrate the strength and resilience of America’s workforce. My wife, Annette, and I hope everyone is staying safe and enjoying the long weekend.

Alabama’s own Dr. Clayton Yates of @TuskegeeUniv has been featured by @theNCI, where they highlighted his impressive and ambitious cancer research journey. Dr. Yates has committed his life to cancer disparities research and achieving health equity.
Please be safe, cautious, and prepared as Hurricane Ida approaches the Gulf Coast.

Good news for #GulfCoast anglers: @UofSouthAlabama & @AuburnU will participate in the Greater Amberjack Abundance Study & receive grant funding. AL scientists & researchers are leaders in reef fish mgmt & I'm confident that the project will be successful due to their involvement.

Deeply saddened by the attacks today in Kabul and the many U.S. servicemembers killed while heroically working to protect our citizens and allies. Praying for their families and loved ones during this time of tragedy, and for the safety of our forces still on the ground in Kabul.

The @US_EDA has granted the @UofSouthAlabama $644K to renovate it’s Laboratory for Additive Manufacturing and provide further resources for a well-trained workforce. This is excellent news for the future of cyber manufacturing in Alabama!

The situation in Afghanistan is a complete disaster. After 20 years and billions of dollars in training and support for the Afghan army, we need to seriously scrutinize why the Afghan military fell apart so quickly. The world is watching.

Congratulations to HMMA on their most recent milestone of producing 5 million vehicles out of #Montgomery, Alabama! This is excellent news and a strong indicator of our state's success in the automotive industry. I look forward to seeing what they will accomplish next. #MadeinAL

This is a significant step in our work to bring a long-awaited, new federal courthouse to Huntsville — a priority of mine for years. In 2018, I worked to secure $110M in funding for this project. I look forward to the lasting impact it will have in North Alabama & its completion.

Dems are all too willing to neglect our defense infrastructure needs while spending hand over fist on their liberal wish list. This reflexive neglect for our national security & the millions of jobs that support it is reckless. It must stop. I hope my colleagues support my amdt.

Will my Democratic colleagues now support this multi-trillion dollar social spending binge while continuing to turn a blind eye to the military infrastructure needs in their own states? I certainly hope not.
My Democratic colleagues inexplicably blocked a vote on a related defense infrastructure amendment in the infrastructure bill that just passed the Senate. Now it’s time to stand and be counted.

We're responsible for providing our Armed Forces what they need to protect us. My amdt helps accomplish that. We’re talking about supporting projects in Alabama, Arizona, Georgia, Virginia, Rhode Island, Connecticut, Maine, California, Hawaii, Maryland, Nevada, New Mexico & more.

We need to modernize shipyards, test ranges, depots, & ammunition plants; install 5G technology at military bases; support our nuclear defense infrastructure; & so much more. These infrastructure projects are absolutely critical to our national security & impact millions of jobs.

The Senate is now voting on my defense infrastructure amendment to Democrats’ so-called budget proposal. This amendment, which I introduced with @JimInhofe and @SenatorWicker, provides $50.2 billion to meet defense infrastructure needs across this nation.
If Senate Democrats continue to prioritize a reckless social spending spree and ignore the needs of our Armed Forces, the future of this country will be in jeopardy.

Supporting trillions of taxpayer dollars for other infrastructure & social programs without investing in our national defense is shameful & inexcusable. We are responsible for providing our men & women in uniform what they need to protect us, and this amdt helps accomplish that.
Democrats are all too willing to neglect our defense infrastructure needs while spending hand over fist on their liberal wish list. This so-called budget proposal is yet another example of that.

I supported @SenToomey cryptocurrency amdt. I know of its importance to innovation & job creation, but I believe it pales in comparison to the security of our nation–which is why I called for a vote on my defense infrastructure amdt. It's unfortunate that Dems blocked both amdts.
For America to remain strong and prosperous, we must balance funding for the domestic and defense priorities of this nation.
There is a clear and dangerous pattern here. The recklessness of the Democrats’ domestic spending spree is matched only by their neglect for America’s military. It must stop.

This comes on the heels of legislation they claim will combat Chinese aggression but also includes nothing for our military. And now the Democrats are turning to a $3.5 trillion budget that will finance their liberal wish list but drastically shortchange our military once again.

It is shameful that this massive infrastructure legislation contains not one dime for our military’s vast infrastructure needs. Not only that, Senate Democrats blocked every attempt to fix this glaring omission.

Today @JimInhofe, @SenatorWicker, & I highlighted our concerns with the lack of resources for military infrastructure in the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act. Our nation’s defense infrastructure needs were ignored in this massive infrastructure bill.
I would hope that this would not interfere with our work to grow the Port of Mobile and transform Mobile into one of the top multi-modal transit hubs in the United States.

STB’s recent decision calls for further consideration of new passenger rail service on the Gulf Coast. I continue to believe the forthcoming decision should be guided by data, including studies on the service’s impact on economic development & jobs in & around the Port of Mobile.

Sending condolences to the family, friends, & colleagues of Snr. Officer George Gonzalez who lost his life in the line of duty on Tuesday. Officer Gonzalez served in the @PFPAOfficial for the past three years, and before that overseas in Iraq. His sacrifice will not be forgotten.

Today we celebrate 231 years of the @USCG! The men and women of the Coast Guard play a large role in defending and protecting Alabama's shores and beyond. I am grateful for their dedicated service and commitment to our safety. #SemperParatus #AlwaysReady

Today, my colleagues and I on the Appropriations Committee advanced three important bills that contain funding for #Alabama priorities, including resources for water infrastructure projects, farmers in rural communities, and assistance for our veterans.

.@NSF has awarded @AuburnU $10M to lead the Southeastern region in a collaborative research project to increase the number of disabled students who complete STEM degrees and enter the respective workforce. This is a national initiative, and I am proud to see Auburn at the helm.

@NSF has awarded @AuburnU $10M to lead the Southeastern region in a collaborative research project to increase the number of disabled students who complete STEM degrees and enter the respective workforce. This is a national initiative, and I am proud to see Auburn at the helm.

Senator Carl Levin was an honest man who devoted most of his life to his home state of Michigan, where he was the longest-serving senator in history. A two-time chairman of the Armed Services Committee, he prioritized our national security. We send our condolences to his family.
I urge members of the House to quickly take up this important security supplemental legislation and send it to @POTUS’s desk without further delay.

It’s past time we provide urgently-needed funding to safeguard the Capitol, ensure @USNationalGuard readiness, and protect our allies in Afghanistan. I am pleased the Senate has advanced this bipartisan bill 98-0 to fund our immediate security needs.

Madison native, Zach Harting, had a strong showing in the #TokyoOlympics 200m butterfly semifinals – only .06 seconds away from making the finals. A job well done representing #Alabama and #TeamUSA, Zach!

Proud to congratulate Haylie McCleney of Morris, Alabama, who led #TeamUSA softball to a silver medal in the #TokyoOlympics. She scored four runs and had a .529 batting average during the tournament. Incredible performance, Haylie!

Congratulations to Huntsville's Nicholas Dunlap who won the 2021 #USJuniorAm Championship this past Saturday! It's always great to see young Alabamians work hard, pursue their dreams, and represent Alabama on the national stage.

Good news! Mobile Airport Authority has received a $1M @USDOT grant to launch a new commercial airline service between @MobileRegional & @Dulles_Airport. With increased access to key airport & market hubs, this will further enable economic development for the #GulfCoast region.

It is also critical that we not leave behind those who helped us in Afghanistan once President Biden fully withdraws U.S. troops later this year. I am glad the Administration at long last provided Congress the information necessary to address this urgent need.

We have reached a deal on the security supplemental that sticks to immediate needs, as I have long advocated. It is essential that we provide the @USNationalGuard and @CapitolPolice the funding they require without further delay.

Very saddened by the loss of my friend & former colleague from Wyoming, Senator Mike Enzi. Mike was a good man and was well-respected in the Senate. Annette and I send our deepest condolences to his wife, Diana, his family, and loved ones. He will be mourned by all who knew him.

Annette and I are praying for Senator Enzi after he suffered a serious accident on his bike over the weekend. We hope he recovers with ease and are thinking of his loving wife, Diana, and devoted family at this time.
Congratulations to Mobile’s very own Paige Madden who placed 7th swimming in the 400m freestyle last night at the #TokyoOlympics! Way to represent our great state and #TeamUSA!

Today in a defense subcommittee hearing, I questioned Pentagon officials on the @USNavy and @usairforce plans for divestment of weapon systems. I asked how those plans better position our forces and how the President's budget impacted their decisions.

I know there’s a lot of controversy around vaccinations. I also know it is a personal decision. My wife and I got our COVID-19 vaccine as soon as we were able, and we encourage you to do the same. It could save your life.

Another Alabamian, Quanesha Burks, has secured a spot in the #TokyoOlympics! I look forward to watching this #Hartselle native represent our great state of #Alabama and the #USA while she competes in track and field this summer. Congratulations, Quanesha! @TeamUSA @Olympics
Republicans stand ready and willing to pass a supplemental to fund the National Guard and the Capitol Police – but not to fund a wish list of Democratic priorities.

Today, I expressed my concerns to @federalreserve Chairman Powell about how the Biden administration is proposing trillions more in government spending in the midst of the largest increase in consumer prices in 13 years.

Affordable living, good job opportunities, and high salaries are a few of the reasons Huntsville, Alabama, placed in the top 3 of @usnews' #BestPlaces to live in 2021-2022. Great showing from the #RocketCity!

Some exciting advancements are happening in west Alabama including new businesses and more! I am pleased to see this region has benefitted from a $2.5M @USDOL @DRA workforce development grant that @univwestalabama received in 2019. Read more here:

Funding for the Capitol Police and National Guard must not be held hostage because the Democrats insist on billions more in spending that lacks full support at this time. The clock is ticking. Let’s pass what we all agree on.

We all agree we must provide desperately-needed funding for the Capitol Police and National Guard. My bill answers these needs. I urge my Democrat colleagues to join me in passing this bill without further delay.

With international travel ramping up, I encourage everyone to check the status of your passport. Routine service to renew or apply for a new passport can take as long as 24 weeks, and expedited service can take up to 12 weeks. Plan ahead and give yourself ample time. More info:

Pleased to welcome Watson Donald back to my team – this time as my chief of staff. I am confident in his leadership abilities and legislative expertise, and I look forward to what we can accomplish together over the next 17 months.

Pleased to share that the U.S. Senate Page Program will be reinstated this fall. This program is a great opportunity for young Alabamians to learn about our government and gain valuable experience. Please visit my website to apply or find more information:

Happy Independence Day! Today, we celebrate our freedom and liberty, and we remember those who sacrificed so much to make our independence possible. I hope everyone has a patriotic day filled with pride and gratitude.

Donald Rumsfeld dedicated a significant portion of his life to public service. I am proud to have known him well. A former Navy pilot & two-time Secretary of Defense, his top priority was the security of our nation. Annette and I send our condolences to his family and loved ones.

Proud that @USDOT is granting $8.29M in FAA funding to advance airport infrastructure throughout Alabama. These grants are important investments in the safety, security, and growth of our local airports and the state's overall economic success. @FAANews

Honored to participate in today's groundbreaking of the new FBI Innovation Center at Redstone Arsenal. This center will be a great asset focused on cyber threat intelligence and analytics. I look forward to the many jobs that will be created and the future of @FBI in Alabama.

Proud to see a North Alabamian, Zach Harting, join #TeamUSA for the 2021 Summer Olympics in Tokyo. Zach hails from Madison where he attended @BobJonesHigh. I hope my fellow Alabamians will join me in cheering him on in the water this summer. Congratulations, Zach!

Following a nat'l merit competition administered by the Army Research Office, @DeptofDefense announced awards for @AAMUedu, @ASUHornetNation, & @TuskegeeUniv. These awards will provide these HBCUs in Alabama with important resources for equipment used in research & STEM programs.

S.1 makes election fraud easier to commit & harder to detect by allowing unlimited ballot harvesting, undermining voter ID laws, & making it more difficult to maintain accurate voter lists. This is a bad bill. I oppose it vehemently. My full speech:

S.1 would permanently tip the scales in favor of Democrats by politicizing the FEC, pouring federal tax dollars into campaigns, and chilling free speech. Do Americans really want their taxes going toward a federal campaign fund that would finance the expenses of all candidates?

States should be left with the freedom & flexibility to administer their own respective elections, without interference from the federal govt.  S.1 would force a single, partisan view of elections on more than 10,000 jurisdictions across the country.

Today, I spoke on the Senate floor about my opposition to S.1 – Democrats’ partisan, power-grab election bill – which contains many alarming provisions that would have a devastating impact on our nation’s electoral process and would make our elections more chaotic & less secure.

This morning, I questioned @USArmy officials regarding @POTUS’s budget request for the Army, which reflects a 2% reduction from FY2021. I’m concerned that we are sending the wrong message to both our allies and our adversaries.  My full statement:

Praying for everyone impacted by the devastating storms that swept through Alabama this weekend. Thank you to our first responders and the many people on the ground helping the communities hit and the families mourning such tragic loss.

Congratulations to Alabama's very own Olympian, Paige Madden! The Mobile native has secured a spot on the 2021 U.S. Olympic swim team and will compete in Tokyo this summer. I will be cheering Paige and the entire team on with pride as they represent our great country. #TeamUSA

Honored to receive @ShipbuildersUSA's 2021 Maritime Leadership award. Our shipbuilders provide significant & essential support in the maintenance & modernization of our naval forces, our @USCG, and our commercial industry. I look forward to continuing to prioritize their work.
I look forward to hearing how this administration plans to keep pace and counter the threats from Russia and China while simultaneously cutting investments in defense.

With military investments in China and Russia continuing to outpace U.S. investments, I find it hard to believe that the requirements outlined by General Dunford just four years ago are no longer instructive.
The FY22 @DeptofDefense budget proposal signals that the U.S. is not committed to investing in readiness, training, state-of-the-art equipment, and technological overmatch.

In years past, we've made the investments necessary to ensure that we have the best trained, best prepared, & best equipped fighting force in the world. But this year, the budget proposal signals to the world that this Administration is no longer committed to that.

The National Defense Strategy provides a road map for what the @DeptofDefense needs – at a minimum – to meet the challenges posed by a re-emergence of long-term strategic competition with China and Russia. Anything less jeopardizes our national security.

Cutting our defense funding is not a plan I can get behind – and it’s not a plan that sends the right message to our adversaries or our men and women in uniform who are asked to make the ultimate sacrifice.

This entirely avoidable crisis situation at the border is only getting worse. The Biden Administration has the means to end this crisis, but @POTUS chooses not to do so. That’s unfortunate for both our citizens and the rule of law.

.@USGAO's decision today makes clear that there are two sets of rules when it comes to executing funds appropriated by Congress: one for Democrat administrations and one for Republican administrations.  @SenCapito and I responded with a joint statement:

Today, we celebrate 246 years of the United States Army! I am grateful to every soldier who has served or is currently serving our great nation for protecting and defending our precious liberties. Thank you, @USArmy!

This program is designed to provide federal funding to reimburse counties that suffered damage and destruction to their community’s infrastructure. If you qualify for assistance, I encourage you to visit   or call 1-800-621-3362 to register.

Some news from @FEMA for Alabamians who were impacted by the tornadoes and severe weather on March 25 and 26: Public assistance has now been approved for Bibb, Calhoun, Clay, Hale, Perry, Randolph, and Shelby counties, in addition to individual assistance!

Today in a Senate Appropriations hearing, I met with top officials regarding @USAirForce & @SpaceForceDoD budget requests. I was pleased to hear DoD and Space Force are at the forefront of protecting both military and commercial assets in space.

Deputy Bill Smith will be remembered for what he was, a true American hero. My deepest condolences remain with his family, friends, and colleagues. We owe the brave men and women in blue a great debt of gratitude for their sacrifice and commitment.

We are forever indebted to all those in uniform who have fallen for our freedom. In honor of these brave soldiers, we remember how they made the ultimate sacrifice to serve and protect our great nation. These courageous heroes will never be forgotten. #MemorialDay2021

The proposal completely disregards our debt of more than $28 trillion, yet somehow still shortchanges our national security. Our highest priority should be funding our national defense to counter the threats they pose, not financing the far-left’s longstanding wish list.

President Biden’s FY22 budget request is a blueprint for the higher taxes, excessive spending, and disproportionate funding priorities the American people can expect from his Administration over the next four years.

Today in a closed Senate Appropriations hearing, I received an update on the Intelligence Community and the challenges their agencies are facing. Maintaining a robust intelligence apparatus is necessary to keep our strategic advantage over our adversaries.

John Warner was a real man. He was a WWII & Korean War veteran, and served as Secretary of the Navy. Notably, he was a five-term Senator, where he chaired @SASCGOP and @SenateRules. John was smart, funny, and a great colleague in the Senate. He will be missed by all who knew him.

Pleased construction has begun to deepen & widen the Port of Mobile, something I’m confident will improve Alabama’s state & local economy for generations. This project has been a top priority of mine for several years. I look forward to its completion and the resulting benefits.

Pleased that @CamgianMicro selected downtown Tuscaloosa as the location for their newly relocated Center for Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. This is great news for Alabama and the future of defense technology.
That's why @JimInhofe and I filed an amendment today to the Endless Frontier Act that would provide dollar-for-dollar parity between increases to defense and non-defense spending.  More information:

The best deterrent to Chinese ambition & aggression is a strong & feared American military. Providing the funding increases our military needs to counter this growing threat must be our top priority. Instead POTUS wants to cut defense$ while increasing non-defense$ by nearly 20%.
In a Senate Appropriations hearing today, I questioned leaders from our National Guard and Reserve forces regarding the resources they need to remain a ready and lethal force. More info here:

Some good news: @NSF has awarded @TuskegeeUniv nearly $1M to fund and host hands-on training programs intended to boost interest in STEM and provide opportunities for minority high school students to gain technical experience and education in STEM-related fields.

Today, I re-introduced the SMART Act to establish a flat tax. Our nation’s current tax code is complex and costly. With my bill, Americans could expect an immediate tax cut for nearly all taxpayers and a reduction in size and scope of the IRS.

These men and women made the ultimate sacrifice to protect us, putting our safety above their own. During #NationalPoliceWeek, we pay tribute to these brave heroes. We owe our fallen officers a great debt of gratitude and my sincerest condolences remain with their loved ones.

Yesterday, I cosponsored a resolution that passed in the Senate honoring the observance of #NationalPoliceWeek, and commemorated the 306 law enforcement officers who lost their lives in the line of duty during 2020, four of whom were from Alabama.

Today @SenTuberville and I introduced legislation to establish the Alabama Black Belt National Heritage Area. This designation for the Black Belt would highlight the region’s many assets, while helping generate tourism and economic activity.

Today I sent @SecMayorkas a letter about his denial on ‘catch and release,’ which contradicts @DHSgov data. I have asked him to clarify the discrepancy between his testimony at this morning’s Approps hearing & the information provided by his Department.

FAA has awarded $12.28M in grant funding to improve airports – both large and small – throughout Alabama, paving the way for growth and increased investment in rural areas. This allows the 12 airports to continue serving communities & driving development.

Pleased @USDA_NIFA awarded @TuskegeeUniv a 1890 Center of Excellence grant to help address profitability, sustainability & prosperity challenges of small farmers, ranchers & forestland owners, with an emphasis on socially disadvantaged & underserved farmers in AL & the Southeast.

This morning, @SenCapito and I sent a letter to @USGAO to correct the Biden Administration’s false or misleading claims regarding its unlawful actions to freeze border wall funding and construction. Link to the full letter and more details:

Domestic violent extremists threaten the rule of law. But so too does turning a blind eye to the flood of illegal immigration at our southern border.  My full remarks from the Senate Appropriations hearing this morning:

The rule of law – the very foundation upon which America was built – is paramount to our future as Americans and the future of our democracy. Selective enforcement of our nation’s laws erodes that foundation.

My 2nd amdt to S.1, the 'Democrat Politician Protection Act,' would strike Section 4111, which attempts to regulate a new category of speech. This section infringes on our First Amendment rights and would prohibit speech that is constitutionally protected.

Today at the Rules Cmte markup of S.1, I offered an amendment to strike Section 1611, which would require mandatory early voting for all states – a liberal one-size-fits-all federal mandate. This would be costly for states and localities, & would have a minimal impact on turnout.
Not only would S.1 tip the scales in favor of Democrats, but it would also force a one-size-fits-all election mandate on every state and locality. This is extremely concerning for all Americans.
S.1 - Democrats' election bill - is a liberal attempt to have federal officials control all elections across the country. Its dangerous policies will make our elections less fair and less secure.

In honor of #TeacherAppreciationDay, I would like to extend my thanks to all hardworking educators. My wife, Annette, taught for many years, and I have witnessed firsthand the impact teachers have on our future generations. We are forever indebted to them.

President Biden has nominated David Chipman to be Director of @ATFHQ. As a longtime gun control activist, he has advocated for policies that would be a direct assault on the 2nd Amendment. If confirmed, his appointment would threaten the constitutional rights of all gun owners.

Tonight’s address from President Biden was focused on drastically changing the country, but instead of reaching across the aisle to find ways to work together, this Administration is prioritizing liberal policies and a partisan agenda. My full statement:

These counties are now eligible for @FEMA's Individual Assistance program for damage & losses from the March tornadoes: Bibb, Calhoun, Clay, Hale, Jefferson, Perry, Randolph, & Shelby. Those with homeowner’s insurance should file your claim ASAP, before applying for federal aid.

Ten years ago today, our state suffered tragic loss and destruction from the tornadoes that swept through the South. My wife, Annette, and I will never forget the lives lost and all those left grieving. A decade later, Alabama continues to showcase its resiliency. #27April10yr
Today we celebrate 113 years of the @USArmyReserve! Our Army Reserve service men and women play an important role in upholding our national security and we are grateful for their service.

Pleased with @DOTMARAD's decision to invest in two Alabama Gulf Coast shipyards, Steiner Shipbuilding and Master Boat Builders. The two grants, nearly $1M in total, will help increase performance capacity and create growth opportunities at both shipyards.

Today, I joined all 11 of my @BankingGOP colleagues in expressing concern with reports that the Biden Administration is pressuring banks to make energy-related lending commitments. Such actions could distort capital allocation, raise energy costs, and slow economic growth.

Disappointed that Dems are trying to pass another package under false pretenses. Less than 6% of this $2.3T “infrastructure plan” will go toward America's roads & bridges. The rest is full of unrelated policies & tax hikes that will cost jobs, cut wages, & slash economic growth.

Mark your calendars – @Outdoor_Alabama just announced the dates for 2021's #RedSnapper season. Beginning May 28, private vessel anglers can enjoy four-day weekends open for fishing in state and federal waters. Wishing everyone a safe and successful season.

Today, the Ingenuity #MarsHelicopter, named by Vaneeza Rupani of Northport, #Alabama, made history by becoming the first aircraft to make a powered, controlled flight on another planet. This monumental feat is excellent news for the future of space exploration.
Talk is cheap, but defending our country is not. We can't afford to fail in our constitutional responsibility to provide for the common defense.
