Annette and I wish everyone a happy Easter. He is risen. #EasterSunday
Very sad to learn that one of the Capitol Police officers has succumb to his injuries. Praying for the officer’s family and loved ones, and for the entire Capitol Police family.

My wife, Annette, and I are praying for the Capitol Police officers who were injured today. Thank you to the all of the officers and National Guardsmen who are working to keep the Capitol complex safe. Very grateful for your protection today and every day.
Happy birthday, @SenatorLeahy. Grateful for our longstanding friendship and willingness to work together on the Senate Appropriations Committee. Looking forward to another productive year.

Pleased that 20 airports throughout Alabama will benefit from more than $11.2M in @FAAnews grants. These @USDOT funds will help airports receive the upgrades and enhancements needed to continue serving local communities and driving economic development.
More information regarding my letter:

Today I sent a letter to @Amtrak, @CSX, @nscorp, & Surface Transportation Board stating that a data-driven process is essential prior to starting new passenger rail in Mobile. A comprehensive study would alleviate concerns re how the new service could impact growth in the area.
Please stay safe as we work to assess the damage in Alabama. To the first responders who have worked hard to rescue those in need, thank you.
My thoughts and prayers are with all of those experiencing loss and destruction as a result of the devastating storms that hit the entire southeast yesterday.

Further, S.1 would allow the use of taxpayer dollars for political campaigns. I vehemently oppose this bill and urge every one of my colleagues in Congress to do the same. This legislation would have dangerous implications on the future of our democracy. 3/3

Not only would S.1 give unelected, ultraliberal Washington bureaucrats the ability to control how Alabama conducts its elections, but it would open doors to fraud and have a devastating impact on our freedom of speech. 2/3
S.1 is a blatant power grab in an effort to force a federalized election system on the entire country. 1/3
In 2016, I worked to have Congress fund this $10 million, state-of-the-art study & I'm very pleased with its results. The Gulf's Great Red Snapper Count" revealed 110 million red snapper
column2: approximately three times more than previously estimated. This is fantastic news. "

column1: Pleased that @ARCgov granted @AthensAL $750K for the installation of new sewer infrastructure to the Huntsville-Browns Ferry Rd Interchange on I-65. This funding will support the construction of new facilities designed to help traffic near the Mazda-Toyota plant being built.

Today is #NationalAgDay! In Alabama, agriculture has a significant impact on our economy and I am grateful for the families & farms that make it possible. The industry boasts an economic output of $92.8B, thanks to the nearly 600,000 dedicated men & women.

Pleased that @AthensState was awarded a $650K @NSF grant to increase STEM degree completion in undergraduate students. This will help with recruitment, retention, academic success, & graduation rates of academically-skilled transfer students in STEM fields.

I joined a bipartisan letter urging OMB to abandon its proposed change to how Metropolitan Statistical Areas are defined – which could have a detrimental impact on the amount of federal funding cities across AL receive. Proud to help ensure that this designation remains the same.
Pleased that today's Green Run hot fire test of the @NASA_SLS core stage was successful and informative -  another important milestone in our return to the moon.

Reintroduced legislation today to require the fed govt to balance a budget – something hardworking Americans do every day. I hope Congress adopts this common-sense amendment, improving our spending of taxpayer dollars & restoring confidence in our economy.

Alabamians, as this severe weather persists, I urge you to remain vigilant & prepared. Please be sure to monitor the forecast & take the necessary precautions, such as establishing multiple ways to get weather updates, having an appropriate plan, & identifying your shelter. #alwx

As we state in the letter, “the President’s actions directly contributed to this unfortunate, yet entirely avoidable, scenario,” and are “a blatant violation of federal law and infringe on Congress’s constitutional power of the purse.”

I joined 39 of my @SenateGOP colleagues in sending a letter, led by @SenCapito, to @USGAO regarding @POTUS’s unlawful suspension of border wall funding and construction, and how those actions have directly contributed to the crisis at our southern border.

Pleased that HomTex, a #CullmanCounty textile manufacturer, received @US_FDA’s greenlight for its Level 1 Surgical masks. This secures the growing Alabama company's entry into the PPE market, which is also on track to open a plant in Selma, resulting in 300 new jobs. #MadeinAL

This week in the Senate, I cosponsored legislation to repeal the #DeathTax, which is an unfair tax that makes it more difficult for hardworking farms & small businesses to stay in the family. It's important that we ease the burden on these family businesses, not exacerbate it.

I look forward to working with the Consortium, including the @UofSouthAlabama, @UofAlabama, @AuburnU, and @ALPublicHealth, to ensure that innovative solutions are identified & a more resilient sustainable wastewater infrastructure is constructed throughout the region.

Pleased to announce that an AL Consortium has been granted a $4.85M Rural Water & Wastewater Treatment award by @USDA. This funding will help strengthen wastewater treatment to improve public health & economic development, specifically in the Black Belt.

Pleased with the progress at the Port of Mobile. The deepening & widening of the Mobile Harbor will increase #Alabama’s global competitiveness, create jobs throughout the state, and serve as a catalyst for economic opportunities. @AlabamaPortAuth
I am disappointed that we were blocked at every turn from engaging and passing real COVID relief in a bipartisan, targeted manner, just like the Senate did five times last year.
The bill does nothing to get kids back in classrooms and, instead, includes a massive cash bailout for some mismanaged states and local governments. This is unacceptable.

Not only does it cost American taxpayers over a trillion dollars, but only 9% of the funding in the bill goes toward the immediate fight against COVID and 1% toward vaccines. Dems are forcing a liberal wish list of pet projects through Congress that's masked as a rescue package.

Today I voted against the Dems' $1.9 trillion COVID bill for several reasons. This legislation includes a host of non-COVID-related left-wing policies and could further wreck the economy and ignite inflation.

These @AlabamaFTBL athletes & coaches demonstrated tremendous fortitude, ending the season 13-0. The team went 11-0 in conference play, becoming the first team in college football history to win 11 @SEC games in a season, & averaged 48.5 points per game – the most in SEC history.

The Senate has passed my resolution commending the @UofAlabama Crimson Tide on winning the 2021 @NCAA College Football Nat'l Championship – the 18th Nat'l Championship for @AlabamaFTBL, and 6th in the last 11 years. I’m proud to formally recognize this achievement. #RollTide

Last year, the Senate worked together 5 times to pass bipartisan, targeted COVID relief to help combat the pandemic and get Americans' lives back to normal. This year, Democrats are pushing a partisan $1.9 trillion package filled with unrelated, self-serving liberal priorities.

This COVID relief package is partisan & non-targeted. In fact, 90% of Dems’ COVID relief package is unrelated to COVID. Instead, Democrats want to expand Obamacare subsidies, push harmful economic policies, & fund blue state bailouts, Planned Parenthood, union pensions, & more.

In Democrats’ massive $1.9 trillion COVID-19 relief package, very little is actually related to the pandemic. In fact, less than 9% of Democrats’ proposal would go to the core healthcare fight against COVID-19, and less than 1% deals with vaccinations.

Last year, Congress appropriated $68 billion in COVID-related funds for K-12 schools. Of that, only $5 billion has been spent. Schools have the resources to reopen and science has shown that it's safe to do so with simple precautions that we can accomplish right now.

FAA selected Huntsville Intl Airport to host a UAS Test Site to evaluate drone detection & mitigation systems. @FlyHSV, in partnership with @UAHuntsville, will work to foster new technologies that'll make airports safer for passengers & aircraft. Excellent decision & great news.

Today I questioned Gary Gensler, POTUS's SEC nominee, about the importance of utilizing economic analysis when proposing and adopting rules within the SEC. Identifying the potential benefits and costs of a regulation is essential in determining if it is in the public interest.

A grant of nearly $745K has been awarded to Physicians Care of Clarke in #ClarkeCounty. This investment will increase their telehealth capacity through the installation of telemedicine carts and videoconferencing equipment at each clinic.

$790K has been awarded to @CahabaMedical to fund teleconferencing equipment in central Alabama. This grant will enable the foundation to offer distance learning for its family medicine residency programs, which help graduates achieve licensure or board certification. #Centreville
.@Montevallo University has received $580K to establish a telemedicine system to provide access to telemental health services for students, teachers, and community members.

The #LauderdaleCounty Board of Education has been awarded approximately $250K to purchase and install distance learning systems in their schools that will increase student's access to their teachers and lessons.

The @UofAlabama received $900K to increase patient care efficiency by establishing a network between 23 telemedicine-equipped ambulances and seven rural hospitals in west-central Alabama, which will allow patient data to be relayed directly to emergency physicians.

Alabama received a total of $3.3M in Distance, Learning & Telemedicine grants from @USDA today. This #telehealth investment will help combat the adverse effects of the COVID-19 pandemic in rural areas by increasing access to quality healthcare & education.

Congratulations to Bob Jones High School in Madison, Alabama, on winning their regional Science Bowl event and advancing to the National Finals this May. I am confident they will represent Alabama well. Good luck to all of the young contestants.
My thoughts and prayers go out to the loved ones of the two Air Force pilots tragically killed yesterday in the trainer jet crash near Dannelly Field.

This year, two Alabama cities placed in @MilkenInstitute’s Top Cities index! @HuntsvilleCity was named one of the top 10 Best-Performing Large Cities and the Daphne-Fairhope-Foley area was named the #5 Best-Performing Small City. #BestPerformingCities

Very pleased that @NASA’s Perseverance rover & Ingenuity helicopter–named by Vaneeza Rupani of Northport, AL–have safely landed on the surface of Mars. Congratulations to everyone from NASA & @ULA involved in successfully delivering the @NASAPersevere mission to its destination.
My statement regarding the conclusion of the Senate impeachment trial:

Honored to continue leading my GOP colleagues on the Appropriations Cmte & its Defense Subcmte, where I'll continue efforts to strengthen the security of our nation & support natl priorities. I also look forward to my work on Banking, EPW & Rules to advance impactful legislation.

For the 117th Congress, I will remain on the following Senate committees: Appropriations, @BankingGOP, @EPWGOP, and Rules. These assignments will help bolster my work on behalf of the state of Alabama and the nation.

Forbes named the University of Alabama at Birmingham America's best large employer. The university prioritizes the health & well-being of its community & employees, and has shown great resilience throughout the pandemic. I am proud they have received this recognition. @UABNews

Congratulations to our new Senate Appropriations Committee Chairman, @SenatorLeahy. Pat and I have a long-standing relationship built on trust and fairness. I look forward to continuing our work to fund national priorities in a bipartisan manner.

Pleased we have announced the Senate Appropriations Committee subcommittee rosters and leadership for the 117th Congress. This committee has a record of working together to complete our bills. I am hopeful we can produce real results in a timely manner:

Although I plan to retire, I am not leaving today. I have two good years remaining to continue my work in Washington. I have the vision and the energy to give it my all. I look forward to what is to come for our great state and our great nation.

Today I announce that I will not seek a seventh term in the Senate in 2022. For everything, there is a season. I am grateful to the people of Alabama who have put their trust in me for more than forty years.

George Shultz was a great statesman. He held four cabinet positions and served under three different presidents. He was smart and wise, and dedicated his life to our country. We will miss his rational mind.

This week I nominated 39 students from across Alabama to attend various U.S. service academies. These students have excellent academic records & achievements outside the classroom. Their futures are bright! @NavalAcademy @AF_Academy @WestPoint_USMA @UsmmaO

Congratulations to Ann Berry, the new Secretary of the Senate. Ann is a Birmingham native and the first African American and Alabamian to serve in this role. Having worked in the Senate for 40 years, she is well respected and will continue to be an asset in her new position.

Cosponsored a resolution, which just passed in the Senate, honoring the life and legacy of Hank Aaron for his vast accomplishments. The Mobile native was an impressive athlete and continues to be a role model to many. He earned his place in history and deserves this recognition.

Secretary Austin and I also discussed my belief that robust investments in readiness and modernization are essential to maintaining a world-renowned military. We live in a troubled world. The defense of our nation must be our number one priority. @DeptofDefense 2/2

Today I spoke with @SecDef Lloyd Austin and reiterated my hope that the Biden Administration’s top priority will be the security of our nation. I told him that we must have the best trained, best led, and best equipped military in the world. 1/2

Some great news for Alabama from @CSpire today. Over the next three years, the company will invest half a billion dollars in all-fiber broadband services in #Alabama. This investment will support rural communities, help create jobs, & benefit thousands of businesses.

My thoughts and prayers are with the people of Fultondale after last night's severe weather. Very sad to hear that one person was killed, many others were injured, and homes and businesses were damaged. Waiting on a full assessment of the damage. #alwx #Alabama
Attention: The deadline to apply for Hurricane Zeta FEMA assistance is in two weeks on February 8. The easiest ways to apply are by calling 1-800-621-3362, FEMA’s app, or by logging onto

Proud to spend some time with members of the @USNationalGuard this week in our nation’s Capitol. My staff and I are grateful to these brave men and women for their sacrifice and willingness to serve our country. Thank you for keeping us safe. #AlwaysReadyAlwaysThere

Pleased that the @USCG has awarded @LockheedMartin's @Sikorsky facility in Troy a $200+ million contract for the sustainment of 25 Coast Guard MH-60T Jayhawk helicopters. Very good news for the Coast Guard, the Troy facility, and the Wiregrass region.

Today I voted to confirm Ret. Gen. Lloyd Austin as our next @SecDef. A native of Mobile & @AuburnU grad, Gen. Austin is eminently qualified to lead the Pentagon. I look forward to working with him to ensure our military remains the most powerful force in the world. @DeptofDefense

Last week @SenRobPortman and I made a friendly wager ahead of the Alabama-Ohio State #NationalChampionship game. On the line was some ribs from Alabama’s @DreamlandBBQ & a few pints of Ohio's @graeters ice cream. Looking forward to enjoying some ice cream. Roll Tide! @AlabamaFTBL

Congratulations to our 46th @POTUS, Joe Biden, and @VP, Kamala Harris. I wish them all the best as they lead our country over the next four years. Thank you to the @USNationalGuard and other law enforcement for securing and protecting our Capitol for this important ceremony.
ICYMI: @USDA is providing additional assistance for certain #agriculture producers through the expansion of eligibility for the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program. #CFAP
Today we remember and honor the powerful life of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. His legacy will live on for generations to come through his impactful work and vision for equality. #MLKDay

It’s official – @USAirForce has selected Redstone Arsenal for the new U.S. Space Command HQ. Great news! Huntsville is the right pick for a host of reasons. Thank you to the Air Force & the Huntsville community for helping make this possible. @TeamRedstone

Proud that the 2021 North American Car of the Year, the Hyundai Elantra, is one of the cars assembled at the @Hyundai plant in #Montgomery. The hardworking men and women who build these cars are highly skilled in their trade. This is an impressive achievement. #MadeinAL #Alabama

The University of Alabama at Birmingham was recently recognized as the nation's first Health Promoting University. Their adoption of the Okanagan Charter showcases UAB’s commitment to promoting health both on campus and in the greater community. @UABNews #Alabama

Pleased that the @US_EDA has granted $3.8M to Mobile’s @usaunivhospital for a badly-needed emergency generator system, which will safeguard the region’s only Level 1 trauma center & pediatric emergency department.

My thoughts and prayers are with the families of those who were tragically killed. My deepest condolences go out to the family of Capitol Police Officer Brian D. Sicknick, who died in the line of duty, courageously protecting others from harm. 3/3

I want to thank the law enforcement officials who bravely restored order and protected those working in the Capitol complex. Additionally, I believe a thorough examination of Capitol security measures is necessary to prevent this from ever happening again. 2/3
The chilling events that unfolded Wednesday on Capitol Hill were unacceptable. The rule of law is one of our nation’s founding principles, and we cannot tolerate such violence and chaos. 1/3

Today is a very dark day for our country. I am safe thanks to the protection and swift action by our law enforcement officials. Our Founding Fathers warned against mob rule. Law and order must be established and maintained.

The @ALPublicHealth Dept has a new data dashboard with information regarding COVID-19 in Alabama. This is a great tool to use if you want to stay up to date on what’s happening in our state in terms of risk status, vaccine distribution, and more.

Great to see Auburn-based SiO2 Materials Science has received the 2020 @Forbes Manufacturing Best Product award for its vials used for COVID vaccine distribution, which are produced with new, advanced technology. #MadeinAlabama @RethinkGlass
Merry Christmas! While our holidays may look a little different this year, what’s important remains the same. I hope everyone is staying warm and safe this Christmas season.

Pleased the Senate has passed all 12 FY21 appropriations bills and additional COVID funding. This package makes certain that #Alabama will remain a major player on the national stage. I look forward to its lasting influence on our state & our nation.

Great news – tonight, the Senate passed all 12 FY21 appropriations bills and a COVID rescue package. Pleased we have addressed critical priorities: funding the government and delivering much-needed relief to struggling families, workers, and businesses.

More great news from SiO2 @RethinkGlass! The company’s production of cutting-edge vials, which are being used to store and distribute Moderna’s COVID-19 vaccine, showcases the ingenuity and skilled workforce in Alabama. #MadeinAlabama

Two AL-based companies, @AccGenetics & SiO2 @RethinkGlass, received the AdvanSE Life Sciences Award for helping combat COVID-19 & promote equitable health care. Proud of their role in growing #Alabama's bioscience sector.

Today we recognize Alabama's promising future. I’m honored to serve such a great state, having witnessed it become a hub for defense, space exploration, medical research, manufacturing, & more. Thank you and happy 201st birthday, #Alabama!

Great news! The Senate just passed the 60th annual National Defense Authorization Act. This legislation is a vital step in the process of funding America’s defense to provide protection for our country and care for our troops. #FY21NDAA

I'm hopeful that we can reach a resolution soon on both. The American people expect us do our job, which includes providing government agencies, in particular our military and veterans, with needed funding.

The Senate just passed a continuing resolution through December 18. This will keep the govt open and give us another week to continue our discussions on the FY21 appropriations bills. This also provides members the opportunity to continue negotiations on additional COVID relief.
Remember to #shopsmall and support your local small businesses this holiday season. Here are a few safe & smart ways to do so.
I'm very pleased with the announcement of these exceptional astronauts. This is another great step to get the first woman and next man on the moon. #Artemis

ICYMI - Lifelong resident of #Alabama, Johnny Heflin, has worked for @NASA for over 30 yrs & currently serves as @NASA_SLS's liquid engines manager in #Huntsville. His work helps to ensure the safety & success of the SLS rocket & the larger #Artemis lunar missions as a whole.

I joined @SenatorRubio & others in commemorating their acts of heroism in a resolution that passed this week in the Senate. Grateful for their honorable service & bravery as they made the ultimate sacrifice to protect others.

Tomorrow is the 1 year anniversary of the tragic terrorist attack at Naval Air Station Pensacola that killed @USNavy officer Joshua Kaleb Watson of #Enterprise, Alabama, airman Cameron Scott Walters of Georgia, and airman Mohammed Sameh Haitham of Florida.

Proud that @CRPHSV in #Huntsville has been selected as the location for the first qualifying race for the @usparacycling team, which will help determine cyclists for next summer in Tokyo. Very exciting news for #Alabama! Best of luck to all of the impressive competitors.

Today is #SmallBusinessSaturday! I encourage all Alabamians to #ShopSmall & support the local businesses that are the economic engine of our state. Many businesses have options in place for safe shopping. Check with your local stores to see what responsible services they offer.

Wishing everyone a very happy #Thanksgiving. Today we remember what we're grateful for, such as family, friends, and freedom. I am also thankful for our first responders and military personnel who protect our liberties and freedoms today and every day.

The @USAirForce has selected Maxwell Air Force Base in #Montgomery to host the new MH-139 Grey Wolf helicopter. The decision highlights and reinforces our state's success in supporting a robust national defense. This is excellent news for #Alabama.

Great news! @NSF recently awarded @SamfordU $1 million in grant funding aimed to boost #STEM opportunities for community college transfers. This award will establish scholarships while applying data and research to increase #STEM academic success and degree completion.

Thank you to each and every one of the brave men and women who put their lives on the line to protect and defend our freedoms. I commend their strength and courage and am grateful for their dedication and selfless service to our nation. #VeteransDay
I’d like to wish the @USMC a happy 245th birthday. Their unwavering commitment and sacrifice for our great country is an inspiration to us all. We’re grateful for their service today and every day.

Our Republic relies on the integrity of our electoral system. Both parties should want fair and honest elections. Fraud, and the perception of fraud, erodes confidence and is damaging to the freedoms and liberties envisioned and established by our forefathers.
Time after time, we have demonstrated our willingness to work together and get the job done. We have before us the opportunity to deliver for the American people once again.

By & large, these bills are the product of bipartisan cooperation among members of the Senate Appropriations Cmte. As negotiations w/ the House begin in earnest, I look fwd to working w/ @NitaLowey, @SenatorLeahy & @RepKayGranger to resolve our differences in a bipartisan manner.

ICYMI – @BusinessInsider declared #Huntsville the best city to move to for people seeking early retirement because of the #RocketCity’s growing opportunities for high-paying jobs and low cost of living. #Alabama

Earlier today, @Hyundai announced their decision to add a 5th vehicle to their Montgomery production plant. This selection is a result of a positive long-term partnership between Hyundai & the #Montgomery community. I look forward to the benefits to come from this great news.
Congratulations to @TTuberville on his victory last night. I look forward to serving with him in the Senate as we work to support and protect the needs of Alabama and the nation.

I am proud to have voted to confirm Judge Amy Coney Barrett to serve on the #SCOTUS. Throughout my career in the Senate, I have never seen a more qualified judicial nominee. I'm confident she will serve our country with honor on our nation’s highest court.

In a few hours, the Senate will vote on the nomination of Judge Amy Coney Barrett – a remarkably qualified #SCOTUS nominee. I look forward to supporting her for this role and once again, urge my colleagues to do the same. She is an exemplary choice for our nation's highest court.

As a country, we should seek to have judges who are thoughtful, fair-minded, & respectful. Judge Barrett exemplifies all of these traits. I have the utmost confidence that she will serve the Court & this country with honesty & integrity. My full remarks:

Today I spoke on the Senate floor regarding the nomination of Judge Amy Coney Barrett, who I consider to be the most qualified Supreme Court nominee that I have encountered in my 34 years in the United States Senate. #SCOTUS
Very sad to hear about the Navy trainer aircraft that crashed in Foley. My thoughts and prayers are with the families of the two service members who lost their lives.

Proud to announce that @USDA has awarded #Alabama $37M for 6 rural broadband infrastructure projects, which will help provide high-speed internet access to thousands of central Alabamians in a time where connectivity & remote access are paramount.

Today in #Alabama, the @FBI formally expressed their support of the @RocketCenterUSA's newest #STEM camp program, Cyber Camp. I am confident that this partnership will expand the existing curriculum and provide great opportunities for cyber education.
Senate Democrats have, again, blocked hundreds of billions of dollars in COVID relief. Families and businesses are struggling. This senseless gridlock must stop for their sake. They deserve better.

I’m pleased to have worked with @US_EDA to support a $1.7M grant for the Port of Epes infrastructure project, which will help create jobs & fuel the local economy – enabling long-term economic benefits to West Alabama. Looking forward to its completion.

Great news for NW Alabama– @ARCgov has awarded @BevillState a $1.5M #POWER grant to create a Rapid Training Facility on the Hamilton campus, with courses focusing on #welding & #HVAC. The facility will offer hands-on training, teaching marketable skills to those looking for work.
Happy 245th birthday to the @USNavy! Thank you to the men and women who have served and continue to serve our nation on the water with honor, courage, and commitment. #Navy245 #USNavy

Judge Barrett is experienced and committed to upholding the Constitution. She'd be an exceptional member of the SCOTUS, bringing a unique American perspective to the highest court in the land. It's past time Democrats stop attacking her based on her personal religious beliefs.
Good news! @USDA is investing $3.05M in Distance Learning and Telemedicine grants in Alabama, which will help rural residents gain access to health care and educational opportunities.

Wishing the President @realDonaldTrump and First Lady Melania Trump @FLOTUS a speedy recovery. My thoughts and prayers are with all those impacted by #COVID19.

I’m proud to have led the efforts in Congress to fund the Great Red Snapper Count. Preliminary results show there are 3X the amount of #RedSnapper in the Gulf of Mexico as previously estimated. Hopefully this data will allow for more #RedSnapper fishing opportunities in the Gulf.

After speaking with Judge Barrett, I am confident that she is the right choice to serve on the Supreme Court. Judge Barrett is exceptionally qualified for this role and maintains strong conservative values and a deep commitment to our Constitution.

Judge Barrett is an excellent choice and will make a great Supreme Court Justice. I will enthusiastically support her confirmation, and I encourage my colleagues to join me in moving her nomination expeditiously.

Wildland Fire Mitigation & Management Commission Act: The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act includes this bipartisan bill, which establishes a commission to study and recommend wildland fire prevention, mitigation, suppression, management, and rehabilitation policies.
Watershed Protection: The legislation provides hundreds of millions of dollars for the Emergency Watershed Protection Program to help local communities recover after wildfires.

Mitigating and Recovering from Wildfires: The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act allows the use of Emergency Relief program funding for protective features to mitigate the risk of recurring damage or the cost of future repairs from natural disasters.

Forecasting and Detecting Drought: Our plan funds the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration’s high-performance computing -- allowing the agency to improve drought, flood, and wildfire prediction and detection.
Fireweather Test Bed Programs: The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act invests $100 million to improve wildfire prediction, detection, observation, modeling, and forecasting.
Road and Trail Restoration: Our historic proposal provides funding to remediate Forest Service legacy roads and trails.
Burned Area Rehabilitation: The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act provides $450 million for the Forest Service and the Department of Interior to carry out Burned Area Rehabilitation.
Community Defense Grants: The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act invests $500 million for Forest Service Community Defense Grants.
REPLANT Act: Our plan includes this legislation, which helps the U.S. Forest Service plant 1.2 billion trees on national forest lands, creating nearly 49,000 jobs over the next decade.
Hazardous Fuels: The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act provides $2.4 billion for the Forest Service and the Department of Interior to reduce hazardous fuels on federal, state, and Tribal lands.

Wildfires increasingly threaten the health and safety of AZ communities. Our bipartisan Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act makes historic investments to prevent and mitigate the impacts of wildfires and boost communities’ recoveries from such disasters.
Tribal Climate Resilience: The plan provides $216 million for Tribal climate resilience, adaptation, and community planning, design, and implementation of projects that address climate challenges.

Raising the Voices of Native American Communities: The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act establishes a new Assistant Secretary for Tribal Government Affairs under the U.S. Department of Transportation.
Tribal Cybersecurity Grants: The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act establishes a new federal cybersecurity grant program for Tribal Governments.
Bureau of Indian Affairs Road Maintenance Program: The historic legislation significantly boosts funding for the Road Maintenance Program.
Tribal Public Transportation Modernization: Our bill provides over $20 million for Arizona Tribal governments to improve and modernize their public transportation systems.

Tribal Broadband: The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act sets aside $2 billion for the Tribal Broadband Connectivity Program, boosting broadband deployment, digital inclusion, workforce development, telehealth, and distance learning.
Indian Water Rights Settlements: The legislation provides full funding to complete all currently-authorized Indian Water Rights Settlements.

Critical Tribal Water Infrastructure: The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act invests $3.5 billion in the Indian Health Service Sanitation Facilities Construction program for water infrastructure and resiliency.
Tribal Governments and Native American Communities will directly benefit from our bill which expands economic opportunities while respecting tribal sovereignty. Here’s how.

Air Traffic Control: The bipartisan plan invests $5 billion in grants for strengthening Air Traffic Control towers and systems -- many of which are decades-old and require upgrades to house new equipment to better keep American travelers safe.

Terminal Program: Our legislation provides $5 billion in competitive grants for terminal development, ensuring terminals at all types of airports will receive funding and guaranteeing that communities of all sizes benefit.

Funding for Airside and Landside Projects: Our bipartisan bill invests $15 billion in priority projects at every airport in the U.S., including runways and taxiways, safety upgrades, terminal development projects, noise mitigation, and transport services like shuttles and trams.

Arizona leads the nation in aviation. Our bipartisan Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act, which passed the Senate 69-30, includes major upgrades to every airport in the state -- creating jobs, improving passenger safety, and boosting tourism.

#Apollo11 launched 52 years ago today, demonstrating to the world that the United States leads in space -- and Arizona played a critical role in that effort. We’ll continue working to fuel Arizona’s space research and exploration.
Billions of dollars to modernize land ports of entry, which will help keep Arizonans safe and secure and improve travel and trade across the border.
Billions of dollars to improve ports and waterways – which serve as vital links for American employers selling U.S. products abroad, boosting jobs and national security.
$73 billion to upgrade America’s power infrastructure and strengthen the resiliency of the power grid that Arizona’s communities rely on.
Tens of billions of dollars in expanding and strengthening America’s passenger and freight rail systems that boost Arizona tourism and move Arizona’s manufacturers’ products to markets.

$25 billion to upgrade and strengthen America’s airports – including Arizona’s nearly 200 airports – to support job-creators that rely on air transportation and ensure the U.S. remains the world leader in air safety, travel, and innovation.

More than $8 billion to strengthen infrastructure in AZ and western states facing drought and wildfire – including more than $3 billion to repair aging infrastructure, $2 billion in water storage and recycling, and full funding for Drought Contingency Plan projects at Lake Mead.
$65 billion to expand high-speed broadband to all Americans, make broadband more affordable, and close the digital divide for rural and Tribal communities.
The biggest federal investment in public transit in history, clearing America’s backlog of public transit repairs, and expanding Arizona’s urban and rural transit options to reduce commute times.
$110 billion in additional spending to repair and upgrade America’s roadways and bridges – and fuel new major transportation projects.
Our bipartisan infrastructure plan paves the way for the largest investment in Arizona’s critical infrastructure in a generation, creating jobs and boosting economic opportunities.

We cannot allow something that is nowhere to be found in the Constitution, the filibuster, to stand in the way of something that is... the RIGHT TO VOTE. Share if you agree.

Representation MATTERS, in all corners of society and institutions of power.

column1: We CANNOT allow the filibuster, and relentless obstruction from the GOP, to stand in the way of protecting our democracy.

Inaction is simply not an option. Our nation stands at the intersection of multiple crises that require immediate attention. From the climate crisis to the ongoing efforts to undermine our democracy, the threats we face cannot be left unaddressed.
Gerrymandering is deeply undemocratic and must be addressed with federal reform. WE NEED TO PASS THE FREEDOM TO VOTE ACT.

For the Bay Area, $18 million to improve BART, protect the San Francisco Bay, replace aging infrastructure and anti-homelessness programs. Find more info here:

For the Central Valley and Northern California, $62 million for projects including fire suppression systems, new water wells, flood mitigation and a range of wildfire prevention programs. Find more info here:

It’s been a decade since Congress allowed congressionally directed spending in federal funding bills. Senators know the needs of their states best, and I was proud to secure more than $260 million to fund projects across California.

We must address the root cause of climate change and drastically reduce carbon emissions. We also have to accept the reality that climate change is happening now and look for ways to mitigate the problems it’s creating, including in the financial sector.

I’m glad the Biden administration agrees that we need greater transparency on the risk posed by climate change to the financial sector. This new report includes many of the proposals we called for our legislation, the Addressing Climate Financial Risk Act:

Climate change is an existential threat to our planet and greatly endangers our financial sector. Extreme weather events – like hurricanes, wildfires or the recent storms in California – pose a serious risk to everything from commodity prices to insurance rates to home values.

Three years ago, a gunman motivated by antisemitic and anti-immigrant conspiracies killed 11 Jewish people at a synagogue in Pittsburgh. As we remember those lost, we must never stop working to stamp out the dangerous and deadly antisemitic rhetoric that inspired this tragedy.

We’re urging the Department of the Interior to continue to review oil and gas drilling activity in Santa Barbara County based on project-specific habitat conservation. Proposed changes could lead to endangerment of surrounding communities and ecosystems.

Registration opens tomorrow for @CalQuake’s Brace and Bolt Program, including new grants for low-income applicants. This program provides grants to Californians to help protect homes from earthquake damage. See if you qualify and find more info here:
JUST IN: FEMA has extended the deadline to apply for disaster assistance to November 8. If you live in Lassen, Plumas, Nevada, Placer, Tehama or Trinity counties, you may be eligible.

As #BreastCancerAwarenessMonth comes to a close, I encourage everyone to consider purchasing Breast Cancer Research Stamps. These stamps are valid for first-class mail and help fund important research. The stamp has raised nearly $93 million since its creation.

This report confirms that military aviators and crew are far more likely to be diagnosed with certain cancers than other airmen. I look forward to receiving the Defense Health Agency report to obtain answers on cancer rates among aviators and crew across all military branches.

CALIFORNIANS: If you live in Lassen, Nevada, Placer, Plumas, Tehama or Trinity counties, TODAY is the LAST day to apply for assistance from @FEMA and @SBA if you were affected by recent wildfires. More info here:

Thanks to vaccines, polio has almost been eradicated from the world. Only two wild polio cases have been reported worldwide this year. We must continue to listen to science if we’re to finally defeat polio and other deadly illnesses. #WorldPolioDay

California-based nonprofits affected by recent wildfires can apply for federal disaster loans through @SBAgov. Applicants can receive up to $2 million to fix or replace damaged or destroyed property. The deadline to apply is November 23.

Unused or expired prescription medications pose an urgent health and safety issue. Tomorrow, National Prescription Drug Take Back Day, anyone with leftover or unwanted prescription medications can safely dispose of them at designated collection sites:

More than 16,000 firefighters have battled blazes across the West this year, and they deserve our great appreciation. These brave women and men put their lives at risk to protect our communities, and I thank every one of them for their work.

Latina women have to work almost 23 months to earn the same amount on average as a white man earns in 12 months. The Paycheck Fairness Act is commonsense legislation that will help close the egregious pay gap. It deserves a vote. #LatinaEqualPayDay

I applaud the San Diego County Board of Supervisors for taking action to rid ghost guns from the county. These weapons don’t have serial numbers, making them popular among criminals as it’s harder for law enforcement to trace them. We must get them off our streets.

Voting is the foundation of our democracy. The Freedom to Vote Act would preserve the integrity of our elections by ensuring every person has equal access to the ballot. Congress can’t sit idly by while the sacred right to vote is under attack.

CALIFORNIANS: If you live in Lassen, Nevada, Placer, Plumas, Tehama or Trinity counties, October 25 is the LAST day to apply for assistance from @FEMA and @SBAgov if you were affected by recent wildfires. More info here:
It’s time to end offshore drilling. Read my op-ed with @RepMikeLevin, @RepHuffman  and @RepLowenthal on the recent oil spill off the coast of Southern California:

Californians know all too well the dangers of off shore drilling and the effects of oil spills: oil-covered wildlife washing up on the sand, popular beaches closed, whole ecosystems devastated.  The images we see of these tragedies speak for themselves.

USA Today is right: Vaccination requirements work and could decrease the risk of transmission during air travel as well as after the plane lands. As the holiday season approaches, we must do all we can to avoid another deadly surge.

October is National Domestic Violence Awareness and Prevention Month. Every year, far too many Americans are the victims of violence at the hands of someone close to them. We must continue to support survivors and work to hold perpetrators accountable.

I want to thank Chairman Leahy and my colleagues on the committee for their leadership on these important issues. I look forward to working with them to keep moving these bills through Congress and get them to the president’s desk.

The package of government funding bills released by the Senate Appropriations Committee reflects significant investments for California. I’m particularly pleased that the committee is taking the threat of climate change seriously.

CDC studies continue to show that getting vaccinated greatly reduces the risk of severe COVID-19 outcomes. In August, unvaccinated individuals were 11 times more likely to die from COVID-19 than those fully vaccinated.

Nearly $7 billion has been distributed to Californians through the newly expanded Biden Child Tax Credit. This money will help reduce child poverty and ensure no child goes to bed hungry. If you haven’t been receiving payments, check your eligibility here:

My deepest condolences to Alma Powell and the Powell family on the passing of General Colin Powell. He was truly a great statesman and a man of deep integrity. I hope that people will reflect on his passing and remember a man who served his country with compassion and honor.

Thank you to two of the country’s leading experts on COVID-19, Dr. Ezekiel Emanuel and Dr. John Moore, for their support of my bill to require proof of vaccination, a negative test or proof of recovery for domestic flights to help end this pandemic.

California’s Hispanic community is central to our state’s identity. Latinos make invaluable contributions to the economy and the country as a whole, and we must continue to work to ensure everyone can achieve the American dream. #HispanicHeritageMonth
Over the summer, I wrote an op-ed in the @SDUT going further in-depth into the problem ghost guns present. Read it here:

Glad to see @AGRobBonta joining this lawsuit against manufacturers of ghost guns. These untraceable weapons are increasingly being used in crimes, making it even harder for law enforcement to do their jobs. We must get these weapons off our streets.

I’m pleased @BigCitiesHealth endorsed my legislation to require a vaccine, a negative test or proof of recovery from COVID-19 to fly on domestic flights. The COVID-19 vaccines are safe, effective and our ticket to ending this pandemic.

REMINDER: The expanded Biden Child Tax Credit is disbursed to families across the nation on the 15th of the month. There are three more scheduled payments this year. If you haven’t been receiving these payments, check your eligibility here:
Happy 246th birthday @USNavy! Thank you to all our sailors – past and present – who have sacrificed so much in defense of our nation. I hope everyone has a great celebration.

It’s #BreastCancerAwarenessMonth. When sending mail this month, I encourage everyone to consider using Breast Cancer Research Stamps. These 75-cent stamps cover the cost of postage, while also contributing to important research.

The recent oil spill in Orange County underscores the need to transition from fossil fuels to cleaner energy. Congress should include our ban on new offshore drilling leases off the West Coast in the reconciliation bill. Read more:

Applications for SBA Disaster Loans relating to property damage from the Caldor Fire are due November 12. Small businesses and eligible private nonprofits can apply for up to $2 million to repair or replace property. Find more info here:

I was pleased to support the San Diego-Tijuana region’s application for the World Design Capital designation. This award would recognize the innovative designs that reflect the cross-border region’s unique economic, social, cultural and environmental developments.

California is our nation’s leading agricultural state. Known for producing almost all of the nuts grown in the United States, as well as the most avocados, grapes, strawberries and more, California is the heart of our nation’s agricultural economy. #NationalFarmersDay

Earlier this year we wrote to the administration urging it to take this action. I applaud the Biden administration for working to preserve history while also protecting the environment and surrounding ecosystems. This is a smart decision.

I’m glad the Biden administration is restoring protections to Bears Ears and Grand Staircase-Escalante National Monuments. These are some of the most beautiful and unique landscapes in the country and are home to historical tribal settlements.

I’m proud to cosponsor the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act. Amid attempts by Republican-controlled state legislatures around the country to make it harder to vote, we must pass this bill to ensure EVERYONE can participate in our democracy.

We’re calling on @SecretaryPete Buttigieg to investigate the oil spill off California’s coast. The investigation must be transparent and the results made public. Amplify Energy, the pipeline’s owner, has a history of violating safety regulations and Californians deserve answers.

One of those recommendations is for Congress to pass the Protecting Our Democracy Act, a bill I’m proud to cosponsor. This bill would strengthen the guardrails of our democracy, ensuring our institutions cannot be abused by those in power.

Chairman Durbin’s report on DOJ’s involvement in President Trump’s attempts to overturn the 2020 election is important. It sheds light on the actions of high-ranking officials and offers recommendations on how to help prevent these undemocratic acts from happening again.

Our bill to ban offshore drilling off the West Coast needs to be included in the budget reconciliation bill. The oil spill in Orange County is just the latest reminder that we must transition to cleaner forms of energy and we can start by banning new offshore drilling.

This morning I was proud to introduce Judge Lucy Koh, President Biden’s nominee to the 9th Circuit Court of Appeals, at her hearing before the Judiciary Committee. She’s more than qualified to serve on the 9th circuit and I encourage my colleagues to support her nomination.

Take some time this #FirePreventionWeek to learn important tips about fire safety. While wildfires are our focus right now, structure fires can be just as dangerous. Find important info on how to prepare and protect your family from fire:

This oil spill off the coast of Orange County is further evidence that we MUST end the practice of offshore drilling. The environmental and ecological damage from this one spill is immense. Congress needs to vote on our bill to ban new offshore drilling off the West Coast ASAP.
This week is #MentalIllnessAwarenessWeek. @NAMICommunicate has great resources for those seeking help with mental health. Visit   for more information.

Hundreds of children are abducted every year, often by a parent, and taken to foreign countries. This leaves little recourse for the custodial parent. We’re working with the DOJ to ensure enforcement of the International Parental Kidnapping Crime Act.

Congratulations to @UCSF’s own David Julius and @ScrippsResearch’s Ardem Patapoutian on being awarded the Nobel Prize in Medicine for their discoveries of how we sense temperature and touch. Well done!
Californians have made it clear: We don’t want oil drilling off our coast. It’s time to stop dangerous offshore drilling and invest in safer, cleaner energy solutions.

This spill highlights why we must also take action to prevent future spills, including passing the West Coast Ocean Protection Act. Our bill would permanently ban oil and gas drilling in federal waters off the coast of California, Oregon and Washington.

The oil spill off the coast of Orange County reiterates the perils of offshore drilling. A pipeline failure has leaked an estimated 126,000 gallons of oil, killing aquatic wildlife, threatening the health of local communities and forcing several beaches to close.

While everyone recognizes those in front of the camera, the heart of the entertainment industry lies behind the scenes. I joined @SenAlexPadilla and @RepAdamSchiff to call for good-faith negotiations to improve wages and working conditions on sets.
As we see more and more hacks and ransomware attacks in the news, please take a moment during #CybersecurityAwarenessMonth to review best practices to keep your digital information safe.
You can also purchase Breast Cancer Research Stamps at your local @RiteAid. My thanks to Rite Aid for making a big push to raise money for breast cancer research.

In 1998, I helped create the Breast Cancer Research Stamp. Since then it has raised more than $92 million for research. As we mark the start of #BreastCancerAwarenessMonth, I encourage everyone to consider purchasing these stamps through @USPS.

Cesar Chavez dedicated his life to improving that of farmworkers across California and the nation. It’s in his shadow that we continue the fight to improve the lives of all workers, especially farmworkers. #HispanicHeritageMonth

The worst mass shooting in American history occurred four years ago today in Las Vegas. As we remember the 60 people killed and more than 860 people injured, we must continue efforts to pass commonsense gun safety legislation.

As we negotiate long-term government funding and infrastructure legislation, Congress must recognize that these intense wildfires and droughts are being driven by climate change. We must pass a package that accepts that reality and addresses the climate crisis we’re facing.

It provides $29 billion in relief for victims of wildfires, will address the shortage of federal wildland firefighters and provide $200 million to western states experiencing drought. It also invests nearly $240 million to improve California’s water infrastructure.

Congress passed a bill today that will keep the government open as we continue to debate long-term funding priorities. That bill included a disaster supplemental with important wildfire and drought provisions for California.

President Biden nominated two more outstanding Californians to be federal judges – Judges Linda Lopez and Jinsook Ohta. Both are well qualified. The president is keeping his commitment to make the federal bench more representative in both background and professional experience.

I’m proud to support Rachael Rollins’ nomination to be U.S. attorney for Massachusetts. When evaluating nominees from around the country, it’s important to hear the opinions of those who know the nominee best. Listen to the support Ms. Rollins has from her own community:

LA’s own Dynasty Taylor was recognized this week on  @PointsOfLight’s Inspiration Honor Roll. Her organization, Dynasty’s United Youth Association, helps ensure youth have access to the resources they need to be successful. Congratulations Dynasty!
Thanks for stopping by @MayorToddGloria. I appreciate your partnership on important issues and I look forward to our continued efforts to clean up the Tijuana River Valley and address homelessness.

We can’t allow upcoming holiday air travel to contribute to another surge in COVID cases. Today I introduced legislation requiring passengers on domestic flights to be vaccinated, test negative or be fully recovered from a previous COVID illness.

COVID-19 booster shots are now available for those fully vaccinated with the Pfizer vaccine who are either older than 65, have an underlying medical condition or work a frontline job. Vaccines are safe and effective and boosters help improve protection for at-risk people.
Protections for California renters are set to expire this week. If you’re behind on your rent, you can still apply for rent relief covering up to 100% of costs. Visit   for more info.

On #NationalVoterRegistrationDay, I encourage everyone who isn’t registered to vote to do so, and if you’re already registered, make sure your registration is still accurate. Elections are the bedrock of our democracy and everyone should participate.

There’s been an alarming increase in the use of these guns in crimes recently and we must take strong action to prevent their proliferation. Read the op-ed I wrote last month in the @SDUT about ghost guns:

I applaud @MayorToddGloria, @MarniVonWilpert and the San Diego City Council for working to rid our streets of unregistered, untraceable firearms known as ghost guns. These weapons exploit loopholes in the law by being sold not as a completed gun, but as separate parts.

Only take medications prescribed by a doctor and dispensed by a licensed pharmacist. It could be the difference between life and death. Visit   to learn more about how to spot and avoid counterfeit pills. #OnePillCanKill

There has been a steep increase in the lethality and availability of fake prescription drugs laced with fentanyl and methamphetamine. The DEA is warning of fake pills being marketed as legitimate and killing unsuspecting Americans.

On Gold Star Mother’s and Family’s Day, take a moment to think of those who sacrificed everything to protect our country and freedom. To the families that lost loved ones in the line of duty, my heart breaks for you. Please know that support is available.

We must take significant action to fight climate change and preserve our public lands for future generations. That’s why I support the creation of a Civilian Climate Corps. It will help mitigate the worst effects of climate change, which we’re already seeing. #PublicLandsDay

California is home to some of the most scenic environments in the world. But climate change poses a direct threat to these beautiful public lands. Giant sequoias – some of the tallest and oldest trees – are threatened by wildfire in Northern California.

The FDA and CDC have approved the use of booster shots of the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine for those over the age of 65, those with underlying medical conditions and those working frontline jobs. Vaccines are working, helping prevent the worst outcomes for those who get sick.

These intense wildfires and droughts are a direct result of climate change. As we work to drastically reduce carbon emissions, this disaster supplemental recognizes the reality that we’re dealing with the effects of climate change right now and provides some much-needed relief.

It provides $200 million to help communities in the West that are experiencing severe drought. And it approves nearly $240 million to improve California’s water infrastructure so we can continue to prepare for future droughts.

It includes nearly $29 billion in relief for victims of wildfires and natural disasters, including farmers who lost crops in the recent wildfires. It would also help recruit and retain more federal firefighters by lifting the overtime pay cap so they’re more fairly compensated.
Wildfire and drought are two of California’s greatest concerns. The disaster supplemental bill includes significant funding that I have supported to address these critical challenges.

In May, @SenAlexPadilla and I encouraged the administration to use California’s rules as a national model, and this is a good step in that direction. I look forward to more action decreasing the use of these harmful gases.
I applaud the Biden administration for taking strong action against hydrofluorocarbons. These greenhouse gases are less common but more potent than carbon dioxide.

California’s eviction moratorium ends September 30. If you need help staying in your home after that date, eligible renters can apply for assistance covering up to 100% of unpaid rent and utilities. Don’t wait to act. Find more information at
I joined with @RepCarbajal to introduce a bill to modernize the law and allow the families to be properly compensated by the boat’s owner for their loss.
The families of those who perished in the tragic Conception boat fire may not receive any compensation because of an outdated 170-year-old maritime law.

The Work Opportunity Tax Credit encourages employers to hire workers facing barriers to employment like veterans, food stamp recipients and the long-term unemployed. It’s a program that helps business owners AND those looking for work. More info here:

The Mississippi law, like the Texas ban, is a blatant attempt by a Republican legislature to undermine the constitutional right to abortion care. My colleagues and I filed an amicus brief in this case urging the court to follow precedent and protect women’s right to choose.

A woman’s right to choose to have an abortion has been settled law for nearly 50 years. The Supreme Court upheld that right repeatedly until it allowed a recent Texas abortion ban to stand. The court is now set to rule on a similar Mississippi law.

CALIFORNIANS: If you live in Lassen, Nevada, Placer, Plumas, Tehama or Trinity counties and have been affected by wildfire, you’re eligible to apply for FEMA aid. More counties will become available soon, but those eligible now can apply here:

California is in the middle of one of the worst, most destructive wildfire years in history. We’re calling on Senate leadership to accept California’s request for at least $7.7 billion in disaster relief funding in upcoming legislation.
Most families with children qualify for #ChildTaxCredit payments, and three more are scheduled for this year. If you haven’t received a check yet, visit:
Happy birthday @USAirForce! Thank you for protecting our skies and keeping our country safe.

We’re calling on Senate leadership to include funding for wildfire fuel reduction projects in any infrastructure legislation. Millions of acres have burned in the West this year and we must do all we can to lower the risk of destruction. Read our letter here:

Pleased to see that @SDMTS will receive $140 million from the American Rescue Plan passed earlier this year. This funding will go a long way toward maintaining and improving public transportation in the San Diego area as we recover from this pandemic.

Federal assistance is available for Californians affected by wildfire. If you live in Lassen, Nevada, Placer or Plumas counties, you’re eligible to apply for FEMA aid. Aid for more counties will become available soon, but those eligible now can apply here:

I’m glad the House Ways and Means Committee added several of my provisions to the reconciliation package. They include critical investments in many areas, from battling climate change to COVID-19 recovery to rebuilding the IRS so it can enforce tax laws.
G'mar chatima tova to all observing Yom Kippur. Wishing you an easy fast and peaceful holiday.

Over the years, I’ve met with these brave athletes on a number of occasions. Today's hearing was heart-wrenching and it’s more clear than ever that the abuse and systemic failures that happened to these young women must never happen again.
Welcome to Twitter @KarenJHanrahan! I’m grateful for all you’ve done for San Francisco at GLIDE.

California’s diversity is core to our state’s identity. As we mark #HispanicHeritageMonth, I’m proud to recognize and celebrate all the contributions the Latino community has made in shaping California into the great state it is today.

The Senate again voted unanimously to pass our bill to end the use of drift gillnets and help the fishing industry transition to more sustainable practices. These nets indiscriminately kill whales, dolphins and turtles and have no place in our waters.

Today we heard from the gymnasts who were failed by the FBI when it neglected to properly investigate the abuse by Larry Nassar.  I’ve met several times with these brave women. Their strength and courage is astonishing. They’re role models for all of us.

If you live in wildfire-prone areas, it’s vital to maintain an evacuation kit. We know all too well that fires can change direction and intensity very quickly so being ready to evacuate at a moment's notice is imperative.

This is more evidence of the damage climate change is inflicting. This creek is now 10 degrees warmer than average, leading to the death of thousands of Chinook salmon. These fish are another indicator of what’s to come if we don’t take bold action now.

Small businesses are the backbone of our economy and we must continue to do all we can to support them as the economy recovers. This #SmallBusinessWeek, I encourage you to support your community’s economy and shop local!

Federal assistance is now available for Californians affected by wildfire living in Lassen, Nevada, Placer and Plumas counties. More assistance will become available soon but those eligible now should apply here:

With wildfires burning across the western United States, it’s important to protect yourself from toxic smoke. Smoke can travel long distances, so even if you’re not near a fire, you may still be breathing in toxins. Find tips to protect your health:

20 years later, we still mourn the nearly 3,000 lives lost on 9/11 and those who jeopardized their health to respond to the attacks. I am forever grateful for those first responders and everyone who has sacrificed so much to ensure an attack like this never happens again.

In the event of evacuation, it’s imperative to have all essential supplies ready to grab and go. Creating an evacuation kit with extra supplies such as clothes, medicine, financial information and more will reduce time needed to evacuate.
No matter what you’re going through, help is always accessible. The National Suicide Prevention Hotline is free and available 24/7 at 1-800-273-8255. #WorldSuicidePreventionDay

I’m glad the Biden administration is moving to block the extreme Texas abortion law. Similar laws have been repeatedly struck down, so it’s alarming that this law was allowed to stand. Texas women shouldn’t be denied their legal rights while this law is litigated in the courts.
It can’t be said enough: Thank you to all the firefighters working around the clock in California battling historic wildfires. Your efforts are truly heroic and appreciated by all. Thank you!

Removing brush and other flammable materials from the area directly around your house can help prevent fire from reaching your home. And using fire-resistant building materials greatly increases a home’s chances of survival. Find more information here:

I’m so glad to hear Senator Klobuchar is doing well following her diagnosis of breast cancer. This is a reminder that regular testing is critical. We’ve made great strides in research and treatment and I’m hopeful one day we’ll eliminate this disease once and for all.

Tracking wildfires requires staying up to date on the news reports as well as information reported by firefighting authorities. Be sure to frequently check with local fire authorities and sign up for text message notifications from @CAL_FIRE.

I applaud President Biden’s plan to produce 45 percent of the nation’s energy from solar power by 2050. Investing in and expanding clean, renewable energy sources is necessary to confront the dangerous effects of climate change. Inaction isn’t an option.

We need action at every level of government to end the recent wave of violence linked to ghost guns. Untraceable firearms have no business on our streets and I’m glad the board of supervisors has taken this action. Read my recent op-ed on the problem here:

The San Francisco Board of Supervisors’ decision to ban untraceable ghost guns will save lives and reduce crime. San Francisco has taken the lead on this important issue, and I’m hopeful that more localities will follow suit.
The large majority of wildfires are caused by human activity. Find the Interior Department’s top 10 tips to avoid starting wildfires here:

Congress created the Provider Relief Fund to ensure our hospitals and other health care providers can continue to offer care during the pandemic. These funds should be released without any further delay. Read our letter urging a quick distribution of the remaining funds.

There are 15 more vacancies in California that still need to be filled immediately and more expected next year. I look forward to working with President Biden and Senator Padilla to fill the remaining vacancies with well-qualified candidates who reflect the makeup of the state.

I’m particularly proud to see so many women stepping forward to be judges. Women represent only about one-quarter of the active judges on the federal district courts in California, despite making up more than half of the population in the state.

These first six nominees to the federal courts in California highlight the strength and diversity of our great state. After reviewing more than 300 applications to the federal judiciary, I’m confident that these nominees will make outstanding jurists.

As we recover from this pandemic we must prioritize getting people back to work, an effort that will require significant investment in education and skills training. #NationalWorkforceDevelopmentMonth

Even after a fire is extinguished, there is still potential danger. After receiving word from officials that it’s safe to return home, check your property for any lingering fires or hot spots. Follow Cal Fire’s checklist to ensure your home is safe.
Wishing everyone celebrating #RoshHashanah a happy new year. Shanah tovah!

Working Americans are at the heart of our nation, and the American Dream remains a defining characteristic of our country. Let's use this #LaborDay to recommit ourselves to fair wages, healthy workplaces and retirement security for all. Happy Labor Day.
I joined @SenJeffMerkley and a number of senators and representatives to urge the Biden administration to ensure humanitarian aid continues to reach desperate Afghans despite the Taliban's takeover.

Today I joined @SenBlumenthal in calling on Justice Department leadership to testify at an upcoming Judiciary Committee hearing on how the FBI mishandled allegations against former USA Gymnastics physician Larry Nassar. Read more here:

The Low-Income Housing Tax Credit is our best tool to create more affordable housing. Read my letter with @SenAlexPadilla calling on Senate leadership to expand access to this program in the Senate's reconciliation package.
I joined @SenJeffMerkley and several of our colleagues today in calling on the Biden administration to take steps to curb plastic pollution at America’s national parks.

If the Supreme Court allows the Texas abortion ban to stand, it will be the end of Roe v. Wade, turning the clock back 50 years for women’s reproductive rights and would threaten other bedrock Supreme Court decisions.
Roe v. Wade has been the law for nearly 50 years and has been upheld in court dozens of times. I remember the days when abortion was illegal and we simply can’t return to those times.
The Texas abortion law that went into effect yesterday is an assault on women’s reproductive rights. Similar laws have been struck down as unconstitutional and this one should be too.
Read my statement with @SenAlexPadilla on the Presidential Emergency Declaration for the Caldor Fire.
We cannot allow these attacks on a woman’s right to choose to continue. We must continue to fight to protect the rights guaranteed by Roe v. Wade.

A new Texas state law took effect today that bans most abortions after just six weeks of pregnancy. Nearly half a century after the Supreme Court guaranteed the right to abortion, it’s shameful the courts didn’t step in to block this unconstitutional law.

I just received my morning briefing on the Caldor Fire. Heroic efforts by firefighters kept the fire from advancing toward South Lake Tahoe Tuesday night and into this morning. However, I urge everyone to remain cautious and follow all evacuation orders.
My thoughts are with @CVN_72 crew and families affected by yesterday’s Navy helicopter crash off the coast of San Diego.
The Red Cross continues to respond to wildfires throughout the state. Information on Red Cross activities as well as how you can donate is available here:
As wildfire evacuation orders expand, shelters will continue to open to accommodate Californians. Here’s the updated list of evacuation shelters as well as small and large animal shelters.
I will continue to monitor the situation and encourage anyone who can’t find a shelter location or needs additional assistance to contact my office and we’ll do all we can to help.
I’ve been in contact with federal and state emergency officials to ensure they have every available resource. I’m grateful to crews that have traveled across the state and country to fight this fire.

The #CaldorFire crossed containment lines over the weekend, putting the Lake Tahoe Basin, particularly South Lake Tahoe, at risk. I encourage everyone to stay safe by following all evacuation orders. Failure to do so puts yourself and the firefighters in danger.

Wildfires are displacing thousands from their homes in Northern California. There are a number of shelters open with plenty of space for families and individuals who have been evacuated. Find an up-to-date list of open shelters here:

The FDA made the right decision to block the sale of 55,000 flavored e-cigarette products. With flavors like Apple Crumble, Dr. Cola and Cinnamon Toast Cereal, it’s clear these products are marketed toward young, first-time users and are driving the youth vaping crisis.

I’m glad BART will receive nearly $331 million in recovery funding to help ensure the trains continue to run on time. Keeping mass transit up and running is key to getting people back to work as we continue to recover from the COVID-19 pandemic.

As long as these fires burn and evacuation orders are in place, the state will help those families who are displaced. I encourage anyone who can’t find a shelter location to contact my office and we’ll do all we can to help.

Thousands of spaces remain in these shelters and I encourage Californians to take advantage of these services until they can return to their homes. Reports that some evacuees are running out of money and may not have a place to stay are unacceptable.

The devastating wildfires burning in Northern California are displacing thousands of Californians. Thankfully, the state has established a number of evacuation sites to provide shelter for families and individuals forced to leave their homes.
New evacuation warnings and orders have been issued for areas near the #CaldorFire in El Dorado and Alpine counties. Please adhere to all guidance from local authorities.
Read my statement on today’s terrorist attacks in Kabul:
Thank you to President Biden for declaring a major disaster in California for the wildfires that continue to destroy homes and upend lives. We must do all we can to help these families.
We must crack down on these weapons and pass commonsense legislation to rid our streets of untraceable guns. Read my op-ed:

In San Francisco, the number of ghost guns confiscated has increased from six in 2016 to 164 in 2020. In LA, they now account for a third of all weapons recovered by police. In Oakland, 147 were confiscated in the first six months of 2021, compared to just 43 in all of 2020.

Ghost guns — unregistered, untraceable firearms — are increasingly being used by criminals to avoid attention or background checks. The manufacturers of these weapons evade current federal regulations that apply to normal firearms.

Air quality is poor across much of Northern California. Wildfire smoke can be toxic so be sure to frequently check the air quality near you. Find tips on how to best protect your lungs and health here:

The Defense Department’s FireGuard program uses DOD resources to detect and track wildfires. I’m pleased the Defense Department agreed to extend this critical program that will help firefighters and save property and lives. Read more here:

I’m glad the SEC has granted a request to allow thousands of wildfire victims to keep payments from a settlement reached with PG&E. They deserve full compensation and we’re grateful the SEC worked with the victims to find a solution.

California is battling multiple wildfires simultaneously. The Dixie Fire has already burned more than 725,000 acres, making it one of the largest in our state’s history. President Biden should issue a major disaster declaration to bolster our response to these historic fires.
It’s important to have an evacuation kit and a plan to escape should a wildfire threaten your home. Find tips on putting together an emergency supply kit and how to plan escape routes here:

It’s literally a matter of life and death. It will protect you from being hospitalized and drastically lower the chances that contracting the virus will lead to death. FDA’s full approval of the COVID-19 vaccine should boost confidence for those who have yet to get the vaccine.

One report showed prenatal exposure to phthalates can have lasting consequences on children’s brain development and increase children’s risks for learning, attention and behavior disorders. It’s time to get these harmful chemicals out of our food supply.

These chemicals, often added to plastic products used in food production, can cause serious health problems. They’re known to leach into food through plastic products such as tubing, lid gaskets, food preparation gloves, conveyor belts and food packaging materials.

Proud to introduce the Preventing Harmful Exposure to Phthalates Act with @SenGillibrand, @RepTedLieu and @RepKatiePorter. This bill would help prevent toxic phthalate chemicals from contaminating the U.S. food supply.

@SenAlexPadilla @POTUS This is important. Glad to see President Biden heeding our calls to build on California’s strongest-in-the-nation fuel emission standards. Transportation emissions are a driver of climate change and we must cut them quickly.

Our bill would help make electric cars affordable to more people and move us closer to a point where high-pollution, gas-powered cars are off the roads. We need more legislation like this to incentivize behavior that will reduce global warming, and I’m proud to lead this bill.

We know that passenger vehicles account for nearly one-third of all carbon emissions in the U.S. California has already taken the lead in shifting away from fossil fuels and the internal combustion engine; now it’s time for the nation to follow.

California desperately needs an infusion of funds to repair roads and bridges, improve and expand public transit, modernize dated water systems, upgrade our electricity grid, prepare for wildfires and more. I’m pleased this bill directs significant funds to California.

California’s success drives the nation, but much of our infrastructure is ancient. We need to create jobs, modernize our infrastructure, reduce carbon emissions and improve living standards, and this bill will help gets us there.

I’m very sad to hear about the passing of Carl Levin. I served with Carl for more than 20 years and came to hold great respect and fondness for him. He was a brilliant man who knew how to bring people together to solve problems, a role model for so many of us in the Senate.

Today I introduced legislation to strengthen protections for congressional whistleblowers by allowing them to seek relief in the courts if existing processes fail to protect them.

Congressional whistleblowers safeguard our democracy by reporting fraud, waste and abuse. Retaliation against them, including threatening their jobs or safety, has a chilling effect that threatens the ability of Congress to conduct oversight.
