There would be bipartisan support for a serious, targeted infrastructure plan. Unfortunately, less than 6% of this massive White House proposal would go to roads and bridges. It would spend more on electric cars than on roads, bridges, ports, airports, and waterways combined.

It’s a modern medical miracle that three safe and effective COVID-19 vaccines were produced in less than one year. Thanks to hardworking Kentuckians at the McKesson facility in Shepherdsville, those vaccines are being distributed all across the country.

The border crisis is not just seasonal. CBP is tracking the largest surge in apprehensions in 20 years. Unaccompanied children are piling up in close quarters.   It turns out when politicians spend a two-year campaign advertising a porous border and amnesty, people listen.

Democrats’ attempted elections takeover has state and local officials sounding alarms. They say its unworkable provisions would invite total chaos in our elections. Even Democratic officials. No wonder Democrats want to talk about everything except what's actually in their bill.

Democrats' H.R. 1 would leave elections more vulnerable to cheating, send taxpayer dollars to subsidize campaigns, and would turn the bipartisan Federal Election Commission into a Democrat-controlled partisan body. It’s not about protecting voting. It’s about rigging the system.
Tune in now to @FoxNews: I am joining @DanaPerino and @BillHemmer to discuss the crisis at our southern border and the Democrats' plan for a partisan takeover of America’s election systems.

H.R. 1 is the Democrats’ plan to take over the American election system and have it run by Washington bureaucrats. Democrats want to force all kinds of unpopular changes on all 50 states because they believe it would benefit their side.

Senate Democrats just spent the last four years using the legislative filibuster and talking constantly about how important it was. Their reversals aren’t about principle. It’s just raw power. And their excuses insult the intelligence of the American people.

A key purpose of the Senate was to ensure all parts of the country have a voice.   Leaders from New York and California want to break the Senate’s rules on legislation because they want to steamroll the interests of Kentucky and Middle America.

Secretary Mayorkas testified “the border is secure and the border is not open.” So either @fema has been deployed just to admire a situation going smoothly... or the Biden Administration is not being straight with the American people.

The science on getting kids back in school is crystal clear. Every day the Biden Administration does not urge schools to reopen safely right now with simple precautions, the most vulnerable kids pay the price.

The Administration claims their top priority is to beat this virus and end the pandemic. But their nominee to run @HHSGov is woefully unqualified. California AG Xavier Becerra is a partisan politician with no expertise in healthcare.
If Democrats break the Senate rules and kill the filibuster by a 50-50 vote, they will regret it. The pendulum would swing both ways, and it would swing hard.

My definition of a crisis is when you send the Federal Emergency Management Agency, which only goes to emergencies, down to the border.  This is a crisis. The Administration created it, and they own it.

Eliminating the legislative filibuster is not in the best interest of the country, no matter which party is in control. Anyone who really understands the Senate knows that steamrolling the rules wouldn't fast-track policymaking. Everything would grind to a halt.

Top Democrats’ drive to break Senate rules is shamelessly hypocritical. Just two years ago, they called the filibuster an essential part of the Senate that should never go away.  Apparently their only principle is that they want Democrats to have all the power, all the time.
Tune in now to @FoxNews. I am joining @HARRISFAULKNER to discuss Democrats’ border crisis and the importance of preserving Senate rules on legislation.

Breaking Senate rules to kill the filibuster would not open up an express lane to liberal change. It would not open up an express lane for the Biden presidency to speed into the history books. The Senate would function more like a hundred-car pile-up. Nothing moving.

I'm glad @SecBlinken and @SecDef are engaging with key Asian allies Japan and South Korea this week. We need to work together to defend against threats from China and North Korea and stand up for democracy in Burma in the face of military dictatorship.

Why did President Biden tell Americans to wait until July 4th to gather in ways that cities, states, and the CDC approve right now? Why did he present a million vaccines per day as a personal “Mission Accomplished” moment when it’s simply the pace Democrats inherited in January?

On Thursday, President Biden spoke in a heartfelt way about grief and loss. But his vision for the road ahead missed the mark. His proclamations broke with Dr. Fauci and his own CDC and ignored what Americans are already doing now. It was like a speech for an alternate universe.

House Democrats' H.R. 1 is a partisan assault on elections. It directly targets political speech and would centralize control of elections in all 50 states in Washington Democrats’ hands.  A dramatic one-party power grab over the way Americans vote.

In 2020, Senate Republicans led Congress to pass five historic bipartisan bills.  Because of that, the American people have been marching toward victory. Democrats just want to sprint to the front of that parade and claim the credit.

Our country has endured one of the most painful years in memory. But the dark times have spotlighted the best of America.    This year’s recovery will ride an already turning tide. Not because of a Democrats’ latest partisan bill, but because of the resilience of our people.

Last Congress, Sen. Schumer and Democrats used the filibuster frequently. And I respected the institution more than any short-term advantage we might have achieved if we’d eliminated it.    Majorities come and go, but the essence of the Senate stays.

President Biden's spending bill is a classic example of big Democratic overreach in the name of COVID relief. It manages to spend only ~1% on vaccinations and less than 9% on the entire health fight.  This is by far one of the worst pieces of legislation I've seen in the Senate.

The Administration is flailing and failing on our southern border. The number of unaccompanied children has tripled in two weeks.  The White House keeps saying “Now is not the time to come.” So there will be a good time in the future to break federal law and come illegally?

I’ve voted for several of President Biden’s nominees. But his choices to lead Interior and the EPA appear eager to restart the left’s war on domestic energy. Kentuckians know that when radical policies are on the table, it means their jobs and pocketbooks are on the menu.

House Democrats’ attempt to forcibly rewrite 50 states’ election laws would weaken voter I.D., mass legalize ballot harvesting, and let a partisan FEC poke around in more of citizens' political speech. No wonder the only thing bipartisan about the bill was the vote against it.

Senator Blunt has tackled so much important work for Missouri and our country and has been an enormous asset to all his colleagues. I’m very sorry he’ll be stepping away but am glad the country has two more years to keep benefitting from his talent. My full statement:

Instead of working together to fight COVID-19, Democrats decided to exploit the crisis by jamming through unrelated liberal policies they couldn’t pass honestly. A colossal missed opportunity for the American people. My full statement:

Democrats said they’d exploit COVID to “restructure things to fit our vision.” Sure enough: Only 9% of their bill for the entire health fight. Only 1% for vaccines. All this borrowed money for a parade of unrelated policies that even left-wing experts say are badly targeted.

We're already set to come roaring back — not due to this liberal spending spree. Democrats inherited a tide that was already turning. We could have worked together to do something smart & bipartisan to finish this fight ASAP. Democrats decided to do something else.

I am continuing to monitor severe flooding across Kentucky. Yesterday I spoke with leaders in some of the hardest-hit counties. My staff and I are ready to do our part to get federal assistance to these communities.

TUNE IN NOW: I'm joining @marthamaccallum to discuss the urgent priorities Senate Republicans are focused on -- reopening schools, helping workers, and getting more Americans vaccinated -- and the liberal wish-list Democrats are pushing instead.

What the American people need are fast-acting plans to open schools now, get laid-off Americans into jobs, and finish the fight against COVID-19.   The Democrats’ plan doesn’t focus on that. It manages to spend ~$2T while leaving the most urgent things on the cutting room floor.
It was my honor to get to thank some of the @kentuckyguard who answered the call to help protect the Capitol. Your Congress and your country appreciate all you’ve done.

Less than 9% of Democrats' spending plan would go to directly fight COVID-19. Less than 1% to vaccinations.  This isn’t a recipe to safely reopen America. It’s what Democrats promised almost a year ago: Taking advantage of the crisis to check off unrelated liberal policies.

Only 1% of the Democrats’ partisan bill goes to vaccines. Less than 9% to the entire health effort. It backs the Big Labor myth that schools can’t reopen safely right now — yet only a small fraction of its K-12 money would go out this year. Liberal ideology, not families' needs.

More great news this morning as Kentuckians help turn the tide against COVID-19. The newly-approved Johnson & Johnson vaccine is now shipping out, thanks to workers at McKesson’s distribution facility in Shepherdsville.
The House’s partisan vote reflects a deliberately partisan process and a missed opportunity to meet Americans’ needs. My full statement:

Washington should focus on practical policies to finish this fight. Accelerate vaccinations. Get kids back in school. Help laid-off Americans get rehired. Instead, Democrats are pushing a partisan bill, packed with non-COVID-related spending & bad ideas that will slow recovery.
TUNE IN NOW: I am joining @BretBaier to discuss Republicans’ work to help our nation reopen and recover — and the $1.9T liberal spending plan the Democrats are focused on instead.

Only about 1% of the Democrats’ partisan plan goes to vaccines. Only about 5% of its K-12 funding would even go out this fiscal year.  Democrats are not addressing the urgent needs of a re-opening America. They started with a preconceived liberal wish-list and worked backwards.
This evening I joined congressional leaders on the Capitol steps in a moment of silence for the 500,000 American lives lost to the coronavirus.

Science and data disprove the Democrats' notion that K-12 schools need their new spending plan before they can open safely. Under their plan, about 95% of the K-12 money would not even go toward the current year’s budget. Stop letting Big Labor move the goalposts on our kids.

The facts are clear: In-person schooling is essential for kids and can be safe. France and Spain have been doing it. The U.K. will have kids back in two weeks. A study from our own CDC last month found that schools can operate safely. Why won't Democrats accept the science?

The partisan bill Democrats are preparing is stuffed with non-COVID-related liberal goals and more band-aid policies as if the country were going to stay shut down another year. We need 2021 to be different than 2020. Congress should focus on smart policies to help that happen.

Families across Kentucky are still recovering from a week of punishing weather. I am grateful to everyone who pitched in and helped their neighbors stay safe. My team and I are focused and ready to help in the recovery.

Rush Limbaugh was a generational media trailblazer. He gave a voice to millions of conservative Americans whom the mainstream media had not even tried to represent. His impact is impossible to overstate. May he rest in peace.

For the three and a half decades that my friend Richard Shelby has served in the Senate, the people of Alabama have had a true heavyweight champion in their corner. I’m glad our friend still has two more years to continue his important and effective work here in the Capitol.

Democrats' so-called relief bill includes Sen. Sanders’s minimum wage proposal that would kill 1.4M American jobs. This after the President killed many thousands of jobs with Keystone XL. Killing jobs and destroying opportunity — that's their idea of pandemic relief?

Democrats admitted last March: They see the pandemic as an opportunity to ram through ideological change.  That's why they are now pushing a sprawling $1.9T plan that even liberal economists say is poorly targeted to the urgent needs of our nation.

George Shultz was one of the great Americans of our time. Nobody better exemplified a thoughtful, principled, and patriotic commitment to public service. A scholar-statesman for the ages. My full statement:

Pres. Biden's own scientists agree school appears to be quite safe and we should get our kids back. Congress sent massive sums for K-12 schools in 2020. Hardly any of it has been spent yet. Federal funding is not the issue. It's Big Labor moving the goalposts on kids & parents.

We’ve heard a lot of talk about unity, but White House staff and congressional Democrats are working from the opposite playbook. Senate Republicans will be ready and waiting with a host of amendments to improve the rushed procedural step that’s being jammed through.

Science tells us that in-person school can be safe — and is crucial for children’s futures. We cannot keep this essential part of our society on indefinite hiatus. No more goalpost-moving from Big Labor. Kids have sacrificed enough. States and districts need to get this done.

Science has spoken and the evidence is clear: It is time to get kids back in school.  Experts say that with basic precautions, risks of transmission are low. And the costs of the online-only approach for kids are very high.

This morning, Congress honored Officer Brian D. Sicknick under the dome of the institution he swore to defend — and died defending.    In the face of lawlessness, Officer Sicknick paid the ultimate price. His name will never be forgotten.

First Navalny was poisoned. Now he’s been jailed. Peaceful protesters across Russia are being suppressed. Just the latest in Putin’s long campaign to subvert democracy and the rule of law. The U.S. and our allies must continue strong measures to hold Putin and cronies to account.

I’ve had good conversations with @POTUS and @SecBlinken about the need for a swift and decisive response from the U.S. and allies following the coup in Burma. Expect the Administration will quickly sanction the junta and defend democracy.

I’ve voted for several of President Biden’s mainstream cabinet nominees. But his choice to run Homeland Security was blasted by the Obama Administration’s own Inspector General for running an immigration law favor factory for powerful Democrats. Bad pick with major ethics issues.

I call on Burma’s military to immediately release the civilian political leaders of the country and turn back from this abyss. We need to support the people of Burma in their journey toward democracy and impose costs on those who stand in their way. My full statement:

The last four years showed U.S. prosperity, domestic energy security, and reducing emissions do not have to conflict.   This Piecemeal Green New Deal through liberal executive orders gets it dead wrong.   There's nothing green" about a tsunami of pink slips for American workers."

Today, I made clear that if Democrats ever attack the key Senate rules, it would drain the consent and comity out of the institution. A scorched-earth Senate would hardly be able to function. It wouldn’t be a progressive’s dream. It would be a nightmare. I guarantee it.

The Senate requires collaboration and deliberation. It’s a feature, not a bug, that slim majorities can't ram through half-baked ideas. My remarks on the legislative filibuster and why I stuck up for the minority’s rights even when Republicans had power:

I’m glad that two Senate Democrats confirmed today they will not vote to end the legislative filibuster. They agree with President Biden and me on protecting the Senate.   With this win, we can move forward with a 50-50 power-sharing agreement built on the 2001 precedent.
It was my honor to get to meet and thank some of the @KentuckyGuard who answered the call to help protect the Capitol and the inauguration.

The failed Paris deal will hurt American families while China and Russia grow emissions. The Keystone cancellation will kill union jobs and hurt U.S. energy security. And a proposal to gut immigration enforcement and give blanket amnesty? Rough day one" for American workers."

Minority rights on legislation are key to the Senate. President Biden spent decades defending them. More than two dozen Senate Democrats backed them just four years ago. This isn't complicated. Simply reaffirming that Democrats won't break the rules should not be a heavy lift.

Today, before the entire world, the greatest nation in history carried out another peaceful transfer of power. Congratulations to President Biden and Vice President Harris. I look forward to working together everywhere we can and differing respectfully when we must.

Tomorrow a new POTUS and VPOTUS will be sworn in. It will be secure because many other brave Americans have sworn their own oaths to support and defend our Constitution.   Thanks to the Capitol Police and all the federal & local personnel helping protect our democracy this week.

Today we honor one of our nation’s great heroes. Dr. King called on America to truly fulfill our founding principles and provide justice and opportunity for all. His work and his example have brought us a long way and they inspire us to keep working.
My full statement on the next seven days and the Senate schedule:

Our nation lost a remarkable American with the passing of Sheldon Adelson. Elaine and I send our condolences to Miriam, the entire Adelson family, and all who mourn today. May his memory be a great blessing.

The Senate grieves the death of the officer who literally put himself on the line to defend our first branch of gov’t and everybody who works inside it. Our condolences and our prayers are with Officer Sicknick’s family and his colleagues at this terrible time. My full statement:

The ultimate blame for yesterday’s events lies with the unhinged criminals who tried to disrupt our government and with those who incited them. But this fact does not preclude our addressing the shocking failures in the Capitol’s security posture and protocols. My full statement:
The United States and the Senate will not be intimidated.  We are back at our posts. We will discharge our duty under the Constitution for our nation. And we are going to do it tonight.
I will vote to respect the American people’s decision and defend our system of government. My full remarks:

I applaud the President’s decision to get billions of dollars of crucial COVID-19 relief out the door and into the hands of American families. I am glad the American people will receive this much-needed assistance as our nation continues battling this pandemic. My full statement:

Even in a dark winter, Christmas brings light. I am grateful for our healthcare heroes, the servicemembers who keep us safe, the modern miracle of safe and effective vaccines, and the blessing of our Savior's birth.   I wish your family a healthy and Merry Christmas.
BREAKING: The Senate just passed another major bipartisan, COVID-19 relief package. The American people can rest assured that more help is on the way, immediately.

Senate Republicans have been trying since July to get more targeted, bipartisan relief into the hands of the American people. Until the election, Democrats kept saying no. I’m glad for our country that we are finally moving ahead together.
Tune in now: I’m joining @DanaPerino on @FoxNews to discuss the bipartisan, bicameral agreement for another major COVID-19 rescue package for the American people.

BREAKING: As the American people continue battling the coronavirus this holiday season, they will not be on their own.  Congress has just reached an agreement. We will pass another rescue package ASAP. More help is on the way.

I think both sides agree: Our around-the-clock negotiations on COVID relief are hours away from completion. Our citizens need this waiting to end. Thousands of Americans are being robbed of their lives every day. Working families are hurting. Let’s finally get this done today.

I appreciate the good-faith spirit that has characterized the bipartisan negotiations this past week. But the American people cannot feed their families or pay their bills with Congress’s good-faith discussions. They need us to act. We need to conclude talks and land this plane.

Just received the safe, effective COVID vaccine following continuity-of-government protocols. Vaccines are how we beat this virus. Now back to continue fighting for a rescue package including a lot more money for distribution so more Americans can receive it as fast as possible.
The only way to beat this pandemic is for us to follow the advice of our nation’s health care professionals: get vaccinated and continue to follow CDC guidelines.    My full statement:

Productive conversations remain underway on COVID-19 relief. But Congress must not slide into treating these talks like routine negotiations at our routine pace. This could not be more urgent. The Senate’s going to keep working right through the weekend until we get an outcome.

The American people have struggled heroically through this pandemic. They’ve already waited too long for more relief.  The Senate isn’t going anywhere until our bipartisan discussions reach an outcome for the American people.

The American people need more help. We need vaccine distribution money. We need to re-up the Paycheck Protection Program to save jobs. We need to continue to provide for laid-off Americans. Congressional leaders on both sides are going to keep working until we get it done.

We can’t just keep blindly trusting companies like Facebook to do the right thing. Promises of “we’ve got this” just aren’t cutting it. We need transparency and action on the algorithms that govern so much of our lives.
What’s really scary this Halloween? How prescription drugs in America are more than 250% times higher overall than those in 32 other countries.
The price of Levemir insulin was $29.38 in America in 2018. In the same year, it was $3.81 in the UK.
The average list price in America for a prescription drug is $466.15 or $341.00 more than other countries combined.
People with diabetes shouldn’t have to cross the border into Canada to be able to afford their insulin.
Happy Halloween! I hope everyone gets to go out and make memories like this one from years past with our daughter Abigail. Stay safe and warm out there.
Hey Virginia vote @TerryMcAuliffe !
Insulin. Cancer treatments. Medications for chronic pain or asthma. They should all be affordable.
Active duty servicemembers have a 20 to 40 percent higher chance of developing breast cancer than civilians. We have a duty to protect the women who are serving our country from this disease.
Letting Medicare negotiate for lower prescription drug prices doesn’t just help patients with costs, it saves taxpayers billions of dollars in the long run.  There’s no downside.
Starting an online meeting now with Americans deeply affected by the high price of prescription drugs who don’t know any Pharma lobbyists.  These are the people Congress should be listening to.

Memo to: A few people  From: 46 million seniors  Americans are tired of paying the highest prices of any country for prescription drugs. After saying you want to lower them for years, please DO IT by lifting the ban on Medicare negotiating lower prices for us.  Thanks!

Big pharma has spent $26 million in advertising this year alone to try and stop legislation to lower prescription drug prices.  If they can afford that, they can afford to lower prices. The people are on our side.
No, YOU were amazing! Thanks for making Minnesota home for a little while, @USWNT.
46 million seniors suffer and big pharma profits if we allow Medicare to continue to be banned from negotiating lower prices. We know the solution — it’s time to lift the ban.
One of the top-selling drugs for rheumatoid arthritis has increased in price 155% since 2012.  155% higher profits for Big Pharma and 155% higher costs for consumers. Something has to change.
Big Pharma doesn’t own the government, the people do.  And the vast majority of the people want Medicare to be able to negotiate lower drug prices. Let’s get it done.
Medicare spends nearly $3 BILLION a year on the pain medication Lyrica. Why so much? Because the price has nearly doubled in the last five years. We must lower the cost of prescription drugs.
We must lower the cost of prescription drugs. 46 million seniors on our side.

So many stories like this. “As someone who has been facing the outrageous price of insulin for decades, I can’t begin to tell you how much real drug pricing reform would mean…” Opinion: My insulin hasn’t changed, but the price has risen more than 600%

After my cancer diagnosis, I learned in a very personal way how crucial health screenings are. Too many have had to delay lifesaving tests, which is why I'm introducing bipartisan legislation to ensure Americans get the preventive care they need.
This was one of my favorite moments from last night’s softball game with @AngieCraigMN.
Breaking news: this changes nothing.
Bottom line: drug prices are too high. It is time for Americans to get a better deal and I won’t stop fighting for it.
Victoza treats diabetes, it cost 42% more in 2020 than it did in 2015.
Americans paid $154.80 for Advair, a treatment for asthma, in 2015. In the U.K. that cost was $46.99.
Eliquis is used to prevent strokes. It retailed for $4,109 in 2015. That rose to $5,473 in 2020.
Crestor lowers cholesterol, it cost $86.40 a month in 2015 for Americans. Across the border in Canada that price was only $40.50.
The price of Lyrica, a different common pain relief medication, has risen 47% over the course of just five years.
Symbicort is a common treatment for asthma, something that impacts more than 25 million Americans, retailed for an absurd $4,282 in 2020. This is a 46% rise from 2015.
Duexis, a common drug for pain relief, cost has gone up 60% from 2015 to 2020.
Avonex and Avonex Pen treat Multiple Sclerosis and (as of 2018) cost $1,697 in the U.S., close to 650 percent of the international average.
Humira is one of the best-selling drugs in the world. In the U.S. (as of 2018) it was priced at $2,436 per dose, 500 percent of the international average.
Prescription drug prices in the U.S. are more than 250% times higher overall than those in 32 other countries.

America pays more for prescription drugs than any other country. Right now a ban on negotiation for our seniors has been written into law courtesy of the pharma companies. This is the time to lift the ban and get a better deal for all of us.
Another Congressional Women’s Softball Game in the books! Great to emcee once again. Congratulations to the Bad News Babes. We’ll get ‘em next year.

Shelley Moore Capito (the OTHER Senator from West Virginia) just got the base hit that tied up the score with the press at the Congressional Women’s Softball game! Great cause. Fighting breast cancer. Great job Shelley!

The Women's Congressional Softball game is one of my all-time favorite traditions, and it also benefits a cause close to my heart: supporting young breast cancer survivors. I am honored to be emceeing tonight's game, and to get in the spirit, here’s a throwback!
This is awesome!

These are the questions we should be asking.
We need judges like Myrna Pérez on the bench. Judges who understand the importance of voting rights and stand up for civil rights. I’m so proud we’re confirming her (and others!) in record numbers.

A musical and creative genius who had such a huge impact on our culture. Prince deserves a Congressional Gold Medal.

Facebook is hurting our democracy.
So many of our kids use Youtube, TikTok, and Snapchat, but not enough is being done to protect them from harmful content. It’s time we do something about it.

The world is much cooler because Prince was in it — he touched our hearts & made us want to dance. I am a big Prince fan and was always proud to say he was from MN. I’m introducing legislation to award him the Congressional Gold Medal to honor his memory & contributions.

Big tech companies aren’t looking out for the little guy. That's why we need rules of the road so small businesses have a fighting chance in this digital economy.

We should be making it easier to vote, not harder. We shouldn’t be targeting people so they can’t vote. That’s not what this democracy was built on. It’s time for basic federal voting standards.

No matter your state, no matter your zip code, you deserve equal access to the ballot box. That is the basis of our democracy.

Today is the day we bring the Freedom to Vote Act to the Senate floor. It’s time to stand up for what’s right. It’s time to protect the vote.
Tomorrow I will vote to begin debate on the Freedom to Vote Act. Our democracy is on the line.

Now is the time to make your voice heard. Let your Senator know — it’s time to pass the Freedom to Vote Act.

We must invest in community college and apprenticeship programs that will let people have meaningful work and support their families.
In America, any business should have a fair shot at succeeding. Today @ChuckGrassley and I are introducing a bill to stop tech companies from squashing competition and raising prices for consumers.

No matter your zip code, you should have equal access to the ballot box. The Freedom to Vote Act will set basic national standards to make sure all Americans can cast their ballots in the way that works best for them. We have to get this done.
Eating disorders have the highest mortality rate of any mental illness for young women. Lives are at risk. Those are the stakes here.

Colin Powell never quit serving when he retired from the military and government. He devoted so much to our nation’s children with America’s Promise. Our prayers are with his wife Alma and their family.
The @Vikings just like to make it exciting to the end. Congrats team!
In the first round of payments alone, the child tax credit pulled 3 million kids out of poverty. Let’s make it permanent.
Watch Mayor @melvincarter3 #RunThru ! St. Paul Remember to vote Nov 2!
Mayor Carter shows us that Saint Paul has overcome a lot and accomplished even more. In two weeks Saint Paul voters can give Melvin another four years to do even more. Good luck, Mayor!

Climate change is an existential threat. Yesterday I joined @SecGranholm and @TinaSmithMN and MN leaders in St. Paul to discuss the immediate action needed to reduce emissions.
What’s one thing Americans overwhelmingly support? Letting Medicare negotiate lower drug prices for our seniors.
No one should spend more on child care than their mortgage payment each month.

Parents read this: Facebook’s motive is to keep your kids on their app 3-4 hours a day! NYT new reporting: Docs show execs were concerned when “Teen time spent” dipped. “That was alarming because Instagram relied on teenagers to spend 3 to 4 hours a day on the app…”
Politicians should get elected because of their ideas, not based on who drew the maps.
Next Wednesday, the Senate will vote to proceed on the Freedom to Vote Act. Passing this bill is consequential to defending our democracy.

The threats to our democracy are real, and they are not going away. There’s simply no other choice: we have to protect one of the most fundamental rights we have as Americans. I will not stop pushing for a national voting rights bill until we get it done.

I have so much to be thankful for after my successful breast cancer treatment, especially the doctors and nurses at @MayoClinic who took such great care of me. Great to be in Rochester today to spread the word about the importance of health screenings and early detection.

There are real dangers on platforms like Instagram and Facebook for kids and teens. Today I met with Minnesota families to hear from them about their concerns around the content pushed to their kids and how these platforms are using their data.
I'm on the side of America's seniors, not Big Pharma. It’s time to let Medicare negotiate for lower drug prices.

When dominant tech companies exclude rivals & kill competition, it hurts small businesses and can increase costs for YOU. My new bipartisan legislation with @ChuckGrassley will establish new rules of the road to prevent large companies from boxing out their smaller competitors.
90% of Americans support lowering prescription drug costs. It doesn’t get much more bipartisan than that! Let’s get it done.
Reopening our borders for travel is good news. The trade and friendship between our countries are critical to our economy and the lives of many people living along the Northern border.

Places like Chanhassen Dinner Theatres are part of what makes our communities so special. That’s why I fought hard to pass my bipartisan Save Our Stages bill. It was great to see everyone coming out to enjoy the Music Man today!

I know what it's like to bury a loved one at a Veterans Cemetery and how important it is to show our veterans that final respect. Honored to be at the groundbreaking for the new Veterans’ cemetery in Redwood Falls.
Just a reminder: the word ‘filibuster' is not in the U.S. Constitution.

This is great news. In the US Senate I head up the group working on issues with Canada and this has been a top priority for both air and CAR travel. Many people have been apart for too long in all three countries!

Donald Trump is still spreading lies about the election and states are still introducing voter suppression bills -- I’ve said it before, I’ll say it again: it’s time for a national voting rights bill.
In Minnesota, the average cost for a childcare center for an infant is $16,164 a year.  We need to bring costs down.
Lower prescription drug costs, affordable child care, one of the largest middle-class tax cuts in a generation. That’s the Build Back Better Agenda.

Too many Minnesotans are struggling to afford medications. That's why I'm fighting to allow Medicare to negotiate w/ drug companies to get a better deal for our seniors. Great to be with @aarpmn, @trellisconnects & patient advocates today to talk about why we must take action.
Virginia! Today is the last day to be able to register to vote for the November 2nd election. Let's get it done for my friend @TerryMcAuliffe!

As we commemorate Indigenous Peoples' Day, it is critical that we acknowledge the work we have ahead of us to respect, uplift, and invest in Native communities in Minnesota and across the country — not just today, but every day.
Pretty simple idea: if you need childcare for your kid to go to work, it shouldn't cost your whole paycheck to send them there. We can fix this!

No one in a bar, in a movie theater, in a classroom, at a concert, in their workplace, or anywhere, should have to fear gun violence in America. We cannot move from one shooting to the next and do nothing. We cannot wait any longer to pass comprehensive gun safety legislation.

Great to be with my friend @PhilMurphyNJ and his wife @TammyMurphyNJ! Phil Murphy is working tirelessly as Governor and always puts the people of New Jersey first. Election Day is less than a month away. So get out and vote for Phil! Stronger. Fairer. Forward. New Jersey!
3 men under arrest after shootout inside St. Paul bar that kills woman, injures 14   via @pioneerpress

Over 425 voter suppression bills in 49 states. That’s what we’re up against. That’s why we need federal voting rights legislation.

You know what Democrats, Independents, and Republicans all agree on across America? Bringing costs down for families, a big middle-class tax cut, and allowing Medicare to negotiate less expensive drugs for seniors. That's what I'm fighting to get done.

Had a great conversation with @karaswisher and @profgalloway today about how much harder Facebook is making it for parents. Frances Haugen’s testimony was a catalyst, and we need to take action to protect our kids.

Journalists around the world risk their lives to protect freedom and tell the truth to the public. Congratulations to Maria Ressa and Dmitry Muratov, and thank you for doing such important work despite the danger.

Minnesota has the highest voter turnout in nearly every single election. When you make it easier to vote, people feel like they're part of something. It’s time to make basic federal voting rights the law of the land.

“You have motivated me to go get my mammogram. I, too, avoided doing it due to COVID...I’m setting it up tomorrow.” Responses like this are one big reason why I shared my experience with breast cancer. There's no better time than now to get screened.
Congratulations to @ceciliakang and @sheeraf! A story that needs to be told.

From lowering prescription drug costs and extending the child tax credit to making education and job training more accessible -- these very are real things that make a difference in people’s lives. We must pass the Build Back Better Agenda.

Did you know that right now, the government is not allowed to work with drug companies to lower drug prices for seniors? That’s right, there is a ban on negotiating on behalf of Medicare recipients. But in the Build Back Better Agenda, we'll lift that ban and get a better deal.

.@SenJohnHoeven and I believe businesses should be able to export across the world, no matter where they are located. That's why we've introduced bipartisan legislation to help rural businesses export to new markets abroad.

This is heartbreaking to read and it has got to stop. That means action to pass common sense gun safety legislation.
This is a huge (but still temporary) relief for women across Texas. This battle isn’t over. We won’t give up.
I'm not going to give up on voting rights legislation. Defending access to the ballot box is our job as Senators and we have to get this done for the American people.
Congratulations to Minnesota’s @TinaSmithMN and @AngieCraigMN. John and I are so happy for you and your families. What lucky grandchildren to have these two incredible women as grandmas!
Mark Zuckerberg sits on his sailboat while kids are harmed by his product and Facebook profits. I think enough is enough.
We can't wait to give soccer fans a huge Minnesota welcome in St.Paul next summer!

We need federal antitrust enforcers who can take on the most powerful companies the world has ever seen, and Jonathan Kanter has the experience, legal skill, and courage to head the DOJ's Antitrust Division at this critical moment. I urge my colleagues to confirm him.

The breast cancer story I told @marieclaire is all too common for so many Americans: I put off preventative screenings due to COVID. But I was lucky to have doctors catch it when they did.  These screenings can save your life. Please -- schedule yours today.
Hearings are great, but I want action. Frances Haugen wants action. It's time for Facebook to be held accountable with legislation, and I'm asking you to join me in calling on Congress to act.

Congressman Lewis never gave up on the fight for justice. I am proud to honor his legacy by joining my colleagues in introducing legislation to protect our democracy, strengthen the Voting Rights Act and prohibit discriminatory practices that keep people from the ballot box.

Eating disorders have the highest mortality rate of any mental illness. Today, @FrancesHaugen told me Facebook knows they're exposing girls to harmful content. The stakes are very real on platforms like Instagram. And Facebook is willingly part of the problem.

We have not done a thing to update U.S. competition, privacy, & tech laws. Nothing. Zilch. Why? Because there are lobbyists around every single corner of the Capitol hired by tech. Today’s testimony from @FrancesHaugen is a catalyst for change. The time for action is NOW.

Do you know how much Facebook makes off of you, one single American, every quarter?  51 bucks. 51 bucks off of your data.  It's time to upgrade our privacy policies. People should be in the driver's seat when it comes to their own data.
.@NIHDirector Francis Collins just announced his retirement. He is one of my heroes. Science first. And always with a good heart.
@NIHDirector Francis Collins is one of my heroes. Science first. And always with a good heart.

I won't stand by while our kids, health, and democracy become collateral damage in the profit game being played by Facebook. I thank Frances Haugen for coming forward to face off with one of the most powerful companies the world has ever known. We hear you. And we have your back.

We need basic federal standards for voting, because right now, at this very moment, voting rights are under attack in state legislatures across the country. As long as that’s true, I’ll keep fighting.

Great to mark the 100th birthday of the Old Cedar Avenue Bridge in Bloomington with Mayor @TRBusse and many others this weekend. John and I have loved exploring the trails in this conservation area, especially during the pandemic when so much was closed down.

Today is the start of a new Supreme Court term. What hangs in the balance? The ability for millions of women to make their own health care choices. We need to codify Roe and make it the law of the land. Now.

It was great to be with @ErinBurnett for the 10th anniversary of her show! We discussed the importance of preventive screenings. If you have put off your mammogram due to the pandemic, go get one today. Don't put it off.

Americans are paying way too much for prescription drugs because Medicare is banned from negotiating for lower drug prices. I think 46 million seniors could get a pretty good deal! Just one more reason we must put people first by passing Build Back Better!
One of the best parts of fall?  @Vikings games are back. Skol!

The Elk-River Rogers VFW Post does so much to support our veterans and this community. They operate a recreation center & athletic fields used by youth organizations and others at no cost. Even with their tour of duty over, these veterans continue their selfless service.
Whether it is child care or housing or bringing down prescription drug prices, this is a big deal and it must get done.
You know what’s great about lifting the ban on negotiating better prices for pharmaceuticals under Medicare?  It BRINGS IN billions of dollars for consumers and taxpayers!

I fought to pass Save Our Stages with @TeamCornyn so cherished venues could secure funds to make it through this pandemic. Got to enjoy a performance of What The Constitution Means to Me during one of The Guthrie’s first shows since the pandemic and can confirm: theater is back!

I was so proud to join the women who rallied in Minnesota and across the country today. Women have a right to make their own health care choices, no matter what politicians in Texas (or anywhere else!) say.

When people ask why we were out marching in the rain today, tell them what Justice Ginsburg taught us: that her dissents were not cries of defeat, they were blueprints for the future.  We will codify Roe v. Wade. We will get this right.
The American public is with us because they get it: we need better infrastructure, better housing, better child care, and lower prescription drug prices.  We have got to get this done.
It’s about time! @ACPage_77 is a Minnesota legend.

Like so many women, I put off my breast cancer screening during the pandemic. These screenings literally save lives—including mine.  Do not put it off that exam any longer. #BreastCancerAwarenessMonth

Met with teachers, administrators and staff from National Blue Ribbon award winning Twin Lakes Elementary today. Their dedication to the success of their students was clear. So thankful for all the educators who give their all every day to uplift and support our children.

Today is the beginning of Breast Cancer Awareness Month. Many people have delayed physicals and routine examinations because of the pandemic. Trust me, it is so important to get your regular screenings and tests done—so please schedule yours today. It could save your life
Happy Birthday Jimmy Carter! 97 great years with more to come.

Companies like Facebook are not doing enough to protect our kids. Why didn’t Facebook act when its research showed Instagram was harming teens? How far are they willing to go before drawing a line between profit and the safety of our children?
90% of the public—both Republicans and Democrats—agree: it’s time to allow seniors to negotiate better drug prices under Medicare.  Let’s get it done.

What would happen if we defaulted? As one economist said, this would be a default by choice, a default “by stupidity.” High interest rates, bad for business, bad for seniors, vets, military. I will stand by the full faith and credit of the U.S.    ￼

This is a strong move and all platforms should do the same.  Then we should pass my bill holding social media companies liable for profiting off of and allowing spread of vaccine misinformation. Way too many people see and believe vaccine misinformation.

Welcome back, Jordana!

When most parties lose elections, they think “should we change our candidate, our policy, our messages?” This time, the Republican Party decided, “no, we're just going to try to change our voters.” Well, that is not how democracy works. And we cannot let them do it.

Virginia, this election is about the future and my friend @TerryMcAuliffe is ready to lead the state forward. Make sure you get out and vote!

YES. @Vikings finally. Well deserved and a big win!

Happy to be back in Virginia to support my friend (former and future Governor) @TerryMcAuliffe! Fewer than 40 days until Election Day. From creating clean energy jobs to preventing gun violence to protecting women’s health decisions, Terry is the right choice for Virginia!
I couldn’t agree more.

The VA can negotiate drug prices for veterans, but Medicare is banned from negotiating for seniors. Why? There’s no good reason, but Big Pharma got a provision in law that says so. I plan on changing that.
This legislation is critical to protecting our democracy. We need to get it done!
And how much did that cost to find out Joe Biden actually had MORE votes??  GOP review finds no proof Arizona election stolen from Trump.
There are still many questions about what happened on (and in the lead up to) January 6. The first step to accountability is getting answers. We will uncover the truth.
I’m immensely proud of our paralympians—from Minnesota and across this nation. This resolution honors their remarkable achievements for our nation and for sports.

Betty Reid Siskin’s uniform represents “a silent message to all the little girls of color” she meets. A business owner, a mother, an activist—and for the past 15 years—a National Park Ranger at the Rosie the Riveter National Park. Happy 100th Birthday!

Let’s get to the facts: we have 46 million seniors that would benefit from allowing Medicare to negotiate the cost of prescription drugs.  No country pays more for medication than we do and that needs to change. Let’s get it done.
Yes. We will only beat this pandemic if we do so at home and abroad. The United States has donated 1.1 billion vaccines to the world. This is what American leadership looks like.

46 million seniors cannot negotiate prescription drug prices. Why? Because Pharma got a provision into law banning Medicare from negotiating with them. We can save taxpayer money. We can get better prices. It's time to lift the ban.
Why are we fighting for federal voting rights legislation? As @SenatorWarnock said: “Some people don't want some people to vote. And we can’t let them win."
In Minnesota, we take our education seriously. I’m proud of these schools and I know our future is in good hands!
American consumers deserve answers.  They deserve real competition.  We need a check on Big Tech.
As hospitalizations in Minnesota rise, it’s more important now than ever to get your vaccine. It will save lives. Protect yourself and your family.

Tech companies & data brokers know so much about us. This data has immense value and raises serious privacy concerns. At our hearing we'll discuss how to protect consumers and competition in this big data economy.

Connected with Minnesotans from across the state during @aarpmn’s tele-town hall to discuss how critical it is to to lower the price of prescription drugs. We must unleash the bargaining power of Medicare so we can negotiate a better deal for our seniors.
The Freedom to Vote Act sets basic federal voting standards into place. It’s a good bill. Now let’s get it done.
A woman’s health care decisions should be between her and her doctor. Bounty hunters? Not part of the equation.
Prescription drugs cost way too much. It’s time to stop just admiring the problem—we must end the ban on Medicare negotiations with pharmaceutical companies.
The Freedom to Vote Act is critical to protect our democracy.
More than 400 voter suppression bills have been introduced in states across the country—31 have passed. The Freedom to Vote Act will put a stop to this. Let’s get it done.
This year, 30 new voter suppression laws have passed in 18 states. We cannot let this go unanswered. We need basic federal voting standards. Now.

We cannot let our  health care workers or hospital system be overwhelmed and leave patients unable to get care. Please, we have the tools to beat this pandemic. For yourself and the sake of others: get the vaccine.
One year ago today, we lost the notorious Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg. She was a fierce advocate for women. Through all who she lifted up, her legacy and fearless spirit continue to live on.
These brave men and women fought for freedom and democracy. They deserve safety and I’m proud that they will be joining our Minnesota community.
The effort to overturn Roe is not over. We need to codify it. We need to protect women’s health care.
This is a tough job and ⁦@jrpsaki⁩ does it so well! She is the epitome of grace under pressure.

Currently Medicare is BANNED from negotiating lower prescription drug prices for 46 million seniors. I have been leading a major bill on this for years and this is the time to get it done. ⬇️   prices now. Not half-way. Not ten years from now. Now.

It seems like a no-brainer: in the 21st century, you should be able to text 9-1-1 for help, not just call.  Unfortunately, that's not reality, which is why I introduced legislation to update our emergency response systems so you can always reach help in your moment of need.
Yes, I am.
There’s no time to waste. We must pass the Freedom to Vote Act.

We can’t sit back and watch our democracy be threatened. Whether it is threatened by rioters with bear spray and crowbars or with long lines at the polls or the elimination of ballot boxes, it is still under siege. We must fight back.
During this time of personal introspection and reflection, John and I wish all who are observing Yom Kippur an easy and meaningful fast.

For years I have worked on bipartisan legislation to ensure law enforcement officers use trauma-informed techniques when responding to sexual assault crimes. The brave testimony I heard today from the survivors of Nassar's abuse make it clear we need to take action.

58 years ago, four little girls lost their lives in one of the most heinous crimes in American history. As we honor their legacy, we must recommit ourselves to continuing the fight for racial justice and equity for all.

The Freedom to Vote Act will set basic national standards to make sure all Americans can cast their ballots in the way that works best for them, regardless of what zip code they live in. We can protect the right to vote and this is how we’ll get it done.

At senate judiciary hearing where Simone Biles, Minnesotan Maggie Nichols and other star gymnasts are once again leading with courage by testifying about what Larry Nassar did to them to make sure nothing like it ever happens again.
Good morning. Gavin Newsom is still the Governor of California.
Recall has failed. Congrats @GavinNewsom ! Job well done.

California Recall results. Lots of cool graphics and enthusiastic commentary tonight but looking like a blowout to me. As in a “let the Governor do his job and stop messing around with our democracy” kind of night.

I joined @ProtectOurCare to speak out on the urgent need to lower prescription drug costs. Too many Americans don’t have access to the medications they need, and the time for action is now.

Congratulations to my friend and former Deputy @hannah_hankins on getting engaged (in an Amy for America t-shirt, no less)! I wish you and Bart the best!

Good news today: we’re introducing The Freedom to Vote Act. It will set basic national standards to make sure all Americans can cast their ballots in the way that works best for them, regardless of what zip code they live in. Let’s get this done!
Right before an election, you talk the truth. And the truth is this recall is bad for California.  Today’s the last day! Drop off your ballot or VOTE NO in-person.

We reached agreement on the Freedom to Vote Act w/ Sens Schumer,Kaine,King,Manchin, Merkley,Padilla,Tester& Warnock to strengthen our democracy. It’s a really good bill! It stops the chaos by setting basic national voting standards, anti-gerrymandering protections & Disclose Act.

Millions of good-paying jobs. New roads and bridges. Broadband access for everyone. Lower costs for childcare, elder care, and community college. We’re going to get this bill to the President’s desk. That’s how we build back better.
I’ve always said we cannot give up in the fight to pass federal voting rights legislation. Our democracy depends on it.
Her first live show in a long time! Her first time back in Minnesota, too! We’re so glad she came to the place where she launched her career. The Twin Cities love you, Lizzo!
Californians: One more day to STOP the Republican recall effort. Vote NO and send your ballot in by tomorrow!
Study after study confirms: The single most important thing you can do to protect yourself from getting hospitalized or losing your life to COVID is to get the vaccine.
Mick Tingelhoff was one of the great Purple People Eaters and a central part of Vikings history. He will be sorely missed.

The show where @stephenathome interviewed me right after the insurrection is up for an Emmy for Outstanding Directing for a Variety Series. Win or lose, thanks to the show for their immediate coverage of a wrenching day in American history.
John and I had breakfast today at the wonderful new farmer-owned Farmers Kitchen + Bar. Thanks to Chef Kris and GM Simone (it is across from the Guthrie).

Gathered in MN to remember those we lost on 9/11. Hearing Mariah’s commemoration of her father, Tom Burnett Jr., who died on Flight 93 after bravely taking on the terrorists to save lives, was moving. Thankful for all who continue to keep the memories of these heroes alive.

On this 20th anniversary of 9/11, we honor the memories of the innocent Americans who were murdered in an act of unspeakable evil.  Today, we recommit ourselves to the principles and freedoms that make this country great—that can never be destroyed. We will never forget.
If you’re unvaccinated, you’re 11 times more likely to die of COVID than those who have received the vaccine. Can’t be any clearer: if you want to protect your health, get the shot!

This ruling reaffirms what we know: app stores raise serious competition concerns. While the ruling addresses some of those issues, much more must be done. We need to pass federal legislation on app store conduct to protect consumers, promote competition, and foster innovation.
Climate change is the existential threat of our time.

As the largest American-owned hearing aid company, Starkey has created jobs & strengthened our economy. We must be a country that invents, makes stuff & exports to the world. That starts with revitalizing manufacturing & making sure the future is made in America.

It’s #WorldSuicidePreventionDay and a reminder that sometimes just one conversation can save a life. Please know: there is always someone available for support.  National Suicide Prevention Lifeline (@800273TALK) 1-800-273-8255.

Thank you, @RobinRoberts, for helping me share my story and shining a light on the importance of regular cancer screenings.  If you've put off that mammogram or routine physical because of the pandemic -- go get it. It just might save your life.
I wanted to share an update about my health.
These brave soldiers fought and died for our nation despite the oppression they faced.  These men are heroes and deserve this long overdue recognition.
In just one year, the Rural Export Commission has helped more than 1800 businesses in 24 states. This is incredible. Very proud to work  with @SenJohnHoeven and make this a reality.
Climate change is an existential threat. We finally have a President who understands this is a “code red” for the world.
Californians, there’s only one week until the election.  Be sure to return your ballots by 9/14 and vote NO! #StopTheRepublicanRecall

A dark day in Texas (again) as Gov. Abbott signs voter suppression into law. Texas Democratic legislators came to DC. They asked Congress to act. It could not be clearer: we need to pass federal voting rights legislation. This assault is not letting up.
Sure, winning a gold medal is cool, but ALSO a big honor: being featured at the 2021 Chalkfest at Arbor Lakes in Minnesota! A nice reminder of how much Suni means to us.
It’s pretty simple: unless we get rid of the filibuster, we’re going to sit around admiring a lot of problems and sending a lot of tweets. Instead, we should get something done.

It was great to be in Virginia, MN on the Range for Labor Day! To all those who have worked long hours to provide for their families & build our country - thank you. I will never stop fighting for you.
Had a great time with the AFL-CIO in Duluth today celebrating Minnesota's workers! Thinking of my friend Rich Trumka, whose memory we honor by continuing the fight for worker's rights.
To everyone celebrating Rosh Hashanah, I wish you a happy and sweet New Year! Shana tova

Received a briefing from local, state, and federal officials on the wildfires devastating northern MN & surveyed some of the damage. So thankful for everyone working on the frontlines to fight this fire and save lives. I will continue to support your tireless efforts.

The promise of America has always been that if you work hard, you have a fair shot at building a better life for your family. Labor Day is a time to reflect on the efforts to make that promise a reality and reaffirm our commitment to protect workers and their right to organize.
Californians: If you care about a governor who will take action on climate change, fight this pandemic, and safeguard women’s healthcare, vote NO on September 14!

This year alone, 19 GOP-controlled state legislatures enacted 33 laws to disenfranchise voters & GOP-appointed judges continue to rip away hard-won voter protections in the courts.   This all-out assault on the sanctity of the ballot is silencing the voices of voters.

Today, @SenateGOP voted to aid and abet the most dangerous campaign of voter suppression since Jim Crow.   By blocking our compromise voting rights bill, the Freedom to Vote Act, Republicans are undermining their constituents, the Constitution and our country.

While I'm looking forward to seeing the @SFGiants go all the way next year, in the meantime, a deal is a deal. Enjoy your sweet victory @RepJimmyGomez with some of San Francisco's own Ghirardelli chocolates!
Join Members of Congress, faith community leaders and me at the U.S. Capitol for an interfaith vigil as we highlight how Democrats will #BuildBackBetter for our children.

Join Members of Congress and me live at the U.S. Capitol for an event about how the #BuildBackBetter Act will create good paying jobs tackling the climate crisis and investing in leading the clean energy economy of the future.

Generations of proud Filipino Americans have blessed our nation with immeasurable contributions, from arts & culture to business & labor to military service. During #FilipinoAmericanHistoryMonth we celebrate the Filipino Americans who have made San Francisco and our nation home.
May it be a comfort to Alma and the entire Powell family that so many in America mourn their loss and pray for them at this sad time. Read my full statement here:

The sad loss of Colin Powell is another sad indication of the toll that the coronavirus continues to take on our country.  As we pray for the General Powell’s loved ones, we pray for the families of the nearly 725,000 Americans who have been taken from us by this vicious virus.

Today, the nation has lost an historic leader who dedicated his life to defending our nation and our families. General Colin Powell was a patriot whose leadership strengthened America and whose life embodied the American Dream.
Today, I spoke with my friend @CommonsSpeaker Sir Lindsay Hoyle to express the condolences of the U.S. Congress for the tragic murder of Sir David Amess, MP.
See what happened behind-the-scenes at the United States Capitol and in my travels with my Medium post, ‘Madam Speaker.’

Yesterday, I was proud to join HUD @SecFudge, SF Mayor @LondonBreed and @CALtGovernor Eleni Kounalakis at the HOPE SF, Sunnydale Site to promote critical provisions in the #BuildBackBetter Act that tackle housing equity.

Today, thanks to @POTUS and @HouseDemocrats, families are getting their fourth payment of the life-changing Biden #ChildTaxCredit. While @HouseGOP have abandoned our families, Democrats are always fighting #ForThePeople.

Yesterday, I joined @SenAlexPadilla & local climate leaders on the California Academy of Sciences Living Roof to discuss key provisions of the #BuildBackBetter Act that tackle the climate crisis, create jobs, promote environmental injustice & invest in our clean energy future.
Congrats to the @SFGiants players on a thrilling season despite the tough ending — and to the @Dodgers for your win. @RepJimmyGomez your chocolate is coming.

Today is the day! Game 5!   With the series on the line, the NLDS is coming home to San Francisco where my @SFGiants will show the @Dodgers, once again, who’s the best in the West. Looking forward to winning my wager with @RepJimmyGomez!   Let's go Giants! #BeatLA #ResilientSF

Join @SenAlexPadilla, @EddieAhn, @Dan_Kammen, @RevSallyBingham & me @CalAcademy for an event on critical provisions in the #BuildBackBetter Act that tackle the climate crisis, create jobs, fight environmental injustice & invest in our clean energy future.
Join @ScottShafer, @MLagos and me live for a moderated conversation for @KQED's Live Fall series discussing the latest in Washington, women in leadership and more.

As House Speaker, it is my official honor to welcome His Excellency @YairLapid, Alternate Prime Minister and Minister of Foreign Affairs of the State of Israel, to the United States Capitol today ahead of a bipartisan leadership meeting.
Join His Excellency @YairLapid, Alternate Prime Minister and Minister of Foreign Affairs of the State of Israel, and me at the U. S. Capitol ahead of a bipartisan leadership meeting.
Join me live at the U.S. Capitol for my weekly press conference.

Whether you came out years ago, are speaking your truth today, aren’t ready yet or plan to someday soon, never doubt that you are seen, you are heard & you are loved. On #NationalComingOutDay, and every day, Americans are proud to stand with our LGBTQ community.
Read my full remarks here:

I want the face of American security to be more about women, more people of color. This is not about mere representation, it's about leadership. We truly do believe that when women succeed, America succeeds.
Honored to accept the inaugural Women for Peace and Security Award and deliver an address at the 67th Annual Session of the NATO Parliamentary Assembly in Lisbon.
Join me live at the 67th Annual Session of the NATO Parliamentary Assembly in Lisbon, Portugal as I deliver an address and accept the inaugural Women for Peace and Security Award.
Before I speak to the NATO Parliamentary Assembly Session in Lisbon, Portugal, I was proud to meet the U.S. Marine Detachment at @USEmbPortugal and deliver our thanks for their service to our nation.

Under President Mattarella’s leadership, Italy has enjoyed stability at home and been a global leader in crushing COVID, in acting on climate and in being a positive international presence. Read my full statement here:

We were very fortunate to hear President Mattarella’s wisdom on global affairs. I reiterated our appreciation for Italy’s @NATO partnership in Afghanistan and the assistance throughout the evacuation of our Afghan allies, as well as for Italy’s role in the @COP26 climate summit.
This afternoon, I was honored to meet with President Sergio Mattarella to express my gratitude for his invaluable leadership of Italy and on the global stage.

While I always enjoy sharing some of my favorite chocolates from Ghirardelli with my colleagues, I look forward to trying the Los Angeles delicacies from @RepJimmyGomez when he has to pay up! The @Dodgers are no match for the heart and hustle of our @SFGiants! #OrangeOctober

In San Francisco, we take special pride in Pope Francis, who shares the namesake of our city and whose song of St. Francis is our anthem. Read My Statement on Audience with His Holiness Pope Francis here:

His Holiness’s leadership is a source of joy and hope for Catholics and for all people, challenging each of us to be good stewards of God’s creation, to act on climate, to embrace the refugee, the immigrant and the poor, and to recognize the dignity and divinity in everyone.
It was a spiritual, personal and official honor to have an audience with His Holiness Pope Francis this morning.

Today, I addressed the Opening Ceremonies of the Pre-COP26 Parliamentary Meeting.  We are at a moment of great responsibility and therefore opportunity on the climate crisis. The G20 countries could, if we act boldly and with unity, mitigate the vast majority of climate change.

It is with great respect for the role parliaments must play in meeting the challenges before us that I met with @Pres_Casellati & @Roberto_Fico at the G20 Parliamentary Speakers' Summit. #P20   Thank you to our Italian hosts for making this global gathering of leaders possible.
Read my full statement here:

I commended Prime Minister Draghi for his economic leadership to promote inclusive economic growth. Crushing the virus and investing in the green economy is a key way to promote that growth. We must build a sustainable future for our children that does not leave anyone behind.

As one of our closest NATO allies, Italy has been an invaluable security partner for the United States. I was glad to express to Prime Minister Draghi the gratitude of the Congress for the hospitality and partnership Italy extends to our military.

It was an honor to meet today with Italy’s Prime Minister Mario Draghi, a strong international leader in the fight against COVID, in confronting the climate crisis and in investing in inclusive growth.
Congressional Democrats and President Biden will #BuildBackBetter For The People – with more jobs, cut taxes and lower costs for all. Read my full statement here:

#BuildBackBetter will be transformative for America’s workers and middle class. We must Build Back Better for jobs: jobs in health care, jobs in family health and jobs in climate by creating the clean energy economy of the future.

The September jobs report is additional proof of the need for @HouseDemocrats’ jobs-creating #BuildBackBetter agenda. While historic progress to create jobs, lower unemployment and defeat the pandemic has been forged, more must be done to protect families’ financial security.
Join me live as I deliver a keynote address as a guest speaker to the opening ceremonies of the #PreCOP26 Parliamentary meeting, emphasizing the U.S. Congress’ commitment to climate action.

It was my honor to deliver a keynote address to today’s Opening Session of the G20 Parliamentary Speakers' Summit #P20. Today, the times have found us, each and every one of us, to save the people from COVID & to save the planet from the existential threat of the climate crisis.

Join me as I deliver my keynote address to the Opening Session of the G20 Parliamentary Speakers’ Summit #P20 on the urgency to crush COVID & save our planet from the climate crisis.    The times have found us. We must rise to the urgency of this moment.

Saddened the brutal sentencing of aid worker Abdulrahman al-Sadhan has been upheld, especially given allegations of torture in detention. Saudi Arabia’s assault on the freedom of expression & pattern of human rights abuses must be condemned by all freedom-loving people.

At a critical moment for the international community on climate, coronavirus & global security, I will be addressing the G20 Parliamentary Speakers’ Summit this week in Rome. #P20 Proud to meet the U.S. Marine Detachment at @AmbasciataUSA & deliver our thanks for their service.

So pleased to join @POTUS, Members of Congress and the greater community for the 2021 Congressional Baseball Game at Nationals Park. See what else happened behind-the-scenes last week at the United States Capitol with my Medium post, ‘Madam Speaker.’

Happy 97th birthday to a leader who personifies goodness and grace: President Jimmy Carter. America, and indeed the entire world, are so grateful for your lifetime of hard work building a better future for our children. Wishing you and Rosalynn the very best on your special day!

Jim Hormel made history as the first openly gay U.S. Ambassador, paving the way for a generation of LGBTQ leaders. But it is his goodness and greatness that will be forever etched in the hearts of all who know him. We miss him dearly.
Honored to welcome @POTUS to the U.S. Capitol this afternoon. Together, we will #BuildBackBetter for the American people!
Join Members of Congress and me live on the National Mall at the #InAmericaRemember exhibit for a moment of silence honoring the 700,000 lives lost to COVID-19 in America.
Today, I am proud to sign H.R. 5305, a Continuing Resolution that ensures we keep the federal government open #ForThePeople.
Join Members of Congress and me live at the United States Capitol for a bill enrollment ceremony on H.R. 5305, a Continuing Resolution that ensures we keep the federal government open #ForThePeople.
Join me live at the U.S. Capitol for my weekly press conference.

Republicans’ refusal to support a suspension of the debt ceiling is downright dangerous and threatens six million jobs, financial security for working families and could send the unemployment rate to nine percent.
It was a privilege to speak with @JeffreyGoldberg for the Ideas Stage at @TheAtlanticFest. Watch my full interview here. #TAF21

Proud to join @HouseDemocrats & League of Conservation Voters, Climate Power & other climate activists to reaffirm the need for critical provisions in the #BuildBackBetter Act that tackle the climate crisis, advance environmental justice & invest in America’s clean energy future.

Join Members of Congress, activists & me live at the U.S. Capitol for an event on how the #BuildBackBetter Act will create good paying jobs tackling the climate crisis, addressing environmental justice & investing in America’s clean energy future.

The full faith & credit of the United States should not be political. Republicans’ reckless decision to block government funding & raising the debt ceiling threatens 6 million jobs, financial ruin for countless families, military paychecks & Social Security payments to seniors.

The backbone of our democracy and our country is the middle class and those who aspire to it. As we Build Back Better, we must meet families’ home health care needs — and lift up the caregivers who meet them!  #CareCantWait
See what happened behind-the-scenes last week at the United States Capitol and in my district with my Medium post, ‘Madam Speaker.’

The Biden agenda: lower costs, historic middle class tax cuts, millions of green good-paying jobs for the American people and much more to #BuildBackBetter – and paid for by making sure the wealthy and corporations pay their fair share.

This morning, I joined @ThisWeekABC to talk about passing @POTUS Biden’s #BuildBackBetter Agenda. The next few days will be a time of intensity. We must pass a Continuing Resolution, Build Back Better Act and the BIF.

President Biden’s vision is about rewarding work, not just wealth. Democrats are united behind America’s working families – fighting for fairness in our economy, justice in the environment and unlocking the full economic potential of parents in the workforce. #BuildBackBetter
This week, I was privileged to welcome @SimonCoveney, Minister of Foreign Affairs and Defense of the Republic of Ireland, to the United States Capitol.

Proud to stand with @RepJudyChu & Members of the @ProChoiceCaucus before @HouseDemocrats’ passage of the Women’s Health Protection Act. By passing this bill today, we reaffirmed this truth: every woman, everywhere, has the constitutional right to basic reproductive health care!

For The Children, Democrats’ #BuildBackBetter Act will give millions of middle class families one of the biggest tax cuts in history while dramatically lowering everyday costs with investments in child care, paid leave, home-based care, universal pre-K and more.
Very proud to stand with Members of Congress and advocates this morning to uplift House Democrats’ work to #BuildBackBetter for Women because we all know: when women succeed, America succeeds.
Join @HouseDemocrats and me at the United States Capitol as we talk about our transformational plans to #BuildBackBetter for Women – because when women succeed, America succeeds!
Join Members of Congress and me live at the U.S. Capitol for a press conference on the Women's Health Protection Act ahead of the vote in the House of Representatives. #WHPA
Join essential home care workers, advocates, Members of Congress and me live at the Care Can't Wait" event to highlight the need to create good union care jobs
column2: expand access to home care & deliver racial and gender justice. "

column1: Join me live at the U.S. Capitol for my weekly press conference.

Today, I met with @LouisianaGov and @RepTroyCarter on helping disaster victims following hurricanes that hit Louisiana. While @HouseGOP abandoned families, @HouseDemocrats fought for them by voting for the Disaster Supplemental last night.

Yesterday, I met with @RepKarenBass & His Excellency João Manuel Gonçalves Lourenço, President of the Republic of Angola, to discuss strengthening our bilateral relationship, COVID-19 response & recovery, support for reforms & economic prosperity & addressing the climate crisis.
Today, I was honored to welcome @ScottMorrisonMP, Prime Minister of Australia, to the United States Capitol ahead of a bipartisan leadership meeting.
Join @ScottMorrisonMP, Prime Minister of Australia and me live at the United States Capitol ahead of a bipartisan leadership meeting.

As Speaker, it was my privilege to welcome The Right Honorable @BorisJohnson, M.P., Prime Minister of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland, to the United States Capitol this morning ahead of a bipartisan leadership meeting.

Join The Right Honorable @BorisJohnson, M.P., Prime Minister of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland and me live at the United States Capitol ahead of a bipartisan leadership meeting.

Proud to join House Democrats yesterday to unveil the Protecting Our Democracy Act. This comprehensive reform is essential to protect, support and restore the American people’s faith in our democratic institutions and prevent abuse of presidential power.

Today I planted a flag at artist Suzanne Brennan Firstenberg’s “In America: Remember,” an art installation on the National Mall commemorating Americans lost to COVID-19. With each white flag, we remember those we have lost and reflect on the enormous toll of the pandemic.
Join @HouseDemocrats and me live at the United States Capitol for a press conference on the Protecting Our Democracy Act.
Join artist Suzanne Brennan Firstenberg and me at In America: Remember, a public art installation on the National Mall commemorating all Americans who have died due to COVID-19.
Two years ago, @LeaderMcConnell said: “America can't default. That would be a disaster. Yet
column2: now he and @SenateGOP are trying to force the first-ever default of the U.S. All Members must come together in a spirit of bipartisanship to protect the full faith and credit of the U.S."

column1: The situation facing Haitian migrants at the border is heartbreaking, and Congress will continue to closely monitor developments. Read my full statement here:
All migrants seeking asylum must be treated in accordance with the law and with basic decency. Any acts of aggression or violence cannot be tolerated and must be investigated.

Reports of the mistreatment of Haitian migrants fleeing violence and devastation from natural disasters are deeply troubling, including the inappropriate use of what appear to be whips by Border Patrol officers on horseback to intimidate migrants.

When SCOTUS takes up Dobbs v. Jackson Women’s Health Organization, @HouseDemocrats urge it to respect the law, precedent & the rights of women by upholding Roe v. Wade & fully striking down the Mississippi ban. Read my full statement here:

Revisiting or undermining Roe presents a threat to equality and justice in America, as the Mississippi ban particularly targets women of color & women from low-income communities & would ‘perpetuate the structural racial and socioeconomic inequities that persist in our society.’

Mississippi’s draconian abortion ban – one in a heartbreaking and nationwide assault against women’s freedoms – is unconstitutional. As the brief makes clear, the constitutional right to an abortion has been resoundingly affirmed: in Roe v. Wade & in Planned Parenthood v. Casey.

Today, Congressional Democrats are taking action in the Courts as we stand with the American people and the law in defense of this truth: every woman, everywhere, has the constitutional right to basic reproductive health care.

Watch my interview with @CommonsSpeaker @G7 Speaker’s Conference. Safety & security is the basis for every other good thing that flows from a Democracy. When freedom of expression turns into violence or an attempt to undermine the constitution, then we have to seek out the truth.

We look forward to passing this crucial legislation with bipartisan support through both chambers and sending to the president’s desk in the coming weeks. Read my Joint Statement with @SenSchumer on Continuing Resolution and Debt Limit Legislation here:
