Addressing the debt limit is about meeting obligations the government has already made, like the bipartisan emergency COVID relief legislation from December as well as vital payments to Social Security recipients and our veterans.

A suspension of the debt limit through 12/22 would provide an amount of time commensurate w/ the debt incurred as a result of passing last winter’s bipartisan $908B emergency COVID relief legislation, which was authored by GOP Senators & signed into law by the previous president.

The legislation to avoid a government shutdown will also include a suspension of the debt limit through December 2022 to once again meet our obligations and protect the full faith and credit of the United States.

This week, the House of Representatives will pass legislation to fund the government through December of this year to avoid a needless government shutdown that would harm American families and our economic recovery before the September 30th deadline.

Today, and every day, Democrats reaffirm our pledge to honor all who don the uniform, no matter who you are or whom you love. And we will not relent until we finally, fully end discrimination against LGBTQ Americans for good. Read my full statement here:

Democrats’ bold action to send this injustice to the dustbin of history immediately strengthened our national security and ensured that all those who put their lives on the line for our freedom are treated with dignity and respect.

Ten years ago today, America took a monumental step forward on the march toward full equality.   When the repeal of the hateful #DontAskDontTell policy took effect, tens of thousands of brave, patriotic LGBTQ Servicemembers could finally openly serve our country.

It was a privilege to meet with Leader @Keir_Starmer of the UK Labour Party in London this morning to discuss the enduring special relationship between our two nations and other issues of critical importance.

This flag, which flew over the U.S. Capitol on the day of @POTUS inauguration, will carry on the proud tradition in St. Laurence’s Church and serve as a symbol of the everlasting bonds between our countries and peoples. May it always be a symbol of friendship, fellowship & peace.

On behalf of the United States Congress, it was my official honor to join @CommonsSpeaker in Chorley’s St. Laurence’s Church to present an American flag complementing the one given more than 76 years ago after WWII by American Servicemembers who were housed in and around Chorley.
It was truly a pleasure to mark the occasion of the @G7 Speakers’ Meeting in Chorley, UK by planting  an American Sweet Gum tree at the Astley Hall with 10-year-old Amy today!

Open democracies are what make up strong democracies: informed and enriched by the values and voices we represent. Proud to represent the United States and deliver remarks on the debate on open vs. secure parliaments at the @G7 Speakers’ Meeting in Chorley, UK.
During the @G7 Speaker’s Meeting, I was also pleased to meet with @RichardFerrand, President of the French National Assembly, and @Roberto_Fico, President of the Italian Chamber of Deputies.
It is a privilege to join @CommonsSpeaker in his proud hometown of Chorley for the 20th @G7 Speakers’ Meeting.

It was a privilege to speak with @RobinNiblett at @ChathamHouse for a moderated conversation this morning. For over a century, Chatham House has been a leader in facilitating international conversation and cooperation in a proud spirit of intellectual pursuit.
Today it was a privilege to meet with @AlokSharma_RDG in London ahead of @COP26 to reaffirm our shared commitment to combating the climate crisis.
Join @RobinNiblett and me at @ChathamHouse in London for a moderated conversation.
Today, it was a great privilege to accept an Honorary Membership to @CambridgeUnion and serve as their inaugural speaker for the 2021-22 academic year.

It was also my honor to personally invite the Prime Minister to a bipartisan leadership meeting in the United States Capitol when he travels to the United States later this month. Read my full statement here:

Today, it was my honor to meet with @BorisJohnson to celebrate the special relationship between America and the United Kingdom and to reaffirm our mutual commitment to international security and strengthening the cherished friendship between our nations and peoples.
Join me at the @CambridgeUnion for a moderated conversation and acceptance of an honorary membership.

As House Speaker, it is my official privilege to join my G7 colleagues in the United Kingdom for this year’s Speakers’ Meeting.   Today, I was honored to visit our U.S. Marine Detachment at the @USAinUK and thank them for their service.
When we #BuildBackBetter, we will create jobs, cut taxes and lower health costs for families across America. Read my full statement here:

Thanks to @HouseDemocrats’ leadership, health coverage through the ACA is more affordable than ever. With families facing a deadly pandemic and many losing health coverage at work, Democrats dramatically lowered the cost of premiums for those who purchase coverage on their own.

Today’s record breaking enrollment numbers are further proof of the life-saving role the Affordable Care Act serves as a pillar of American health and economic security, standing alongside Medicare, Medicaid and Social Security.

When Kamala Harris became @VP, America took a glorious step into the future. In the White House, she is not only making history – but she is making progress #ForThePeople.   Read my full #TIME100 piece on Vice President Kamala Harris.

Indeed, our country’s foundational spirit of E Pluribus Unum – from many, one – continues to inspire Democrats as we strive to build a stronger, fairer future for all our children and for decades to come. Read my statement on #HispanicHeritageMonth here:

Since our nation’s founding, Latinos and Latinas have played an integral role in the American story. From these extraordinary achievements we are reminded that our nation’s greatest strength is our unity, forged by our diversity.

During COVID-19, our nation has been grateful for the courageous service of so many Hispanic Americans on the frontlines. We also reflect on the challenges our Latino communities face, from unjust impacts of COVID-19 to decades of underinvestment to a broken immigration system.

#HispanicHeritageMonth offers a special opportunity to come together in celebration of our Latino communities, who have for generations blessed our nation with their remarkable talents, fierce patriotism and an entrepreneurial spirit.

In order to #BuildBackBetter, we have to start with women, who have seen the biggest challenges during the pandemic. @POTUS’ transformative vision will enable women to go back to work without having to worry about the uncertainty of home health care for their families.

I was proud to recommend to @POTUS that @RepBarbaraLee continue her service as our representative to the United Nations. Our nation, and indeed the world, will be well-served with the experience and excellence that she brings to this essential post:

Congresswoman Barbara Lee has the confidence of the Congress to continue to represent the U.S. at the 76th General Assembly of the United Nations. She will continue to bring her commitment to strengthen the UN, advance American values and build a brighter, fairer future for all.
As Americans across the country mark #September11, we recommit to our sacred promise to never forget – both what we lost and the unity and strength that we found.
President Lincoln once cautioned the country of  “the silent artillery of time,” threatening to erode our memories. Let us renew our vow: that time shall not dim the memory of our heroes.

Moved by their strength, resilience & persistence, @HouseDemocrats are fighting to honor this truth: no woman should be forced to live in fear of violence or intimidation. Let us strive to build a brighter, safer future for all women & girls. My statement:

Yet there remains work to do. 1 in 3 women today have experienced sexual & domestic violence – with even higher rates for women of color & women from underserved communities. We must listen to the brave survivors sharing their stories & demanding we take action.

Today, Americans celebrate the lives saved & the progress forged by this legislation, first championed by @POTUS during his service in the Senate. We also hold in our hearts the women lost to this horrific violence & their loved ones.

For nearly three decades, the #ViolenceAgainstWomenAct has stood as one of our nation’s most powerful tools in the fight against sexual & domestic violence. This has been an invaluable force to rally the nation around protecting the safety, rights & dignity of women and girls.

At our darkest moment, America showed the world our greatness in the heroism of the first responders who rushed into danger on #September11. Today and always, Americans are united in grief for those we lost and their families, and in gratitude for their heroism.
Join Members of Congress and me at the U.S. Capitol for a Bipartisan Congressional Remembrance Ceremony marking 20 years since the terror attacks on September 11th.
See what happened behind-the-scenes last week at the United States Capitol and in my travels with my Medium post, ‘Madam Speaker.’

Deeply concerned with allegations of torture in detention of aid worker Abdulrahman al-Sadhan. His sentencing continues Saudi Arabia’s assault on freedom of expression. Congress will monitor Abdulrahman’s appeal hearing tomorrow, as well as all human rights abuses by the regime.

It was a solemn privilege to visit the @Sept11Memorial to mark 20 years since the terror attacks on our nation.   When we talk about #September11 we tread on sacred ground. Let us continue to hold dear the memories of those we lost & honor those who rose to heroism that day.
Read my full statement on twenty years since the September 11th attacks here.

Twenty years later — after the rubble has been cleared, the fires extinguished and our cities rebuilt — Americans come together today to pray for the 3,000 beautiful souls lost to the terror attacks, honor the heroes & survivors, and reaffirm our sacred pledge to #NeverForget911

The painful memories of September 11th remain forever etched in the hearts of every American, inspiring us to come together to build a more peaceful future for generations to come. Read my full statement here:

Yet, the story of #September11 is also one of heroism and hope. In one of our nation’s darkest moments, Americans forged unity in the anguish of loss, strength in the shadow of fear and hope in the face of despair – proving to the world the indomitability of the American spirit.

Twenty years ago, the terror attacks on #September11 forever changed our nation and the world. We hold dear the memories of the 3,000 beautiful souls who perished in the attacks, and the families who have endured unimaginable pain, as well as honor all the heroes and survivors.
Grateful to receive an honorary degree yesterday from @SmithCollege as a part of their Year on Democracies. Watch my Presidential Colloquium for this event below.
.@POTUS & @HouseDemocrats have created more than 4 million jobs. Now we must unlock the full economic power of every worker in America & #BuildBackBetter: More jobs. Tax cuts. Lower costs.

Proud to join @RepJohnLarson & @GovNedLamont at Goodwin University to celebrate the expanded Biden #ChildTaxCredit, ahead of families receiving the third check next week. This is a recognition of how we value children, support families & honor @POTUS' vision to #BuildBackBetter.
Join me live with @RepMcGovern for a press event to highlight the American Rescue Plan and the Biden #ChildTaxCredit.
Join @RepJohnLarson, @GovNedLamont and me live for a press event to celebrate the expanded Biden #ChildTaxCredit.
Join me live for my weekly press conference at the United States Capitol.

Let us draw inspiration from Judaism’s beautiful call to repair the world and build a fairer future for generations. And we remain committed to combating hatred and bigotry in all forms. I wish all people of the Jewish faith a sweet and joyful new year. Shana tovah u’metukah!

This holy season, Jewish families look ahead after a challenging past year — including a disturbing rise in antisemitic attacks. Our nation is in awe of the strength and resilience of the Jewish people.

#RoshHashanah offers an opportunity for millions of Jewish families to rejoice with loved ones and reflect on the blessings of the past year. As the celebration of the High Holy Days begins, Congress joins all Americans in wishing our Jewish communities health and happiness.
As we observe #LaborDay, we remember a titan of labor: Richard Trumka. Richard dedicated his life to the labor movement, and in doing so, lifted up all working Americans.

As our nation emerges from this crisis, Democrats will not relent in our fight to build an economy that works for everyone, so that every child may have the means to pursue their American Dream. Read my full statement here:

The many victories secured by the heroes of organized labor helped forge the middle class and continue to benefit every family. Democrats are proud to stand with unions & we are leading the charge in the Congress to deliver critical benefits and protections for American workers.

On #LaborDay our nation honors all hard-working Americans, who are the backbone of our economy, & the labor unions that empower them to reach their fullest potential. Working people joining together in a union have been one of the greatest forces for progress in American history.

With @POTUS’ vision to #BuildBackBetter, Democrats are giving leverage not to the rich, but to the children of America and their families. We’re working on historic legislation that will help meet their needs.
Congressional Democrats and President Biden will #BuildBackBetter – with more jobs, cut taxes and lower costs for all. Read my full statement here:

Today’s job report is further evidence of the need to #BuildBackBetter for our economy. As the delta variant continues, decisive action is needed to ensure that the economic gains forged under @POTUS – including four million jobs created – are sustained and shared by all.
Join me live with Rep. Doggett in Austin to highlight Democrats’ priorities in the forthcoming #BuildBackBetter Act that will lower health care costs.
Read My Full Statement on Supreme Court Shadow Ruling on Texas Reproductive Rights Case here:

When the Supreme Court takes up its reproductive rights case this year, we urge it to uphold, as Justice Sotomayor wrote in her dissent, ‘its constitutional obligations to protect not only the rights of women, but also the sanctity of its precedents and of the rule of law.’

Every woman has the constitutional right to basic health care. SB8 is the most extreme, dangerous abortion ban in half a century & its purpose is to destroy Roe v. Wade, and even refuses to make exceptions for cases of rape and incest. This ban necessitates codifying Roe v. Wade.

The Court’s cowardly decision to uphold a flagrantly unconstitutional assault on women’s rights and health is staggering. The House will bring up Congresswoman Judy Chu’s Women’s Health Protection Act to enshrine into law reproductive health care for all women across America.

As COVID continues to take a toll on mental health, we must do more to treat addiction, end the stigma & advance equity in access to care.   Congress remains committed, in a bipartisan way, to helping every American achieve recovery so that they may reach their fullest potential.

As we mark the first day of #NationalRecoveryMonth today, Congress stands with all who struggle with substance use disorders & we celebrate the millions who fought hard to achieve recovery.   We also honor the many we have sadly lost to this epidemic.

Every woman, everywhere has the constitutional and moral right to basic reproductive health care. We will fight SB8 and all immoral and dangerous attacks on women’s health and freedoms with all our strength.
SCOTUS’s failure to block #SB8 has delivered catastrophe to women in Texas. This radical law is an all out effort to erase the rights and protections of Roe v Wade.
Democrats are committed to the #BuildBackBetter agenda so that we help women return to the workplace and ensure that their families and children are cared for. Children learning, parents earning.

The Congress will continue to work closely with @POTUS and the Admin, as we are briefed regularly and work to address the security and humanitarian challenges that remain for evacuees and those who wish to be evacuated. We pray for the people of Afghanistan and in the region.

As we honor the heroism of the fallen, we salute each member of our military, intelligence and diplomatic communities who conducted this evacuation, which is the largest and most successful airlift in U.S. history.

Congress joins @POTUS in solemn prayer for every life lost. We are united in prayer for the thirteen U.S. servicemembers killed last Thursday as they helped bring over 124,000 Americans, allies and Afghan partners to safety, an act of profound valor, selflessness and sacrifice.

Today, America and the world observe a milestone of solemnity: the end of the twenty-year war in Afghanistan. I commend @POTUS for his steadfast leadership in ending a forever war. Too many men and women in uniform and their families have had to bear the burden of this conflict.
See what happened behind-the-scenes last week at the United States Capitol and in my district with my Medium post, ‘Madam Speaker.’

58 years after the #MarchOnWashington, Americans are marching again today for our democracy. With state laws disenfranchising voters and making it harder to vote, we need the Senate to pass the For the People Act and the House-passed John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act!

Across the country, state lawmakers like those in Texas are systematically disenfranchising voters by making it harder to vote. Now more than ever we need the For The People Act and the recently House-passed John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act to #RestoreTheVote.

This week, the House passed H.R. 4, the John R. Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act to restore the power of the Voting Rights Act. In America, the right to vote must never, ever be compromised. Proud to stand with @RepTerriSewell and House Democrats in fighting #ForThePeople.

Today, I ordered flags at the U.S. Capitol to be flown at half-staff in honor of the U.S. Servicemembers & others killed in the terrorist attack outside of the Kabul airport. Congress & the Country pray for the innocent lives lost, those injured & the families of all affected.

As we pray for the lives lost, the many injured and their families, Congress and the Country are grateful to our military, diplomatic and intelligence communities for their courage and patriotism. Read my full statement here:

As we work with the Biden Admin to bring stability to the situation, Congress must continue to be kept closely informed, which is why I have requested the Executive Branch continue to brief Members. Our Committees of Jurisdiction will continue to hold briefings on Afghanistan.

Since the end of July, over 100,000 people have been evacuated from Afghanistan with assistance of the US military & allied forces. As we continue this process, Congress, on a bipartisan basis, remains deeply concerned about the security and humanitarian situation in Afghanistan.

The United States House of Representatives strongly condemns the heinous terrorist attack outside Kabul airport.  We mourn the loss of every innocent life taken, and we join every American in heartbreak over the deaths of the servicemembers killed.
Join me live in San Francisco with Mayor London Breed, elected officials and community leaders to commemorate Women’s Equality Day.

Proud to meet with religious leaders & @UniteThePoor yesterday at the Capitol.   I came to Congress for our children. No child should ever go to sleep hungry. Thanks to @POTUS, we have a transformative opportunity to #BuildBackBetter for every family.

Today, and every day, let us summon the suffragists’ spirit of hope and strive to lift up the voices of women across the nation – because we know this truth: when women succeed, America succeeds. Read my full statement here:

Despite progress, women across the nation still face barriers to full equality: from shameful pay disparities to the unfair economic impacts of the pandemic to the brazen assault on the right to vote. At this moment, Democrats are committed to Building Back Better with Women.

We also remember the many heroic women of color, too often unsung, who carried on the fight for decades more to overcome discrimination and injustice to win fair access to the ballot for every community.

More than a century ago, after generations of marching and fighting, courageous suffragists finally won full and equal citizenship and representation in our democracy with the adoption of the 19th Amendment. We honor those who moved our nation closer toward full equality for all.

Honored to speak with Israeli PM @naftalibennett today. We discussed the importance of our nations’ unbreakable bond. Support for Israel is & will always be bipartisan in Congress. I expressed to the PM the hope for a two-state solution & commended his leadership fighting COVID.
Join Leaders of the Poor People’s Campaign, religious leaders and me live for a press event on key issues #ForThePeople, such as voting rights, the minimum wage and infrastructure.
Join me live for my weekly press conference at the United States Capitol.

Join Congresswoman Terri Sewell, House Democrats and me live for a press event highlighting H.R. 4, the John R. Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act, to restore the power of the Voting Rights Act and protect the right to vote.

For those reluctant to get vaccinated, this long-awaited approval reflects the extraordinary rigor and scrutiny that FDA has applied in reviewing millions of cases to ensure that this vaccine is safe.

Daily, we are seeing the tragedy of unvaccinated Americans struggling to breathe in hospital beds, sending heartbreaking messages to their loved ones to get vaccinated before it’s too late. Vaccines are the best way to protect ourselves, those in our care, schools & workplaces.

The FDA’s full approval of a coronavirus vaccine shows Americans can have full confidence in the safety and effectiveness of a vaccine that has been painstakingly studied and reviewed. With the leadership of @POTUS, free, safe and effective vaccines are available across America.

Congratulations @LizShuler on your historic election to lead @AFLCIO!   House Democrats look forward to continuing our partnership with you to #BuildBackBetter, lift up diversity in the workplace and create millions of good-paying, sustainable jobs for all!

House Committee Chairs were joined by members of the House Democratic Leadership in commending President Biden for the boldness of his vision and his determination to pass legislation. Today’s meeting was marked by a determination to produce results – and soon.

Today, @POTUS met with the Chairs of the House Committees that will write the reconciliation bill. All agreed that we have an historic opportunity for transformational change #ForThePeople. The President expressed his appreciation for the Committees’ work to Build Back Better.

Once again, Capitol Police, FBI and other law enforcement dealt with a potential threat to the Capitol Hill community.    The immense gratitude of the Congress is with all law enforcement officers who today & all days sacrifice to keep the Capitol Complex & those within it safe.

Proud to join Dr. Susan Ehrlich, @IMAKglobal and @CoveredCA at San Francisco General Hospital yesterday to discuss Democrats’ efforts to lower health care costs #ForThePeople. Quality, affordable health care must be a right, not a privilege.
Join me live at the San Francisco General Hospital to discuss Democrats’ efforts to lower health care costs #ForThePeople.

With Congresswoman @RepTerriSewell and Judiciary Committee Chairman @RepJerryNadler’s leadership, Democrats are fighting back against an anti-democratic tide and protecting access to the ballot box for every American. Read my full statement here:

With the attack on the franchise escalating and states beginning the process of redistricting, we must act. When the House returns on August 23rd, Democrats plan to pass H.R. 4 – and we hope it can secure the bipartisan support this vital legislation deserves.

The House today is taking a momentous step to secure the sacred right to vote for generations to come. With the John R. Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act, @HouseDemocrats are fighting back against an anti-democratic tide & protecting access to the ballot box for every American.

As Democrats continue to advance our #BuildBackBetter agenda, we will fight to ensure that every child has enough healthy and nutritious food to eat so that they may reach their fullest potential. Read my full statement here:

Thanks to @POTUS, struggling families across the nation will soon see a permanent increase to their monthly SNAP benefits for the first time ever.   This action, which was directed by Congress in 2018, will help parents afford enough healthy food to feed their families.
Jim’s extraordinary life will always serve as a beacon of hope and promise for LGBTQ children across our country and around the world. Read my full statement here:

Paul and I are heartbroken at the loss of our friend. I was honored to officiate at the wedding of Jim and his dear husband Michael. May it be a comfort to his family that so many mourn their loss and pray for them at this sad time.

Jim made history as the first openly gay U.S. Ambassador, paving the way for a new generation of leaders and elevating the voices of LGBTQ voices in our foreign policy. He had the courage to be a pioneer & the patriotism to accept the challenge.

It is with the deepest sadness and the greatest appreciation for his unsurpassed contributions to our country and society that we mourn the passing of Ambassador Hormel. We will dearly miss him in San Francisco, in our nation and around the world.

Congress shares the President's concern for Afghans who have assisted U.S. efforts in country. Most of all, we join the President in acknowledging the sacrifices of our men and women in uniform and their families. Read my full statement here:

The U.S., the international community and the Afghan government must do everything we can to protect women and girls from inhumane treatment by the Taliban. As we strive to assist them, we must recognize that their voices are important and respect their culture.

The President is to be commended for the clarity of purpose of his statement on Afghanistan and his action. The Taliban must know the world is watching its actions. We are concerned about reports regarding the Taliban’s brutal treatment of all Afghans, especially women and girls.

The United States continues to stand with the people of Haiti during this sad time and mourn for the lives lost to this disaster.  The Congress applauds @POTUS’ actions to assist Haiti, and we call on the international community join us to marshal a robust global response.

The Congress joins all those who are praying for the people of Haiti in the wake of a devastating earthquake this morning. Our thoughts are with all families affected by this heartbreaking disaster, especially those who have lost or are still missing loved ones.

As we advance Democrats’ #BuildBackBetter Agenda, the House remains committed to realizing the totality of @POTUS' vision: more jobs, greater tax cuts & lower health costs for working families. My statement:
Every American deserves to retire with dignity and security. For 86 years, Social Security has stood as a pillar of economic security, offering peace of mind to millions of hard-working Americans.

Proud to join @RepMaxineWaters and American families at Ethel Bradley Early Education Center to discuss how @POTUS' #ChildTaxCredit is working #ForThePeople. Today, the next round of checks were sent to families.
Join @RepMaxineWaters, families and me live for a press conference on the Biden #ChildTaxCredit in Los Angeles.

The House will continue to investigate the former President’s opaque financial dealings & craft legislation to prevent presidential misconduct - including conflicts of interest that could undermine national security.

Today’s ruling in Trump v. Mazars is a victory for the rule of law, our Constitution & Democracy itself.   I am pleased the courts have, once again, reaffirmed the authority of Congress to conduct oversight & consider legislation #ForThePeople.
Join local San Francisco community leaders and me live for a press event highlighting the emergency rental assistance available to help protect renters and landlords.

The House will continue to work with the Senate to ensure that our priorities For The People are included in the final infrastructure and reconciliation packages, in a way that is resilient and will #BuildBackBetter. Read my full statement here:

Today is a day of progress, as the Senate has passed the bipartisan infrastructure package & paved the way for not only rebuilding but reimagining our infrastructure for the 21st Century. The leadership of @POTUS has seized this once-in-a-century opportunity to #BuildBackBetter.
The House continues to work closely with the Senate on Reconciliation. Democrats are committed to bold action that makes a difference #ForThePeople. Read my full statement here:

Today, the Senate Budget Committee has introduced a transformative budget resolution that will achieve the vision of @POTUS and @HouseDemocrats to #BuildBackBetter, by expanding opportunity, prosperity and justice For The People.

The @IPCC_CH shows the undeniable truth: the #ClimateCrisis has reached Code Red for humanity. Bold, immediate climate action is an essential part of @POTUS & Congressional Democrats’ #BuildBackBetter Agenda and will help prevent a catastrophic future for our children.
See what happened behind-the-scenes last week at the United States Capitol with my Medium post, ‘Madam Speaker.’

Paid leave is about parents, it’s about children — and it’s about time! Proud to join the #CareCantWait coalition to fight for #PaidLeaveForAll. With Democrats’ Build Back Better agenda, we’ll fight for this vital benefit & get parents earning & children learning.

The Biden Economy is working! Paychecks are growing at strongest rate in 15 yrs, poverty is set to be cut in half & the economy is growing at fastest pace in 40 yrs. Now, we will build on the momentum by investing in families: more jobs, cut taxes, lower costs. #BuildBackBetter

Honored to welcome the new Ambassador, Mariangela Zappia of Italy, to the U.S. Capitol this week to discuss the new position, continuing the strong bonds between the US & Italy, working together on COVID response and recovery, advancing security and addressing the climate crisis.
Read My Full Statement on the New Congressional Report Providing Robust Support for Strengthened Voting Rights Act:

As Americans today celebrate the 56th anniversary of the Voting Rights Act, which stood for decades as a vanguard of freedom, anti-democratic forces continue to wage an assault on the franchise. We must combat & prevent brazen voter suppression & secure the sacred right to vote.

Report from @HouseAdm_Dems proves what we already know: voters of color across the country are being silenced by partisan forces.  Congress has the ironclad Constitutional mandate to strengthen the Voting Rights Act with #HR4. The House will soon act to advance this legislation

Thanks to @POTUS, the pause on federal student loan payments is now extended through January 2022!   I’m pleased he took this necessary action, which will deliver vital relief to students & working families across the country as Democrats continue our work to #BuildBackBetter

Now, we must sustain this growth and ensure that all can share in its benefits.  Congressional Democrats and President Biden will continue to Build Back Better – with more jobs, cut taxes and lower costs for all.  Read my full statement here:

Today’s jobs report is decisive proof Democrats’ #BuildBackBetter economy is working.  Under @POTUS & the Democratic Majorities in Congress, millions of good-paying jobs have been created, paychecks are surging & the economy is growing at the fastest rate in nearly forty years.

Today, on the anniversary of the Voting Rights Act, which has secured the right to vote for so many, let us recommit ourselves to advancing the #ForThePeople Act and HR4, bills necessary to ensuring we have free and fair elections for generations to come.

The Texas State Democrats captured the country’s attention with their devotion to our most sacred democratic right: the vote.    Not only did their actions stop the TX GOP’s anti-voter bill, their advocacy has moved us closer to passing federal voting rights legislation.
Join me live for my weekly press conference!

Yesterday, I proudly joined @RepWexton & @EleanorNorton to sign legislation awarding the Congressional Gold Medal to the Capitol and Metro Police Forces who defended the Capitol & our Democracy on #January6th. This historic legislation honors their service and their sacrifice.
Richard Trumka’s life was a testament to the power of organizing and mobilizing for progress, and his leadership leaves a legacy of inspired advocacy for workers.  Read my full statement here:

Richard dedicated his life to the labor movement & the right to organize, and his leadership transcended a single movement, as he fought with principle and persistence to defend the dignity of every person.  His courage in speaking truth to power made a difference for millions.

The Congress & Country are shocked and heartbroken by the passing of an unsurpassed titan of labor: Richard Trumka.  Personally and officially, I am greatly saddened by his passing, which is a great loss for the men and women of labor, and indeed, for all hard-working Americans.

The GOP already voted to block funding for local police departments, but last week they fully turned their back on law enforcement - picking violent insurrectionists over the heroic officers who protected them on January 6th.
Join live for a bill enrollment ceremony for H.R. 3325, to award congressional gold medals to the United States Capitol Police and those who protected the U.S. Capitol on January 6, 2021.
Join Democratic Members of Congress, community leaders and me live with the Paid Leave For All bus tour! #CareCantWait
Wishing a very Happy 60th Birthday to President @BarackObama!

This brand new moratorium will provide time for the money allocated by Congress to flow, as it helps stop the spread of the virus. I am especially pleased about what this means to the children who have had uncertainty about their housing, their health and their education.

Today is a day of extraordinary relief. Thanks to the leadership of @POTUS the imminent fear of eviction and being put out on the street has been lifted for countless families. Help is Here! Democrats have worked tirelessly for this action, which is based on public health needs.

Dems stand ready to work with the Admin as they search for ways to extend the moratorium and as they urge states and localities to spend the $46.5 billion Congress allocated. Our sole focus must be keeping people housed and we must do so with the urgency this moment deserves.

I am pleased to salute @RepMaxineWaters for her leadership in proposing and fighting for the moratorium and the funding for tenants and landlords. I also salute @RepCori for her powerful action to keep people in their homes. All Democrats know that inaction is not an option.

The crisis of families being evicted is a challenge to the conscience of the country, and Democrats’ commitment to immediately helping renters and landlords is a priority that unites our Caucus. @HouseDemocrats have galvanized a national movement around the eviction emergency.

On behalf of the U.S. House of Representatives, I send condolences to the family, colleagues & loved ones of Officer DeFraytag. May it be a comfort to Officer DeFreytag’s loved ones that America knows of his heroism, and that so many mourn with and pray for them at this sad time.

As we grieve Officer DeFreytag’s passing, the Congress conveys our gratitude to every law enforcement hero who, like Officer DeFreytag, sacrificed to keep the Capitol and all within safe and who continue to serve our nation during this difficult time.

The Congressional community and Country are heartbroken by the death of Metropolitan Police Department Kyle DeFreytag, a patriot who protected the Capitol on January 6th. The loss of fallen officers who defended our democracy that day is devastating & each life lost is a tragedy.

The sentencing of humanitarian aid worker Abdulrahman al-Sadhan in April was a grave injustice, continuing Saudi Arabia’s assault on freedom of expression. Congress will closely monitor Abdulrahman’s appeal hearing tomorrow, as well as all human rights abuses by the regime.

Enough is enough: today, and every day, we urge our Republican colleagues to join us to enact commonsense, bipartisan gun violence solutions that will end the bloodshed and ensure a safer, brighter future for our children. Read my full statement here:

Drawing strength from survivors & loved ones across the nation, @HouseDemocrats will never relent in the fight to end the epidemic of gun violence & combat the evils of bigotry & hate. Too many families across the nation have been forced to endure the horrors of gun violence.

2 years ago, a brutal massacre against the Latino community in El Paso stole 23 beautiful souls, injured dozens more & shocked the nation. This hateful act left Americans horrified & heartbroken, & on this day, we pray for El Paso & all communities torn apart by of gun violence.

All Americans are indebted to him for his great valor and patriotism on January 6th & throughout his selfless service. May his life be an inspiration to all to protect our Country & Democracy. And may it be a comfort to his family that so many mourn their loss at this sad time.

On behalf of the House of Representatives, I send deepest condolences to the family and loved ones of Metropolitan Police Department Officer Gunther Hashida. Officer Hashida was a hero, who risked his life to save our Capitol, the Congressional community and our very Democracy.

Congratulations to San Franciscan @AMassialas, his teammate originally from SF @GerekMeinhardt and the entire Men’s Fencing Team for winning Bronze at the @Olympics #Tokyo2020! For these two fencing is a family affair! Let's support @TeamUSA as they compete on the world stage.

The virus is still a threat. The moratorium must be extended & the funds Congress allocated to assist renters & landlords must be spent. An extension of the moratorium is based on public health & delta. It will also give time to allow the money that Congress allocated to flow.

House leadership is calling on the Admin to immediately extend the moratorium. As the CDC doubles down on mask-wearing and vaccination efforts, science and reason demand that they must also extend the moratorium in light of the delta variant. Doing so is a moral imperative.

On Thursday, @POTUS asked Congress to pass an extension of the eviction moratorium. Sadly, it's clear the Senate is not able to do so & any legislation in the House, therefore, won't be sufficient to extend the moratorium. Action is needed & it must come from the Administration.
See what happened behind-the-scenes this week at the United States Capitol with my Medium post, ‘Madam Speaker.’
See a behind-the-scenes view of the first hearing of the Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack on the United States Capitol on ‘Madam Speaker.’

It is a moral imperative to keep people from being put out in the street which also contributes to the public health emergency.  The virus is still a threat, the moratorium must be extended and the funds Congress allocated to assist renters and landlords must be spent.
The CDC has the power to extend the eviction moratorium. As they double down on masks, why wouldn't they extend the moratorium in light of delta variant?
Strengthening the CDC and our public health infrastructure so that we are better prepared for future pandemics is a top priority for Democrats to help us #BuildBackBetter.

People are paying a seven year high for gas at the pump and natural gas for homes in America. @POTUS ' solution is to ask OPEC+ and Vladimir Putin to produce more energy for America. This is a total jackpot for Putin and it’s because of the Biden administration policies.

The policy priorities of the Biden admin are far out of step with those of the American people. While the president and almost half of his Cabinet are soaring off to Scotland, most Americans would like to see a plan to deal with soaring inflation and skyrocketing energy costs.

This draft plan will result in less American energy production, fewer jobs for energy workers, & more frivolous lawsuits from environmental activists. At a time when energy prices are skyrocketing, this is a punishing plan the American people can’t afford.

The Biden admin continues to hamstring American energy. Tracy Stone-Manning & @BLMNational want to build new regulatory road blocks for oil & gas leasing on America’s federal lands. She is taking even more valuable American energy off the table.

Thanks to Biden admin policies, we are using more oil from Vladimir Putin in Russia than we are from Alaska. Now @POTUS is off to Europe to waive the white flag of surrender of American energy dominance and wealth.
.@POTUS’ radical anti-American energy agenda is hurting our economy, and people in every state of the union are paying the price and feeling the pain today. #BidenEnergyCrisis

On Aug 19 @POTUS vowed he would get every American out of Afghanistan before withdrawing U.S. Forces by August 31. Yesterday, we learned there are over 400 Americans still in Afghanistan. The Biden Admin has lied & left hundreds of Americans & Afghan partners behind enemy lines.

While @POTUS is about to soar off to Scotland for a world climate conference, energy prices are soaring here at home. He’ll be overseas for Halloween, but people all across America will be suffering through the nightmare of high energy costs thanks to the #BidenEnergyCrisis.
Ironic.

Democrats are trying to figure out how to pay for their $3.5 trillion tax & spending bill. There are more pages in this bill than there are billionaires in the U.S. Everybody will end up paying for it through higher taxes, higher debt and the most punishing tax of all, inflation.

The American people have seen through President Biden's big lie. If the cost of the $3.5 trillion tax and spending spree is zero @POTUS, why are you having such a hard time getting people to vote for it?

UW Homecoming allows alumni, students and faculty to reunite and see friends. Bobbi and I enjoyed seeing many friends, including College of Ag Dean Barbara Rasco and Honors College Dean Peter Parolin at this weekend’s parade. #UWYO
Nancy Pelosi is insisting on dishing out hundreds of millions of dollars to her favorite park that’s run by her biggest donors. This isn’t building back better. It’s Pelosi’s pork park.

The people of Wyoming want nothing to do with @POTUS and the Democrats’ scary, big-brother proposal to give even more power to the IRS. @SenLummis and I joined @SenatorTimScott in a bill stopping this invasion into Americans’ privacy dead in its tracks.
.@POTUS could end his illegal ban oil and gas leasing on federal lands today. We have American energy right here. President Biden is blocking us from using it.

Bill Crapser has served as Wyoming State Forester since 2003. He provides critical expertise & is a valuable resource for the many issues we discussed today. Not only is Bill a great state forester, he’s also a crack shot. I’m pleased he could be part of today’s energy hearing.

Congratulations to Wyoming Teachers of the Year for 2021 and 2020, Alexis Barney and Dane Weaver. Students at Evansville Elementary and Ten Sleep School are fortunate to have such outstanding educators at their schools.

Parents always deserve a say in what their kids learn and how they learn it. But @POTUS's administration is treating concerned parents like criminals. It’s time for Democrats to stop taking orders from teachers' unions and start listening to parents and students.

We must hold China accountable. Questioned Pres. Biden’s nominee to be the next U.S. ambassador to China today on the threats the Chinese Communist Party poses to U.S national security and how we can hold the them accountable for their dangerous behavior.

We have the best energy resources in the world. We also have the best energy workers in the world. It’s time we let these good men & women do their jobs. It’s time for @POTUS & the Democrats to get out of the way of affordable American energy.

Joe Biden still doesn't understand the fundamental truth that we do much better as a nation if we are selling energy to our friends rather than if we have to buy it from our enemies. Every American is paying the price for Joe Biden's war on American energy.

Joe Biden wants to give the IRS more power to spy on Americans. The IRS has a track record of targeting specific groups that they don't like politically and Republicans are committed to stopping this very scary proposal dead in its tracks.

My wife Bobbi, a breast cancer survivor, dropped the puck at the Yellowstone @QuakeHockey game on Saturday in Cody. The “Fill the Rink with Pink” game is a wonderful community tradition that honors Breast Cancer Awareness Month and supports cancer survivors.
Today we lost a trailblazer, a soldier’s soldier, and a leader. General Colin Powell was a great public servant. My thoughts and prayers are with his family.

The historic and colorful Niobrara County Courthouse celebrated 101 years in Lusk today. It was a pleasure to be there to honor this historic building and the community it serves. Thank you to everyone involved in keeping Niobrara County strong for the next century.

Thank you and congratulations to Alexis Barney, @WYOEducation's 2021 Teacher of the Year, for inviting me to visit Evansville Elementary today. Evansville’s students get their high quality education from the dedicated teachers and staff.

The Powell Middle School Cubs celebrated their designation as a 2021 Blue Ribbon School this week. It was a pleasure to congratulate the students and staff in person and have a great discussion with the bright student body.

Congratulations to Tongue River Elementary for their recognition as a 2021 Blue Ribbon School. These students have impressive insight into our government and will make excellent leaders one day. Go Eagles! #Wyoming
Small businesses are a staple to our communities all around Wyoming. Thank you to June and Melissa at Innominate Coffeehouse and Bakery for the great food and warm welcome to Ranchester.
Inflation is at a 13 year high. Prices keep rising faster than wages. @POTUS has given families in Wyoming a pay cut. Now Democrats want to add another $3.5 trillion to the credit card? Madness.
While Americans are paying sky high prices at the pump, the Biden Administration has its head in the sand. Begging OPEC and Russia to produce more isn’t an energy policy, its surrender.
Americans are paying more for gas at the pump than they have over the last seven years. America used to be energy dominant. Now we are energy dependent—and it’s all because of Joe Biden’s policies.

A wonderful groundbreaking for the Casper Wyoming Temple of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints. Thank you Elder S. Gifford Nielsen and President Steve Higginson for inviting me to be a part of your ceremony.

Americans are struggling with exploding inflation & spiking gas prices. Instead of releasing oil from our nation’s strategic reserve and begging OPEC and Russia for more oil, @POTUS should abandon his irresponsible attempts to end oil and gas leasing on federal lands and waters.
We don't need the IRS looking over our shoulder, prying into our life and our activities. If Democrats go forward with this Big Brother plan, people all across this country will not stand for it.

Democrats need to learn their lesson before it is too late. They need to stop raising taxes, cutting into Americans' paychecks, and stop pouring more fuel on the inflation fire that is raging across the country.

Flip-flops by the Biden administration on COVID have led to a great sense of confusion. If we want to see the remaining 70 million eligible Americans vaccinated against this disease, the president needs to change minds, not issue mandates. @FoxNews
Gas prices are the highest they’ve been in seven years. Now, @POTUS & the Democrats want to accelerate inflation by spending trillions more AND crush American production of oil and gas. #Bidenflation

Whether it’s in his classroom in Worland or the annual trip to DC, I always look forward to visiting with Worland High School teacher Randy Durr’s history students every year. This year was no exception.  Glad @SenLummis is able to join in on this wonderful tradition.

People are feeling the pain of this administration and inflation. Everybody is paying higher prices today for gas and groceries compared to the day Joe Biden came into office. Inflation will only get worse if the Democrats pass this reckless tax and spending bill.

Republicans are not going to allow Joe Biden to give the IRS more power. I want to be able to tell cowboys in Wyoming that if they make a payment on their pickup truck or buy a saddle for their horse, they're not going to have an IRS agent along for the ride.

People in Wyoming have a right to be alarmed. President Biden and Democrats want to supersize the IRS and let the government spy on the transactions of law-abiding citizens. We will continue fighting to stop this alarming power-grab dead in its tracks.
Joe Biden ran as a centrist and as competent. We are seeing that he is neither. Joe Biden has now walked the plank for the socialist Bernie Sanders’ budget. He is man overboard and he can’t swim.

And the content of this bill matters almost as much, if not more, than the cost. Democrats want to give a whole new army of IRS agents the power to rifle through your checking account. This is an invasion of privacy.

People are feeling the bite of inflation right now when they buy groceries, buy gas, all of those things. If the Democrats’ massive spending and tax bill passes, that inflation is going to get much worse.
Now we're at a point where the president is weak and Bernie Sanders and the far-left Democrats are driving the bus and Joe Biden is just along for the ride.

Introduced legislation this week that recognizes sportsmen & women’s efforts in conserving native species in our national parks & will allow for the donation of hide & horns to volunteers who help protect our native bighorn sheep.

Senate Democrats just voted to confirm Tracy Stone-Manning to lead @BLMNational. She colluded with eco-terrorists. She stone-walled a criminal investigation for years. She lied to the Senate. And she still holds radically dangerous views.

At a time when America faces mounting crises, Senate Democrats are determined to confirm a nominee who collaborated with eco-terrorists, lied to the US Senate, and continues to hold very dangerous views.

Democrats are planning a dangerous Big Brother initiative to squeeze every last penny out of Americans. They’ll bring the IRS right into your bank account. @SenLummis and I will continue fighting to stop this IRS power grab dead in its tracks.

#ICYMI: Former forest service investigator wrote on @FoxNews about how Tracy Stone-Manning colluded with eco-terrorists, can’t be trusted, and broke the law. She should never be the director of @BLMNational.

When you go through this 2500 page bill what you find is a whole army of IRS agents. They want to be able to go through any check written for over $600 to squeeze everything they can out of the American taxpayers. This is Big Brother government with Joe Biden as Big Brother.

Tracy Stone-Manning’s nomination to lead @BLMNational has been publically opposed by former BLM leadership, outdoor organizations, sportsmen’s groups, pro-life organizations, loggers, the Western States Sherriff’s Association, & 8 counties in Utah. She should never be confirmed.
Americans want safer communities, secure borders, higher wages and lower costs. Under the Biden administration we are getting the exact opposite. #DemsInDisarray

With mounting Democrat-caused crises in our country, Senate Democrats’ top priority is to confirm an eco-terrorist collaborator who lied to the Senate. Tracy Stone-Manning should never be the director of @BLMNational. Senate Republicans are united against this dangerous nominee.
The true expense may reach $5.5 trillion over a decade
column2: and much more beyond that. The larger cost will be conditioning the American middle class to rely on government for ever more of life’s needs." "

column1: Americans already feel the bite of inflation. Their paychecks are eaten away every time they go to the grocery store or the gas station. Republicans are committed to defeating this massive spending bill because of the permanent damage it will do to our economy and nation.
Guarantee @POTUS, @SpeakerPelosi, @SenSchumer, and even @AOC haven't read their $3.5 trillion reckless bill.
Wrote in the @WashTimes on how irresponsible Democrats are pushing to follow California’s failed energy model. The failures of California’s approach are a warning.

The “First Women” plaque, dedicated by the Jacques Laramie Daughters of the American Revolution, honors three Albany County women who played a critical role in shaping women’s history. The WY Women’s History House shares the stories of remarkable women from the Equality State.

Wyoming lost one of its most talented broadcasters, KODI’s Darian Dudrick. Darian was the voice of Cody. It will be hard to imagine not hearing him on Daybreak, Speak Your Piece or broadcasting from the top of the Irma on the 4th. He will be sorely missed.

Wyoming has incredible forests and rangelands that are critical to our economy & attract visitors from around the world. I introduced bipartisan legislation with Energy Committee Chairman @Sen_JoeManchin to help protect and manage these natural wonders.
Biden’s weakness on Putin’s pipeline will have serious consequences. For our security and for the security of our allies, we must stop Nord Stream 2.
John Kerry has been a disaster for a long time for our country. There are ways that we can certainly protect the environment without hurting the economy — he apparently doesn’t believe that.

When you turn on the TV in America you see the incompetency of the Biden admin at the border, in Afghanistan, and crime in cities. President Biden’s poll numbers are in free fall and he is desperately trying to get something passed. Massive spending will only hurt the economy.
Republicans won't rubber-stamp Democrats' reckless spending. If Democrats want to go it alone on spending, then they can go it alone on raising the debt ceiling.

Once again, Democrats walked away from bipartisan police reform negotiations. @SenatorTimScott has led the way with meaningful reforms that would increase transparency and make communities across America safer. It’s time for Democrats to put politics aside and join us.

The blowout spending that the Democrats are proposing doesn't have a single Republican vote. They are moving forward with an outrageous bill based on Bernie Sanders’, socialist budget, and Republicans will not be a rubber stamp for this.

The Democrats’ reckless tax and spending spree will take from working families and give kickbacks to their most powerful friends. They’re proposing more than $2 trillion in new taxes and want to put the IRS on steroids. Democrats are putting us on a bullet train to bankruptcy.

The American people know what they want: safe communities, secure border, higher wages, and lower prices. The incompetence of this administration over the last eight months cannot be allowed to continue. The American people deserve better.

Democrats want to pay for all of this by raising taxes on your income, on your retirement savings, and even on your death. Everyone will end up paying more. If the Democrats want to go it alone on the spending, they're going to have to go it alone on raising the debt ceiling.

Wyoming SkillsUSA is doing important work to help make sure America has a skilled workforce. Today, I met with students from Buffalo, Cheyenne, & Guernsey to discuss the importance of career & technical education in Wyoming and the benefits of participating in @SkillsUSA.

Great to see War Memorial Stadium packed with excited Pokes fans today. And big thanks to @WYOEducation for inviting me to join them on the field today to recognize the hard work of Wyoming’s outstanding teachers. #GoWyo #OneWyoming

The @WyDSA @NDSSBuddyWalk brings the community together every year to celebrate people living with Down Syndrome in Wyoming and the incredible support professionals who assist them. It was a pleasure to reconnect with so many old friends at today’s 21st annual walk in Laramie.

The Boy Scouts Greater Wyoming - Longs Peak Council honored Peter and Jack Wold at their Strength of America Banquet in Casper. Their dedication to scouting will ensure the youth of Wyoming will have great character and build a strong America.

The Biden administration’s answer for everything is to double the size of government. @BLMNational doesn’t need two headquarters. The single headquarters of @BLMNational belongs in the West, closer to the resources it manages & the people it serves.

On September 17, 1787 our founding fathers signed the U.S. Constitution, one of the most powerful documents in American history. On #ConstitutionDay, we celebrate how America is governed by “we the people”.
The American people deserve accountably. General Milley is going to have to testify under oath about what happened because these allegations are very serious.

Today’s actions by @USFWS are just more of the endless political antics from Washington bureaucrats & extreme environmentalists who have no interest in doing what’s right for Wyoming. Wyoming, not Washington, is in the best position to manage the wolf.

Democrats want to give $12,500 to couples making up to $800,000 per year so they can buy luxury electric vehicles. What’s next? Subsidies for electric yachts? No wonder they want to spend $3.5 trillion. #RecklessTaxandSpendingSpree
Wrote in @FoxNews today on how President Biden and the Democrats are the party of chaos. America has veered from calamity to calamity since @POTUS and the Democrats came to power.

The Biden administration’s withdrawal from Afghanistan was an epic failure. America has paid a very high price for the decisions made by this administration that focused more on the calendar on the wall than on the conditions on the ground.

President Biden wants to wash his hands of Afghanistan and get it behind him in spite of how many people have been left behind to be captured, tortured and killed. I have more faith in the American people than I certainly do in this disgraced and incompetent president.

At today’s Senate Foreign Relations hearing on the disastrous withdrawal from Afghanistan, we heard nothing but excuses from Secretary of State Blinken. We heard testimony today that there are still more than 100 Americans trapped in Afghanistan who want to get out.

President Biden has described the evacuation from Afghanistan as an ‘extraordinary success’. This has to be the lie of the 21st century. It is dishonest, and if he believes it, it is delusional. Our enemies are emboldened and our allies are enraged.
What Rylee McCollum loved was protecting others. What Rylee McCollum loved was service. What Rylee McCollum loved was America… Rylee McCollum is an American hero.

The 2020 Cowboy Hall of fame inductees, and their families, represent the best of Wyoming’s values: grit, resilience, and determination. Bobbi and I enjoyed the opportunity to recognize these hard-working stewards of our land and cowboy culture.

Wyoming had an impressive turnout in Cheyenne to commemorate the 20th anniversary of the tragic attacks on September 11, 2001. It was an honor to recognize the service & sacrifice of all first responders, military service members, & veterans in attendance. We will #NeverForget

We will never forget the nearly 3,000 people who lost their lives 20 years ago today on September 11, 2001. We also pay tribute to our brave first responders, firefighters, police, and service men and women, who put their lives on the line.
20 years ago: America attacked. 20 years later: America abandoned.

Grateful to the WY Hospital Association for all they do to help Wyoming’s health care workers serving on the frontlines. At their convention in Casper, we talked about how HHS needs to get the funding Congress provided into the hands of our hospitals & health care providers ASAP.

Glad the Biden admin finally realized David Chipman is the WRONG person to lead ATF. Chipman is an anti-gun extremist who would have been the most radically anti-gun director in ATF history. @POTUS needs to nominate someone who has respect for the #SecondAmendment.

Talked to @VarneyCo about how Biden’s policies are keeping Americans from getting back to work and causing energy prices to skyrocket. We also discussed how getting vaccinated is the best way for Americans to protect themselves and their families from the Delta variant.

A fantastic Aircraft Rescue Fire Fighter demonstration kicked off Casper/Natrona County International Airport’s new training facility. These courageous first responders do an incredible job and are a great resource for the region.

The Boys & Girls Club of Central WY Annual Awards Breakfast brings together the leaders our community relies upon. A special thanks to this year’s honorees, Rocky and Lisa Eades. Their nonprofit, Jason’s Friends, supports WY families battling childhood cancer.

The Powder River Chapter of @RMEF recently gathered to raise funds to conserve natural habitat, advocate for public land access & honor our hunting heritage. Thanks to Shawn Kelley & Kaylee Hagen for inviting me to join them in recognizing veterans & celebrating conservation.
.@POTUS Biden bears full responsibility for the deadly consequences of his disastrous Afghanistan withdrawal. Thank you, @seanhannity, for continuing to draw attention to this.

Their reckless legislation will also make it nearly impossible to mine on federal lands at a time when America is already heavily dependent on China for minerals used in critical defense, telecommunications, and energy technologies.

The Dems’ reckless tax & spending spree is a gift to our nation’s adversaries. Dems are ramming through a bill that will effectively end new oil & gas leasing on federal lands & waters at a time when gasoline prices are rising & @POTUS is begging OPEC & Russia to pump more oil.

The Wyoming Stock Growers Land Trust recently celebrated their 20th anniversary. In that time, the organization has preserved more than 285,000 acres in WY. Congrats to Scott & April Sims and Ogden & Zannie Driskill for winning the 2020 & 2021 Bucholz Stewardship Award.

The entire Afghanistan withdrawal has been a disaster. The only thing @POTUS is right about is that he bears full responsibility for it. The United States is less safe today due to President Biden’s actions and complete lack of leadership.
We lost 13 brave Americans in Afghanistan last week. There are still American citizens stranded behind enemy lines. And President Biden considers this operation an “extraordinary success”?
Rylee McCollum's family went on @FoxAndFriends this morning to honor his memory and talk about how Rylee knew he wanted to be a Marine since he could walk.
The Biden Admin’s withdrawal of troops in Afghanistan has been handled terribly no matter how you stand on the issue.
Joined @LarryKudlow on @FoxBusiness to pay tribute to Wyoming’s own Rylee McCollum, a 20-year-old U.S. Marine who gave his life to protect Americans & Afghans.

Wyoming’s own Rylee McCollum made the ultimate sacrifice protecting Americans and civilians in Afghanistan. Bobbi and I join everyone in Wyoming in mourning this devastating loss. Rylee was a true American hero. Rylee’s sacrifice will never be forgotten.

The Petroleum Association of Wyoming represents more than 19,000 oil and gas jobs across our state. At their annual meeting today in Cheyenne, we had a good discussion about the future of Wyoming energy, industry innovation and our joint focus on energy independence.

We have a duty to our men and women in uniform, and an obligation to all Americans in Afghanistan. President Biden is failing at a crucial moment.  The terrorists must hear this message now, loud and clear: There is no timeline on protecting an American life.
Our military leadership should be immediately empowered to secure the situation on the ground and to complete their mission, without regard to deadlines imposed by the Taliban.
The evacuation of those who were injured, and all the Americans and our Afghan allies who remain in harm’s way, must be our top priority. The administration must bring them home safely.
The people of Wyoming join me in praying for the safety of our forces, and American civilians, currently in Afghanistan.

Today we heard tragic reports of devastating terrorist bombings in Kabul, Afghanistan. American families are receiving the heartbreaking news that their loved ones have been killed serving our country. Bobbi and I send them our deepest condolences.
Very troubling news coming out of Afghanistan. Keep our American troops, citizens, and Afghan allies in your prayers as we learn more.

The Wyoming Association of Rural Water Systems assist the 778 public water systems across the state. Their important work helps shape national water infrastructure policy. I always appreciate the opportunity to meet with them.

While catastrophe unfolds in Afghanistan, @POTUS just doubles down on the Dems' inflation super-spreader American Rescue Plan" with a massive spending spree. Get your priorities straight! The country is demanding a "Rescue Americans Plan" in Afghanistan. The clock is ticking."

President Biden's disastrous withdrawal from Afghanistan has put the lives of American soldiers, citizens, and our allies in danger. Right now, his job is to get every last American home safely. We don’t take deadlines from the Taliban. @POTUS should remember that.
Read my letter with Sens. @lisamurkowski, @SteveDaines, @SenJohnHoeven, @SenHydeSmith, and @SenatorLankford here⬇️

.@POTUS continues to favor foreign oil over American oil. His request to #OPEC to increase oil production is a one-two punch with the admin's punishing oil & gas policies here at home. This weakens our recovering economy & threatens our energy security. He must change course now.

Thanks to the Trump admin & #OperationWarpSpeed, the @FDA approved the COVID-19 vaccine in record time. If you’re eligible, I encourage you & your family to get vaccinated at one of the many sites across Wyoming:
Douglas hosted the 109th Wyoming State Fair Parade this weekend. Bobbi and I always look forward to celebrating the Cowboy State at this iconic event every summer.

Big thanks to the Green River Chamber of Commerce for hosting the 20th Annual Cajun Shrimp Boil and River Festival. I never miss this one-of-a-kind event celebrating John Wesley Powell’s expedition which embarked from this very spot on the Green River in 1869.

Joined @SenRubioPress and 23 other senators in sending a letter to @SecDef to demand a full account of all U.S. military equipment left behind in Afghanistan. We cannot run the risk our equipment and assets falling into the hands of the Taliban.

Tonight, the Wyoming Ag Hall of Fame added two new outstanding inductees, Keith and Linda Hamilton and Dr. Jim Logan. It’s an honor to recognize these vital members of Wyoming’s Ag industry during the 2021 WY State Fair.

#OTD 101 years ago, the US ratified the #19thAmendment to give women the right to vote. The #EqualityState helped lead the charge decades earlier, being the first in the world to ensure women had this important right. WY & USA are thankful for our extraordinary female leaders.

President Biden is in deep denial of the consequences of the chaos and destruction that were caused specifically by his actions in Afghanistan. He has lost amazing credibility as a result of this weekend, not just at home, but also around the world.

Afghanistan is Joe Biden’s Vietnam but worse. He is showing the world his incompetence and ineptness. If you make decisions based on the calendar on the wall versus the conditions on the ground, you are doomed to disaster and that's what Joe Biden has done for America today.

The Biden administration’s catastrophic miscalculation will cost the lives of innocent Afghan civilians and is a slap in the face to America’s men and women who served and sacrificed so much in the war.

The fall of Afghanistan is a dangerous failure of leadership that jeopardizes our national security. It didn’t have to be this way. Biden’s botched, hasty withdrawal paved the way for the Taliban to take over. Afghanistan is now a haven for terrorists.

The annual Dubois Volunteer Fire Department Buffalo BBQ always brings friends and neighbors together with excellent food. Bobbi joins me in thanking the volunteer firefighters in Fremont County, and around the state, who routinely risk their lives to protect people and property.

The Cheyenne Pink Ribbon Run returns with beautiful weather and a great turnout. @WYBreastCancer supports early detection & community services in all 23 counties. This year, WBCI invested over $500k, providing valuable resources to those fighting the disease & their loved ones.

Great @WSJOpinion question for @POTUS: “Someone should ask Mr. Biden, on his next stop for ice cream, why the President thinks oil produced by foreign dictators in Russia, Iran or Saudi Arabia is more desirable than oil drilled by American entrepreneurs.”

The Democrats’ tax-and-spending spree is a freight train to socialism. It will raise taxes on middle class families, your savings, your investments, & your retirement. It’s wrong for Wyoming, & I’ll keep fighting to stop it.
If it was a sham vote, why did you vote for it?
Instead of raising the costs of energy, we should be working to lower the cost of alternative technologies and fuels through innovation, not taxation and regulation. #GreenNewDisaster

Offered an amendment to the budget resolution to spare the country from the so-called ‘Green New Deal.’ The #GreenNewDeal is a socialist scheme that would destroy jobs. It will reduce the quality of life for the American people.
The #GreenNewDeal would cost our nation up to $93 trillion over the next decade and put the government in control of the economy.

It would cost our nation up to $93 trillion over the next decade & put the govt in control of the economy. It’s socialism masked as environmental policy. My amendment slams the brakes on the Dems’ attempt to subject the American people to the #GreenNewDeal

The #GreenNewDeal isn’t about protecting the environment. It’s about giving the government more & more control of our lives. Democrats want to use their reckless tax & spending spree to impose this green new disaster on every American.

Now Nancy Pelosi has tied this bill to her $3.5 trillion tax and spending spree. We could have all agreed on physical infrastructure. Democrats have made this into political infrastructure. Full statement on my vote here:

The bill also includes left-wing policies that will hurt Wyoming. These regulations will push us into to the California model of electricity, with the highest utility bills in the country and rolling blackouts. That’s dangerous.

I’ve insisted that an infrastructure bill be fully paid for. This bill misses that mark. The level of new spending Democrats insisted on will add more than $250 billion to the debt burden on our children and grandchildren.
Welcome to the Biden administration’s energy policy: Block U.S. oil & gas production so we have to buy it from our adversaries. #CantMakeItUp

My wife Bobbi, a breast cancer survivor, emceed @WYBreastCancer’s Casper Pink Ribbon Run this morning. This year’s honorary survivors are Marilyn and her daughter Brenda from Gillette. Thank you to all who participated, volunteered or supported such a worthy cause. #PRR4WBC

Today, we celebrated the life and legacy of Senator Mike Enzi. As I wrote in his official Senate Condolence Book, Mike was my colleague, my mentor and my friend. He was my trail boss and I loved riding shotgun for him. May he rest in peace.

The American taxpayers are already giving billions of dollars to electric car manufacturers and owners. Electric car buyers don’t need more taxpayer money, they have plenty. This is a Democrat giveaway to the rich and certainly a case where more taxpayer dollars aren't necessary.

Welcomed #UWYO President Seidel to the Senate Energy and Natural Resources Committee today where he testified on ways to improve @doescience. We were lucky to have a university president with such relevant experience for this important discussion today.

It is time for the American people to stand up and speak out and say we’ve had enough. Everyone one way or another is going to pay for the Democrats’ tax and spending bill. Inflation is already eating away at people’s pay checks. Enough is enough.

In @WSJ, Sen. Sanders brags about how Democrats want to use their $3.5 T tax and spending spree to kill American energy jobs and take over the transportation sector, electric grid, construction, and farming. This is the Green New Disaster on steroids.

Nancy Pelosi’s spending bill is going to raise taxes on family farms, ranches, small businesses, and eliminate 80,000 jobs over 10 years. Families across the nation are struggling to make ends meet. We must stop this freight train to socialism.
Our legislation ensures the Chinese Communist Party can no longer take advantage of low-cost loans subsidized by U.S. taxpayers at multilateral development banks.

17 GOP senators joined me in introducing legislation that ends lending to China from multilateral development banks. China is the second largest economy & the largest single creditor in the world. They should not still be receiving loans from these banks.

David Chipman is an anti-gun extremist who would politicize one of the world's greatest law enforcement agencies, the ATF. The more than a hundred million legal gun owners in America deserve a leader with integrity and respect for the Second Amendment.

People are concerned, angry, and anxious. If the White House flip-flopped on wearing masks, are they going to flip flop on shutdowns? Lockdowns? Closing schools? The White House and the CDC have lost all credibility.
Finally a flip flop we can agree on. @JoeBiden backed off on reversing Trump’s public health order at the border after I and 25 other GOP senators demanded he keep #Title42 in place.

The CDC should be sued and found guilty of medical malpractice. Their flip flop in telling people they still have to wear masks even if vaccinated will not encourage people to get the vaccine.  The best thing you can do to protect you and your family is to get vaccinated.

This reckless tax and spending bill will cost much more than the Democrats are admitting to at a time when we can't afford it. You cannot fund something this expensive without everybody in America getting hit.
Wrote in @DCExaminer about how when the Democrats’ answer to every problem is a far-left policy fueled by enormous taxes and spending, you won’t find a single Republican in support.

It’s #NationalInternDay and I’m so grateful for the wonderful group of students who interned in my Washington, D.C. office this summer. For any Wyoming students interested in interning in my DC office or one of my state offices, you can learn more here:

If Democrats pass this reckless spending bill Americans will pay more. $5.5T is larger than the economy of Japan - the 3rd largest economy in the world. Prices are going up because Democrats have spent too much already & we will all suffer the consequences of their actions.

Democrats insisted on a level of new spending that we can’t afford. They tied the infrastructure bill explicitly to the multi-trillion dollar tax and spending spree they intend to ram through Congress. My full statement on the bill here:

The solution to ending energy poverty does not lie in limiting options. Introduced the POWER UP Act today to prohibit the DFC from enforcing restrictions on projects that are powered by traditional energy resources.

The best way to help lift people in the developing world out of poverty is to give them access to affordable and reliable energy. The U.S. Int’l Development Finance Corporation is undermining these efforts by restricting financing for critical coal, oil and gas-powered projects.

$4T on top of the $6T already spent on covid relief is an astonishingly high amount of money that our country can't afford. The Democrats' reckless tax and spending spree is taking us back to the era of Jimmy Carter and the misery index with high inflation hitting all of America.

We cannot use our U.S. economy as a crash course dummy for the plans the Democrats have for their reckless tax and spending bill. This would be the largest spending bill of all time that will only add our debt, inflation, and continue to raise our taxes.

How can the men and women of @BLMNational– people who have devoted their lives to this agency – how can they respect @POTUS’ nominee, Tracy Stone-Manning, when they know she threatened their colleagues at the @forestservice?

.@SpeakerPelosi has basically said that there will not be a penny for roads, bridges, ports, or airports, unless, and until the Senate passes an increase in taxes and spending on the American people.  What she is proposing is bad for the economy and the country.

The misleading and false statements Tracy Stone-Manning has made to the Senate don’t align with the facts. Lying to the United States Senate has consequences. In this case, her actions and her lies should cost her this nomination to lead @BLMNational.

Today we honor the incredible life of former U.S. Senator Mike Enzi. Wyoming will always be extremely grateful for his decades of faithful, tireless service. May God bless the memory of Mike Enzi and comfort his family during this trying time.
At approximately 11 am ET, I’ll pay tribute to Senator Mike Enzi on the Senate Floor. You can watch it LIVE here:

It was an incredible honor and a great privilege for my wife Bobbi and me to serve the people of Wyoming alongside Mike and his wife Diana. Mike was a mentor to me, a dear friend, and I will miss him tremendously.

Mike was a problem solver through & through. More than 100 Enzi bills were signed into law by four U.S. presidents. He was the trusted trail boss of Wyoming’s congressional delegation. In his four terms in the Senate, he never wavered in his commitment to God, family or Wyoming.
